Patient query: Hello doctor,I had mumps five months ago and after that, I started to have an infection in my left testes. It was swollen and now it has shrunk to almost half the size of the other one. As I am sexually active, I feel a pain in each of the vas deferens after sex. If I do not have sex for days, they become sensitive. I was treated with Ceftum 500 mg, the first time I had an infection. Now my question is, is there any chance that the infection is still in my body? And, do I need to get examined for it? For the time being, please suggest some precautionary antibiotics for my relief.
Doctor response: 1) There is no need to worry about reinfection as the infection caused by Mumps virus does not persist in the body and is completely cleared up by the immune system.2) The swelling at your scrotum is due to inflammation of epididymis or vas deferens which is a result of mumps infection.3) There is no need to take antibiotics for this problem. You can take anti-inflammatory medicines like Ibuprofen for symptomatic relief.4) Doing cool compresses over the scrotal area will help in reducing the inflammation and pain.

Patient query: Hello doctor,I am trying to conceive but my husband and I did cocaine a week ago. How long should my husband and I wait to safely continue to try to get pregnant? How long until it is out of our system? How long does cocaine stay in sperm? Thanks in advance.
Doctor response: 1) Cocaine use can affect fertility by causing male infertility due to decreased sperm motility and morphology as well as increased abnormal semen parameters (especially pH). However, there is insufficient evidence to suggest that cocaine causes significant changes in female fertility.2) It is not clear how long cocaine remains in semen or blood after use. Therefore, it is difficult to say exactly when it will be completely gone from your husbands body.3) There is no data regarding the amount of time that couples need to abstain from sexual activity before attempting conception.4) In conclusion, if you want to become pregnant, then you should avoid coke for at least three months before trying to conceive. Hope this helps

Patient query: Hello doctor,I am currently on the Yaz contraceptive pill. I skipped my sugar pills for around four months and had a breakthrough period this month. I had my period last week, but I still have some residual brown discharge for about a week now. Additionally, I had sex a few days ago and bled during it. Nothing hurts or is sore, I just want to know how long I am going to have the brown discharge and if I should be worried or if I should do anything about it?
Doctor response: 1) The brown discharge is due to the hormonal imbalance in your body after missing the sugar pills. It will gradually settle down.2) There is no need to worry as there is nothing serious happening with you. Just wait for the brown discharge to subside.3) You can take a course of antibiotic like Doxycycline 100 mg twice daily for 5 days if the problem persists.

Patient query: Hello doctor,My son aged 13 years has got his left eye -11 and right with -8. I am now very worried what good precautions should I take with him. Can you suggest me what should I do?
Doctor response: Hi, welcome to Chat Doctor forum. I understand your concern about your sons eyes. The best thing for you to do is to get an appointment with an ophthalmologist who can examine your sons eyes more thoroughly and determine if there are any treatable conditions that could be causing the vision loss in his eyes. There are some conditions that can cause vision loss at younger ages and it would not be wise to wait too long before getting him examined by a specialist. You may also want to have him checked out by a pediatrician or general practitioner as well to rule out other health related issues that could be contributing to his vision problems. Hope this helps. Good luck.

Patient query: Hello doctor,I just got one side of my wisdom teeth removed both upper and lower six days ago, and I have another one scheduled after two days for the left side. The upper is 100 % fine, which they pulled. The lower they pulled the tooth without removing the root because it was too close to the nerve. I do have some stitching in this area currently on the lower cheek. Noticed a hard lump about 1 inch between my lower jawline and cheek area. Is this normal because of swelling or something else. Currently taking Amoxicillin 500 mg and Ibuprofen 600 mg. Please let me know what this hard lump is, also generally on the lower side where this lump is, remains sore.
Doctor response: Hi, Thanks for your query. It appears that you are having post-operative complication like hematoma formation at the site of extraction socket. This can be due to trauma during surgical procedure or due to poor blood supply. You need to take an antibiotic like amoxicillin along with anti-inflammatory painkiller like ibuprofen. I suggest you to consult your dentist again and get evaluated. Hope this helps. Regards.

Patient query: Hello doctor,I had deep unprotected sex for three minutes with a broken condom with a sex worker who looks younger and healthy and aged between 18. So there is no need to worry but I cannot believe her and started studying about HIV and its symptoms and I have a feeling of infection because I got red dots in my finger pits and cold and throat infection.I want to know what are the red dots on my finger which I got? I got it tested many times in those three months and got a negative result. I am worrying abt six months test.
Doctor response: Hi, welcome to Chat Doctor forum. As your sex partner is telling that she do not have any sexually transmitted disease then you don't have to worry much. But still if you feel that you are having some symptoms like fever, body ache, sore throat etc. Then go for ELISA test as soon as possible. The red dots on finger tips may be due to fungal infection or some other skin problem. I hope this information helps you. Thanks.

Patient query: Hello doctor,I need advice after my second CT chest result. Six months back, I went for a CT scan because I have got chest pain which suddenly comes and goes and I wanted to go for a check-up. The CT showed a right-sided nodule measuring 3 mm and was advised to RPT interval scan in six months. I have done the second CT, the previous nodule is still there and they found another one.In the LLL, a 4 mm nodule is representative of an intrapulmonary lymph node. No suspicious lung lesion. Tiny 3 mm RLL nodule noted. No enlarged lymph nodes. Mild thymic hyperplasia. The partly visualized upper abdominal viscera appear unremarkable. No aggressive bony lesion. They said I do not need to do anything which is strange because there are two nodes now and the second one was not there six months ago. Do I need some kind of medicine therapy to clear my lung from this node or do I need to check if it is growing or not after one year?
Doctor response: 1) The nodules are probably benign and unlikely to grow.2) There is no reason to worry about them at present.3) You may be monitored with CT scans every 6 months to see if they change in size or number.4) If they do change, then biopsy of these nodules can be done to determine whether they are cancerous or not.5) At present, you should just continue to follow up with CT scans every 6 months.

Patient query: Hi doctor,I had sex for the first time. After that, I did not get my periods yet. I went to a gynecologist. She had taken my blood sample and it was negative. But, still I have not gotten my periods and it has been a week ahead. What could be the reason for my late periods?
Doctor response: 1. The delay in periods is usually due to stress, anxiety or hormonal imbalance.2. The most common cause of delayed periods is pregnancy.3. So you need to do urine pregnancy test followed by serum beta-ChatDoctor levels.4. You can also go for USG scan to rule out other causes like ovarian cyst, POD etc.5. In case of any doubt you can consult your gynecologist again.

Patient query: Hello doctor,My friend aged 30 had two drops of phenol mistaking for milk. He vomited and had lot of salt water. Please advice for any side effect.
Doctor response: 1. The side effects of phenol include irritation to the eyes, skin rashes, increased heart rate, respiratory depression, nausea, dizziness, headache, sweating, tremors, seizures, coma, and even death.2. Since your friend has already taken it, he should be fine. There is no need to worry about any long-term damage.3. However, if he develops symptoms such as rapid breathing, low blood pressure, chest pain or discomfort, confusion, extreme sleepiness, irregular heartbeats, severe headaches, or vomiting, then he needs immediate medical attention. Hope I have answered your query. Let me know if I can assist you further.

If I move, roll over, or get up, I can make it stop. It does not hurt and is very fast. What does this sound like?

The symptoms that you have mentioned in your query suggest that you might be having some form of brain problem which could be due to many reasons like-anxiety disorder, depression, stress related problems etc. So better to consult a psychiatrist for diagnosis and treatment. Hope this will help you. Wishing you good health. Take care.

Patient query: Hi doctor,My last USG report showed intrauterine pregnancy with 8 mm gestation sac, no fetal and yolk sac. Last week I had brown discharge with mild lower abdominal pain and was prescribed Susten 200 mg (oral). Now, I am feeling the pain frequently in the right lower abdomen with mild bleeding and pain. It is less when I lie on bed. What to do?
Doctor response: 1) Firstly, it seems that your uterus has been ruptured due to which there is bleeding and pain. 2) You should consult your OB/GYN immediately for proper management. 3) The following investigations will be needed to confirm the diagnosis:* Ultrasound scan of pelvis * Hysteroscopy if suspected* Blood tests like CBC, serum Chat Doctor level, thyroid profile, etc.* Urine routine examination4) Treatment will depend upon the cause.

Patient query: I'm 40 & I've had glandular fever, shingles, influenza and have an autoimmune condition (Hashimoto's disease). I believe I may be more vulnerable than the average person my age to get Coronavirus, due to my weakened immune system? Should I be self isolating? I am ok to do so
Doctor response: 1. I don't think your history is enough for me to conclude that you are more likely to contract coronavirus infection.2. There are people who have mild symptoms of common cold with viral upper respiratory tract infections but they will not develop severe illnesses like pneumonia or acute respiratory distress syndrome.3. So if you have no fever, chills, cough, shortness of breath, or other unusual symptoms then you need not worry about getting sick from this virus.

Patient query: Hello doctor,I am a 50-year-old female who has had an elevated ferritin level for many years now. My last ferritin level was 342, 20 days back. My ferritin level has been as high as 390. My TIBC, UIBC, iron, and iron saturation have always been within normal range. My glucose has always ranged from 100 to 104. I was tested for hemochromatosis and results are negative. My doctors keep telling me that we will just watch my ferritin level and I have bloodwork done every six months. I was diagnosed with fibromyalgia last year. I am looking for some answers and some help.
Doctor response: 1) Ferritin is a protein which stores iron in body and if its level increases it means there is increased demand of iron, hence more production of ferritin.2) Your iron levels are also fine so no need to worry about iron deficiency or any other problem related to iron.3) Fibromyalgia is a condition where pain can be felt anywhere in body. I think your doctors are rightly treating this condition by monitoring iron levels, but do not ignore your symptoms. 4) You should consult a psychiatrist who might prescribe medicines like pregabalin or duloxetine for fibromyalgia.

Patient query: Hello doctor,I have had a fishy odor down there since I was in elementary school. I was not sexually active at all either. Just a couple years ago I realized I might have something called bacterial vaginosis. I went to the doctor for it a couple years ago and got prescribed Metronidazole and it did nothing for me. Ever since then I have not really gone to the doctor about it again. I am worried because I have read that BV left untreated can make you infertile. How common is it that this could happen? And do you have any tips for me?
Doctor response: 1. You need to get your lab tests done like-blood sugar levels, thyroid profile, prolactin levels, uterus & ovary ultrasound & smear test from gynecologist.2. Your main concern should be to find out the cause of foul smelling discharge.3. Since you have been having this problem since childhood, it is very unlikely that bacterial vaginosis has caused infertility.4. You may take antifungal medication like fluconazole or metronidazole tablets after consulting with your doctor.5. Avoid wearing tight clothing & panties as they will increase the chances of infection.6. Wash genital area with warm water twice daily.7. Use only plain soap (not scented) for bathing.8. Keep your vaginal area clean & Chat Doctor.

Patient query: Hi doctor,I am a 25-year-old male. I do not have any medical history. Been always healthy. For the past 3 months, I have been experiencing this facial tightness which comes pretty often throughout the day with different intensity. The facial tension usually comes half an hour after I leave the bed. The tightness on my face happens to be on both sides of my face but usually more intense on the right. At times, I can feel it from my neck all the way up to my face. As of recent, I have been feeling this slight burning sensation on my chest to my shoulders as well. Prior to this facial tightness, I have been suffering from this burning feeling on the centre of my chest for about a month. It was my first time experiencing heartburn and I thought it was heart related. Went for X-rays and echo heart ultrasound. Everything came out fine. I have a healthy heart. What made the burning chest sensation go away temporarily is lying down, eating, exercising and drinking alcohol. And the weird part is the same thing helps me relieve my facial tightness temporarily is the same thing as that for the burning chest sensation; lying down, eating, exercising and drinking alcohol.Since having this facial tightness, I have paid numerous visits to different doctors, even the neuro-specialist and they all said it was anxiety. The doctors did facial senses test where they take a piece of fine cotton to touch different parts of my face. I had to close my eyes and tell them where the spot is. I have no troubles at all. I did blood test. It came out normal. They told me I do not need to do any scans and that it was merely anxiety and it will go off by itself. I convinced myself that I had anxiety because of the one month heartburn ordeal that I was suffering from. Even though the facial tightness was there, I tried my utmost best to ignore it. I do not think that I have any anxiety in me now as I try not to think of the weird tightness sensation. However, it has been 3 whole months and now I am getting alarmed and worried that it is still here and with newer sensations as I described above. In all honesty, I do feel that the intensity of the facial tension as compared to I first experienced it, is less. However, it is always there even as when I am typing this. I do not see any physical change on my body. Not sure if it is neuro damage. I am worried sick.Hope I can get some form of advice and diagnosis.
Doctor response: 1) Burning sensation on your chest could be due to acid reflux disease (GERD). This is a common condition where the gastric juices flows back into esophagus and causes discomfort. 2) Facial tightness can be due to muscle spasm. 3) Neither of these conditions are caused by anxiety. You should visit a physician who would examine you and then decide what tests he wants to order.

Patient query: Hello doctor,My mother is 75 years old. She had been treated for TB (tuberculosis) of the abdomen as her ultrasound of abdomen finding was thicken bowel loop. In general terms, it was informed about TB in her abdomen. Accordingly, medicines were given to her as per the advise of a local MD doctor. Treatment continued for three months and due to some discontinuation of medicine it relapsed and again she was diagnosed with Thicken bowel loop as per USG. Again treatment continued.However, while undergoing treatment she lost sensation in her legs and complained of losing sensation in her legs and numbness in her feet and was unable to put on slippers in her feet with difficulty in moving. She also complained that while moving she felt as if she was moving on a bed of soft cotton.Subsequent treatment by neuro experts revealed that overdose of treatment of her TB in abdomen resulted in this condition and she was diagnosed for peripheral neuropathy and was advised for biopsy for proper diagnosis. Meanwhile, she fell and hurt herself which was later on diagnosed that her spine at L3 - L4 was compressed due to felling abruptly and accordingly she was advised to take bed rest for three months. Slowly, she recovered from this condition felt pain in her back and was facing another kind of problem as she could not sit for a longer time and preferred to lay down on the bed.Finding her bad condition subsequetly, we also took consultation from other neuro experts at a prestigious institution where she was prescribed Lupivitin one tablet and Sammy one tablet.When condition persisted thereafter she was given Primosa one tablet daily, Neurox one tablet daily, Maxglobin 50 mg one tablet and Defart 6 mg.But, whenever she was given medicine her condition further aggravated. After about six months of treatment by the neuro expert, she has now been referred to the department of immunology for their advice. Meanwhile, we also took advice from a rheumatologist who diagnosed a kind of arthritis and started treating accordingly. He also started the course of Defzacort (steroid) along with other medicines. The steroid was prescribed with a decreasing dose per week from 60 mg per day to 6 mg per day.However, after taking about two months of steroid course her condition deteriorated and had severe breathlessness. Her blood sugar level also shot up and ultimately she was hospitalized and the treatment of steroid withdrawn. After 15 days of treatment at the hospital she recovered to her previous condition. But, her neuro problem of numbness in her legs and loss of sensation in legs still continues. Please help.
Doctor response: Thank you very much for your question. I am sorry to hear about your mothers health problems but I think I can be of assistance. Your mother has suffered a lot and it seems like she may have chronic inflammation or an autoimmune disease. I would suggest seeing a rheumatologist for a thorough evaluation and management. You mentioned she has arthritis, however, I would like to know what type? This will determine how best to treat her. The use of steroids should be done carefully, and her dosage should be monitored closely. I hope my response helps.

Patient query: Hi doctor,I am suffering from a mild cold and severe clogging of ears. I am taking Afrin spray for an hour and one pill of Sudafed. I developed a similar condition of cold and sinus infection before six months. I had severe clogging of ears. I was given Amoxicillin for five days and Prednisone 5 mg. My ENT doctor examined my ears and told me that there was no issue with the eardrum. He diagnosed it as eustachian tube issue. Please help.
Doctor response: 1) You should take steam inhalation to clear your ear canal.2) Take a decongestant like Xylometazoline nasal spray.3) Avoid hot and spicy food.4) Use saline nasal Chat Doctor. 5) Do warm compresses over your forehead.6) Take rest and avoid exposure to cold air.7) Take plenty of fluids so that your body can flush out the excessive fluid.8) For symptomatic relief, you may use antibiotics like levofloxacin, azithromycin or doxycycline.9) If the symptoms persist even after 3-4 days then consult an ENT specialist. Hope this helps you.

Patient query: Hi doctor,My wife missed her periods and we doubt she is pregnant. Our first kid is just 1 year old now and it was a Cesarean. We are not in a position to have a second child now. Her LMP was 22nd of last month. I read that Mifepristone can induce abortion. Is it a safe drug? Do we have to consult doctor for taking this drug? What are all the possible side effects? Is that drug 100 percent reliable? Is there any other options? Whether this drug is available without doctor\s prescription? Thank you.
Doctor response: 1. No, mifepristone is not available without doctors prescription. 2. It is a safe medication, but as with any medications there may be some side effects which include nausea, vomiting, headache, diarrhea etc. These symptoms usually subside within 48 hours after ingestion.3. Yes, it is 100% reliable if taken under supervision by a trained gynecologist.4. There are many other options for termination of early pregnancy like medical methods (like MTP kit) or surgical methods (like suction evacuation). But these need to be done under proper guidance of a qualified Gynecologist.

Patient query: Hi doctor,I have a question for my mother. My mother is 50 years old. She complains of episodic, sudden loss of weight bearing ability on the left Achilles tendon. She is taking Bisoprolol 5 mg and Amlodipine 5 mg for high BP and it is well-controlled. She has no history of any allergy. She has kidney stones and so occasional pain in the lumbar area. She used to get constipation frequently. She was hospitalized four times for normal vaginal deliveries and once for abortion. She is monogamous with her husband. She has a positive family history of hypertension in mother, CAD in father, mother and brother and uterine cancer in mother. She has a history of menorrhagia and cycles have become more irregular now. Then, diagnostic D and C was performed last year, which was normal. She will not smoke or drink. She sleeps 4 to 6 hours daily and snores at night.
Doctor response: Hi, Thanks for your query. I am Chat Doctor. I understand your concern. The symptoms you mentioned are suggestive of possible involvement of muscles in the lower limb. It is best to consult an orthopedic surgeon who can examine her and give treatment as required. In addition to medicines she may require physical therapy including exercises to improve strength and mobility. I hope this answer helps you. Please write back to me if you need any further clarification.

Patient query: Hello doctor,A few months before, I developed a gastric issue that required treatment with PPIs. Soon into using the drugs I developed headaches, dizziness, and nausea. I changed the type of PPI three times but the symptoms persisted. The symptoms included a feeling of pressure above my right ear and behind my right eye. Later, I came off the PPIs and after using over the counter headache painkillers for three days the severity of the headaches eased. But the feeling of pressure remains to this day on the right side of the face. I often feel heavy head or even light-headed with a slight dizziness, often as if I am hung over. The symptoms come and go, but are there every day for differing periods of time. And the constant is this feeling of slight pressure on the right side of my head above the ear and extending sometimes down to the cheek and behind the right eye.
Doctor response: HI, thanks for your question at Chat Doctor. I can understand your concern. You have got a typical picture of migraine which is a common problem nowadays. Migraine is a disorder in blood vessels supplying brain. It causes severe headache along with other symptoms like nausea, vomiting, sensitivity to noise, bright light etc. In some people it may be associated with visual disturbances. It usually occurs on one side of the head. It comes and goes. It can be due to stress also. You should take medicine to control your headache. I would suggest you to consult a neurologist to get proper diagnosis and management. Hope this helps. Regards

Patient query: Hello doctor,I would like to ask what is the likelihood that my partner who performs oral sex on me has trench mouth or acute necrotizing ulcerative gingivitis? He has no bad breath and he was able to have normal food. Can people with trench mouth have no bad breath and is able to eat normal food?
Doctor response: 1) your boyfriend had no gum bleeding, so it is unlikely that he has Trenchmouth (necrotizing ulcerative gingivitis).2) The symptoms of Trenchmouth are gumbleeding, pain, swelling in the gums, difficulty in eating and talking, etc.3) People with Trenchmouth may not be able to eat normal food because of severe pain.4) But if your boyfriend does not have any other symptom than he can be treated for gingivitis only.5) You should visit a dentist and get him examined.6) He will need scaling and polishing of his teeth and gums. Hope I have answered your query. Let me know if I can assist you further.

Patient query: Hello doctor,My son has developed anxiety symptoms about four years ago. They came completely out of the blue. He was with someone who now has heart palpitations, sweaty palms and feet, and lightheadedness sitting in the living room. We ran a battery of tests when it first happened including TSH, EKG, lung scans, blood panels, etc. and everything was normal. So we went down the path of anxiety. Four years later, the symptoms continued. As my son now has a terrible fear of doctors, we tried a home blood test to get a full thyroid panel. I have attached the results.The blood work came back normal. Low normal TSH, but low normal T4 and lower normal free T4 and free T3. There is nothing that shows an abnormality. However, his urine test showed moderately low iodine and slightly low selenium. I have read that abnormalities in these measures could cause thyroid problems. What am I wondering is if these two indicators are worth further exploration with an endocrinologist knowing that going to the doctor will cause my son a severe panic.Also, is it possible that low iodine could have been a temporary diet thing and it is masking the signs of hyperthyroidism in the blood work? He has all of the symptoms of someone with hyperthyroidism. On a side note, I am hypothyroid, my sister is hypothyroid and my two nieces had Hashimoto\s with my younger niece having thyroid cancer and got her thyroid removed at age of 22. So everyone on my side of the family has thyroid issues. We were wondering if you could please give us some guidance. Looking to see if we need to eliminate thyroid as a possible cause of his symptoms or if it is worth further pursuit.
Doctor response: Hi, Thanks for writing in. The blood levels of thyroid hormones are not always accurate in people with anxiety. In such cases, an ultrasound scan of the neck can be done which can help in differentiating between a normal thyroid gland and enlargement of the thyroid gland due to inflammation or goiter. In case of enlargement of the thyroid gland, the treatment is simple. It consists of taking anti-inflammatory medicines like steroids along with thyroxine. This is called as subclinical hyperthyroidism. In case of thyroiditis, the thyroid function tests may come back normal but there might be some changes seen on thyroid ultrasound. These are transient conditions and resolve over a period of time without any specific treatment. Do discuss the above with your doctor. Hope this helps.

Patient query: Hello doctor,My fiancee had a bleeding on the 25th of last month. It lasted for about four to five days. She then got dengue and on the 14th of this month, had mild spotting for a day and a half. The doctor said it could be the dengue causing the spotting. She has not gotten her periods yet. I have read that there could be bleeding during pregnancy as well.
Doctor response: Hi, Thanks for writing in. Bleeding can occur in pregnancy due to many reasons like miscarriage, ectopic pregnancies etc. and should be investigated thoroughly. Dengue also causes bleeding from time to time. But if she is still bleeding after 3 weeks or so, she needs to get investigated further. The period might become irregular during pregnancy. Patient query: Hello doctor,My father recently had a heart attack and a stroke. Then had two heart valves repaired and they want to put a stent in. His list of medications does not seem to make sense and although he loves his cardiologist. I do not think he is paying enough attention. I am in the medical field and although I am not a pharmacist or an M.D. I know a little bit about adverse drug reactions. Tell me if this makes sense to you.Metoprolol tartrate 25 mg half pill twice a day, Potassium Chloride 20 mEq once daily, Losartan potassium 25 mg once daily, Warfarin sodium 5 mg once daily, Atorvastatin 20 mg, Digozin 25 mcg once daily and Furosemide 40 mg once daily.I need to know if these medications are fine to take all in one day and if so, I would like to split them into two times a day according to the reactions. I feel that so many medications doing the same thing is redundant and unnecessary and causing problems. Please help me.
Doctor response: Hi, Thanks for writing in. As you have mentioned your fathers history with heart attack and stroke, it seems that he has got coronary artery disease which means blockages in coronary vessels supplying blood to heart muscle. This can lead to chest pain (angina) while exercise or stress. Since your father has been given metoprolol and warfarin, it suggests that he is at risk of clot formation either due to heart attack or atherosclerosis. The other medicines like potassium, losartan, statins etc. are used to control high blood pressure as well as diabetes. These medicines also reduce the chance of further blockage in coronary vessels and hence prevention of future heart attacks. Hence, it is necessary to continue all these medicines. You may discuss with your father's treating doctor regarding splitting the doses of some of the medicines if required.

Patient query: Hello doctor,So, I have hives, also known as chronic urticaria. Basically, I break out when the climate I am in is hot, or when I exercise. Patient query: Hi doctor,I have noticed that my first molar is loose. I keep pushing it with my tongue and clenching a bit against it and I just noticed that it has become loose little more. Patient query: Hello doctor, I have been going to a dentist about a tooth that is sore. They started a root canal but then did not finish. I have gone back several times and every time they open up the tooth and insert medicine. My tooth is in agony right now. I am just wondering if this is a standard procedure during a root canal? Should not the dentist remove the nerves so I am not in so much pain? Or is it the standard procedure to fight the infection first and then remove the nerves?
Doctor response: 1) The treatment of choice for an infected tooth is a root canal therapy. During the course of the root canal treatment, the dentist will be able to determine whether the nerve is viable or not. If the nerve has died (necrosis), he/she will remove the dead tissue and leave the healthy tissue alone.2) If the nerve is viable, the dentist will clean out the canals and fill them with a sealer. Root canal therapy is a very successful treatment option and once done, there should be no further discomfort.3) After the root canal treatment is complete, the tooth should be restored with a crown. Please do not hesitate to contact us again if you require any additional information.

Patient query: Hello doctor,Is there a difference in alcoholic and non-alcoholic mouthwash. Which is better at combating bad breath due to smoking than alcoholic? Doctor response: Hi, Thanks for writing in. Mouthwash containing chlorhexidine (0.12%) is very effective in controlling halitosis caused by smoking. It has antibacterial properties that help in control of bacteria causing bad breath. It also helps in keeping your gums healthy and prevents plaque formation. Alcohol free mouthwashes can cause irritation to the mucosa lining the mouth and may even worsen bad breath. So, it is advisable to use chlorhexidine mouthwash if you smoke. You may need to rinse with this mouthwash for about 3 months to see visible results.

Doctor response: Hi, Welcome to Chat Doctor forum. I understand your concern, as you have mentioned that you have hereditary spherocytosis. Other symptoms include anemia, fatigue, easy bruising, frequent nosebleeds, bleeding gums, dark urine, light colored stools, abdominal pain, fever, headache, joint pains, loss of appetite, nausea, vomiting, numbness and tingling sensation in limbs, rashes, seizures, severe itching, stiff neck, swelling of the legs, and weight loss. Kindly consult your physician for further management. Hope this helps you. Take care.

Patient query: Hi doctor,I asked a question to you this morning. You advised me not to take contraceptive pills since I have the DIU MIRENA. But I have another question. Doctor response: 1-it is not advisable to stop using intrauterine device at any time.2-you can use condom as a form of birth control while on Mirena; however this will not protect you against sexually transmitted diseases.3-the pill contains hormones which are essential for normal functioning of your body and also helps prevent pregnancy by preventing ovulation. Stopping pills suddenly may cause side effects such as dizziness, nausea, headache, breast tenderness, etc.4-if you are planning to get pregnant soon, you need to start taking pills regularly again after stopping the current pack.5-it is best to complete the current pack and then switch over to other form of contraception. Patient query: Hello doctor,I had a secondary burn on my calf, after a month of self-treating. It just got worse. I play soccer and that and the sweat is what was irritating it. Doctor response: 1) Secondary bacterial infection can develop if the wound is infected by bacteria.2) Peripheral dermatitis is caused due to fungus which causes scaling and itching around the mouth and other parts of body.3) The best way to treat this condition is to use topical steroid cream such as triamcinolone acetone ointment twice daily.4) You should take oral antihistamines tablets such as cetirizine/levocetirizine for symptomatic relief.5) Apply mild steroid cream over affected areas at nighttime for faster healing.6) Keep your mouth clean and Chat Doctor.

Do not drive, operate machinery, or do other dangerous activities until you know how this medicine affects you.6) Other

Patient query: Hello doctor,I am six days post operative from a full tummy tuck with liposuction and muscle repair. I feel that I am recovering normally from what I was told and what I read. You can take anti-inflammatory medications like Ibuprofen for pain relief and antibiotics like Augmenting as well as ointments like Mupirocin or gentamicin ointment locally over the swollen area. Do warm fomentation over it. Hope this will help you. Wishing you good health. Thank you.

Patient query: Hello doctor,I am an 18-year-old, and I have experienced forgetfulness ever since I was in elementary. I usually ace my tests because I have a very short term memory, so cramming often makes do. But, I often tend to forget things when my body takes the so-called auto-pilot mode. During these times, I tend to do things with me, not really focusing on doing it because I was thinking of something else. I cannot really recall what exactly happened in a day when nothing special has occurred. I often forget where I put things, even when they are already in front of me, or in my hand. I seem to misplace habitually and it has pertrubed my parents. Now I am wandering if these are early symptoms of Alzheimer\s. Please reply, and if you want to ask questions about me,feel free.
Doctor response: Hi there, your concern is valid as you have been experiencing this for quite some time now. Although, the exact cause can only be known after a thorough clinical evaluation and investigation, however, from what you have mentioned here, it does seem like you are having problems with concentration and focus in life. This could be due to many reasons which would need further assessment and evaluation. You may also have to undergo some investigations like blood tests, CT scan etc. to rule out any other causes. Patient query: Hi doctor,Five years ago my mother was diagnosed with fibromyalgia. I think she also has rheumatoid arthritis. For the past five years, she was managing the pain with anti-inflammatory medicine, Lyrica, Mythycobal, Voltaren injections, herbal creams, etc. You can see the veins in her hands popping out. I also realized that the pain has got worse now.For about 12 months the doctor put her only on Prednisolone 5 mg/day and painkiller when necessary. She was fine till last month but the pain increased in her hands now. In the daytime she is fine and the pain starts mildly in the evening. When she lies down in the bed she gets electrical tingling in her legs by which her sleep gets disturbed. She has undergone several tests last week and I attached them for your reference. She did not consult a rheumatologist yet. What medication can I give to reduce the inflammation and cure her? Her ESR, CPR, and ANA are quite high. The pain in her hands and the tingling in her legs at night are agonizing her life. Kindly provide your expert advice.
Doctor response: Hi, Thanks for writing in. Fibromyalgia is a chronic condition. It is characterized by widespread musculoskeletal pain as well as fatigue and tenderness of specific points on palpation (trigger points). The trigger points may be tender even after the muscle has been completely relaxed. The pain may be severe enough to limit daily activities or require bed rest. Treatment includes lifestyle changes such as exercise, stress management, proper sleep hygiene, physical therapy, cognitive behavioral therapy and medications such as Tricyclic antidepressants, muscle relaxants, analgesics, Serotonin reuptake inhibitors, Sleeping pills etc. I would advise you to take treatment from an Rheumatologist who will help you with the above mentioned options. Please do not worry.

Patient query: Hello doctor,I am currently having acne on my cheeks. I am currently applying Benzoyl peroxide gel on my acne. It only reduces the inflammation but bumps are not reducing. I also have pigmentation caused by acne before. I only get acne on my cheeks. What may be the reason? I usually get cyst acne bumps on my cheeks. If acne clears, then it comes again. I have red pigmentation caused by acne. Can you recommend a product for acne and after acne has cleared, can you suggest a product for pigmentation? Can you recommend a product for controlling further breakouts? Also, I wanted to know which sunscreen and moisturizer to use?
Doctor response: 1) Benzyl peroxide is an antiseptic agent which acts against the infection causing microorganisms. It is not a treatment for acne or pigmentation as such.2) Acne lesions can recur if adequate measures are not taken. The best way to prevent them is to maintain good hygiene by washing face twice daily with a mild soap/cleanser and keep your skin clean. Avoid excessive oiliness of face. Use benzoyl peroxide gels for local application over active areas.3) After acne subsides, apply a cream containing clindamycin, tretinoin and azelaic acid. Apply this cream at nighttime only.4) For pigmentation, use a cream containing retinoid (Retinol), niacinamide and kojic acid.5) Sunscreen should contain SPF 3

Patient query: Hello doctor,I have been given hepatitis B blood test that showed the HBsAg negative and the hepatitis B core antibody image as positive. I am currently getting labs done for hepatitis B Surf Ab Quant, HBsAg screen, hepatitis B virus profile, and panel. I am getting conflicting information on websites and from healthcare professionals that hepatitis B does not ever leave the body but I also read that 98 % of the people who get it cleared the disease from the body. My question is what is the real answer, can I beat the virus and remove it from my body completely leaving only anti-bodies?
Doctor response: Thanks for your query to Chat Doctor virtual clinic. I am a Gastroenterologist. Hepatitis B infection is a chronic condition and if left untreated may lead to cirrhosis & liver cancer. The treatment consists of antiviral medicines which should be taken lifelong along with immunization against Hepatitis B. This will prevent further spread of the disease. You need to consult an Infectious Disease specialist for management. You also need to undergo regular monitoring of liver function tests. Hope this helps you. Take care.

Patient query: Hello doctor,I have had a feeling like something had been at the back of my left side of the throat for a few days. I do not know what it is? Tonsils are not inflamed, throat a bit dry, and does not hurt to swallow.

Hope this information was useful to you. Wish you good health. Thank you.

Patient query: Hello doctor,How to use a product called Contractubex? I bought it but for some reason, it does not come with usage instructions. How do I use this product but combining it with SPF 30? I would like to know how to use it for a fresh surgical scar. Can someone please tell me how to use it with SPF 30, that is how to combine SPF 30 for a surgical scar because Contractubex does not come with instructions on how to use it mixing it with SPF 30. Doctor response: 1. For best results start using contracture as soon as possible after surgery.2. Apply it twice daily at least for 6 months. You can apply the cream before applying sunscreen and reapply every 4 hours, if needed.3. If you feel that there is no improvement in your scars within a few months of treatment, consult your surgeon who will examine your scars and may change the therapy accordingly.

Patient query: Hello doctor,Just a few minutes before I was trying to reach my forehead with my left arm and just after that, I think my nerve got stretched in the neck. For now, you can take acetaminophen/Tylenol for pain relief.4. Avoid heavy lifting, straining, bending forward, and twisting movements of head and neck.5. Apply an ice pack over the affected area for 20 minutes at a time every two to three hours during the day.6. As a first step you should see a neurologist or neurosurgeon for further evaluation and treatment.

Patient query: Hi doctor,I have been suffering from pain on the right side of my abdomen, from the past three days. It pains more when I press my abdomen. Patient query: Hello doctor,I am writing on behalf of my mother and she is currently facing the severe recurrent nocturnal high blood pressure problem. She has been constantly relying on anti-hypertensive drugs from the past five years and the situation is aggravating day by day. Moreover, she claims of facing high pulse rate and is positively confirmed by ECG. Currently, she consumes a combination of Cilnidipine and Metoprolol and also other allied drugs in an emergency.
Doctor response: 1) The medication that your mother is taking for hypertension may be causing her symptoms. It is best to discuss this with her physician who can assess whether or not these medications are actually needed.2) It is possible that some of her symptoms are related to her diabetes which needs to be managed better.3) She should avoid sugary foods and increase her physical activity.4) In addition to her current medications, I would recommend that she takes calcium supplements to help reduce any hyperactivity of the heart.5) If she has had any uncontrolled episodes of hypoglycemia (low sugar), it is important to check her blood sugar levels at least once a month.6) It is also important to make sure that she is not having cardiac arrhythmias such as Atrial fibrillation which can cause palpitations.

Patient query: Hi doctor,I recently had unprotected sex with a guy twice in an interval of three days. After the first time, there was a lot of pain, but had a regular whitish discharge. Second time, I started having this brownish or yellowish discharge and I have taken the photo of the discharge. I am not sure what it is? Neither of us have STDs. I am quite scared of being pregnant. Doctor response: 1st you need to know your ovulation day, as you did intercourse during that phase only. So, chances of getting pregnancy is less. As per your history, you had unprotected sex few times, so possibility of getting pregnancy is high. You can go for urine pregnancy test after one week of missed periods. Brownish or yellowish discharge could be due to vaginal infection like bacterial Vaginosis (BV). BV is common in women who have frequent sexual activity. It usually presents with gray-white discharge with fishy odor. So, consult gynecologist for proper clinical evaluation and treatment. Take care.

Patient query: Hi doctor,My mother is suffering from a left femoral neck fracture. Is there any other treatment other than surgery? Please suggest.

This will be done by a orthopedic surgeon. She may have to stay in bed or may require assisted walking using crutches. In case if she has not had any complications of her previous hip fractures then I would advise her to undergo this procedure as soon as possible.

Patient query: Hi doctor,My fiancee and I are not known HIV positive. But we have had unprotected anal sex ten times so far. Can we be infected with HIV?
Doctor response: 1. It is very unlikely that your partner will get infected with HIV.2. The chances of getting infected with HIV after one exposure to it is less than 0.1%.3. However, if you want to be doubly sure about her health status then go for an HIV test at least three months after the last sexual encounter.4. In my opinion, there is no need for you to take any medicines as you do not have any symptoms or signs of HIV infection.5. Please follow safe sex practices in future to avoid such problems. Hope this answers your question. If you have additional questions or follow-up questions then please do not hesitate in writing to us. Wishing you good health.

Patient query: Hello doctor,Just two days ago I found out I was about 1-2 weeks pregnant. And it has been about 4 1/2 weeks since my last menstrual period. Unfortunately with labor day being this weekend I have been unable to see my regular OBGYN. But I did go to the ER to confirm the pregnancy 2 days ago. So my blood results came back with an HCG OF 248 and the doctor said I am right around 1-2 weeks.So, here is my question. I have been stressing out badly due to the fact I have been on Lorazepam 1 mg every night for anxiety and PD for the last 2 years as well as Percocet 10 mg as needed for back pain. I have been taking both of the medications during my pregnancy when I had no idea I was pregnant. Since finding out I have tried tapering on both medications. The Percocet is making me sweat and very agitated and when I tried to cut down on the Lorazepam I was shaking and almost hallucinating and delusion. I also tried not taking the Lorazepam at all and woke up crying, shaking and sweating. I want to be off both these medicines but I am worried more about the Lorazepam as it is a class D pregnancy drug. I have read about the terrible problems this causes for infants. I am so scared that I am considering abortion. I do not want to be a terrible mother before I even give birth. I have been having bad panic attacks over this and cannot seem to relax as the complications of these medicines are always on my mind. Any advice at all would be very much appreciated.
Doctor response: Hi, Thanks for posting in Chat Doctor. I understand your concern. Lorazepam is a benzodiazepine which is a group C teratogen, meaning it can cause harm to the fetus. It should not be taken during pregnancy if possible. However, there are some women who may need it for their health, and they will have to weigh risks vs benefits. If you were taking Lorazepam only, you might consider taking it while pregnant. You could try switching to another anti-anxiety medicine such as clonazepam or alprazolam. These two are considered safe during early pregnancy. In addition, you should continue to take your other medication such as percocet. This can help reduce the symptoms of nausea, headache etc. Hope this helps. Take care.

Hope this helps.

You need to consult a hematologist for further evaluation.3) Your symptoms seem to be related to the high platelet count and not to hypertension. Patient query: Hello doctor,I am not satisfied with dental bonding done on the front left tooth. Enamel was removed to make room for the composite resin and the enamel is now too thin and feels sharp to the tongue\s touch because of this. Shape and feel is not consistent with the natural front right tooth. Is there any way to fix this? Want to be as conservative as possible to avoid further damage.
Doctor response: 1) You need to visit your dentist and get the teeth evaluated, if it can be corrected at that time then no problem otherwise, you have to go for re-bonding or veneers.2) In case of veneering, only enamel will be removed, so no need to worry about enamel loss.3) Bonding is not recommended in the area where the tooth is chipped, so you should discuss it with your dentist whether to re-bond or go for veneer.4) Veneers require more preparation than bonding, but they look very natural, whereas bonding looks artificial.5) I hope my advice will help you.

Patient query: Hello doctor,I had sex with a condom. But it tore in the middle of the act. But the guy did not ejaculate. I took unwanted 72 within 15 hours. I experienced withdrawal bleeding a week later that was quite normal like a period and lasted for four days. I took UPT which was negative. Can I still be pregnant?
Doctor response: 1. You had intercourse without protection while having your periods. This increases chances of conception. So, if you have missed any period or spotting then get a pregnancy test done to confirm the pregnancy2. Unprotected sex during periods is least safe time for getting pregnant as there is no ovulation during this period3. The probability of pregnancy is high because of the torn condom. Also, the semen may contain sperms even after the condom tears off.4. You can try repeat pregnancy test at home after 10 days from unprotected sex. The best method to avoid pregnancy is to use birth control pills regularly.

Patient query: Dear doctor,My age is 29 years. I had a surgery three months ago, open myomectomy (posterior wall 4x4 cm subserosal 8x7 cm) with right endometriotic cyst (4x4 cm). Now taking Novelon. Shall I try for a baby now?
Doctor response: 1. You should not be trying to conceive as yet. You need at least one complete menstrual cycle after your surgery without any hormonal supplementation before you can safely attempt conception.2. Post-operative complications of pregnancy like bleeding and ectopic pregnancies are more common in early pregnancy.3. So it would be better if you wait till your first ovulation post-menstrual cycle. Then start follicular tracking and avoid intercourse during the fertile period.

You have not mentioned if there is any pain or discomfort associated with this change in the vision.5. The best way to find out what is causing this problem is to consult an Ophthalmologist who will examine the eyes thoroughly and also send you for some tests so as to know the exact reason for this change in vision.6. It may be possible that the perinorm

Patient query: Hello doctor, Is it safe to take Chymoral Forte once daily for three days in pregnancy?
Doctor response: 1. Hi, Thanks for your query.2. Yes, it is safe to take Chymoral forte once daily in pregnancy.3. It is used to treat anemia due to iron deficiency caused by heavy menstrual bleeding or other causes.4. It contains iron and vitamin C which helps in absorption of iron from food.5. It can be taken during pregnancy without any harm to mother or fetus.6. Please also consult your obstetrician about its use as he will know better about your condition and can guide you properly regarding its safety. Hope this helps.

Patient query: Hi doctor,I have lots of anxiety issues. I have taken Deanxit in the past. Then I stopped it for a year. I started taking it back again six months ago. I have a long flight to take soon. I have a fear of flying. Can I take one pill of Valium 5 mg while taking the Deanxit? So, that I can sleep on the plane. However, you may take deanxit alone, but then you will need to fly with an air sickness bag nearby.2) You should talk to your doctor about your medication. It is likely that the higher doses of concor and femina are causing your palpitation problem. Try reducing the dosage or switching to a different antihypertensive agent.

Patient query: Hello doctor,My daughter aged 7 years has a urine infection. We have done a urine culture as well as regular analysis and found that there is an infection. She has this problem from a long time. She has a bad habit of holding her urine for a long time until she can hold it no more.

Hope I have answered your query. Let me know if I can assist you further.

Patient query: Hello doctor,I need to know about cardiac dysfunction. I was told it was found on venous Doppler looking at DVT. What all information can you tell me about the blood vessels having a pulse and it being a cardiac dysfunction? That is all I was left with until the cardiologist consult.
Doctor response: Hi, Welcome to Chat Doctor.com. In my opinion this is not related to heart disease, but it may be related to your leg veins. In some patients there may be dilated or blocked veins in legs which will cause pooling of blood in lower part of legs. This condition is known as chronic venous insufficiency (CVI). It can be diagnosed by ultrasonography. You should consult a vascular surgeon for further evaluation and treatment. Hope this answers your question. If you have additional questions or follow-up questions then please do not hesitate in writing to us. Wishing you good health.

Patient query: Hi doctor,I am a 29 year old. My doctor said that I have an umbilical hernia.Either open surgery or laparoscopy, which would be the best? After which surgery, can I lift heavy weights?I am a sports person and a bodybuilder. Please suggest.

The reason being in case there is a complication like strangulation of intestine, then it will be very difficult to fix the same by non-operative methods. So better to get operated once and forget about it.2. As far as lifting heavy weights are concerned, it is not advisable to do so at least till after six weeks post-operatively.

Patient query: Hello doctor,I have cavities in the front two teeth. I have kept putting off seeing the dentist because of a high profile busy job. I have an upcoming appointment but am worried about a possible infection to the bone? If this is the case would I have severe pain and swelling?

You should consult your dentist for evaluation and treatment.4. Get all the decayed teeth removed and restored with filling material.5. Antibiotics like amoxicillin 500 mg twice daily along with anti-inflammatory medicine like ibuprofen 400mg thrice daily will help in reducing pain and inflammation.

Patient query: What are some common causes of one sided SI joint Pain that comes and goes? I\m 25 and just had a baby (naturally) 10 months ago. Back pain started at 8 months Postpartum .
Doctor response: Hi, thanks for posting your query. The most common cause is spondylosis or degenerative changes in the vertebrae which is very common after child birth due to hormonal changes. This can be confirmed by MRI scan of the lumbar spine. Other causes include stress fracture of the pelvis, sacroiliac joint arthritis, osteoporosis, inflammation of the nerve root etc. You need to take a course of steroid along with analgesic Chat Doctor.

Patient query: Hello doctor,Earlier this year approximately five months ago, I was diagnosed with ulnar nerve entrapment at the right elbow. Sadly, I declined rapidly and lost all my hypotheaner and some of my lumbericals in a matter of six weeks. I was operated on exactly 14 weeks ago where I had a decompression of the ulnar nerve and an anterior interosseous nerve transfer to the motor component of the ulnar nerve so that the nerve axons would reach my hand quicker. I still have no improvement and I wanted to ask if it is possible to transfer muscle to fill in the hand? And will this protect my nerves in the hand? Would it be too soon to be considering this operation?
Doctor response: Hi, The nerve transfers have been done to improve the function of hand but not for filling up the hand. You can consider undergoing surgery after 6-8 months of non-improvement as your symptoms has progressed since last 5 months. If you are satisfied with the results of the first surgery then there is no need to go for another surgery. Hope I have answered your query. Let me know if I can assist you further.

Doctor response: 1) You can get complete information regarding your disease only after seeing your reports, so I would suggest you to upload them here on Chat Doctor.2) I have gone through your history and understand your concern.3) Regarding your query, you need to know that Chemotherapy is a systemic treatment, which means it affects all cells in the body, not just cancer cells.4) Apart from hair loss, other side effects include nausea and vomiting, fatigue, sore mouth or throat, mouth sores, diarrhea, constipation, loss of appetite and taste changes.5) Please do not worry, these symptoms will subside gradually once the chemo treatment is finished.6) Yes, you should also consult an Ayurvedic physician along with Oncologist, who will help you out with the right medicines to boost up your immunity and maintain good health.7) Also, make sure

Patient query: Hello doctor,My daughter is 2 years old. Now, she is speaking only 3 to 4 words. She is not talking like other children. Please tell me if she has any kind of disorder. I have been to the doctor once and he told nothing to worry. After 2 years only they can speak. But my elder daughter spoke when she was 1.5 years old. I am so worried about her. Please tell me what to do. Her birth weight is 3.2 and now she is around 9 I think.
Doctor response: 1st thing is, you should not compare your child with others. Every kid develop at different rate, and some may be ahead of others in some aspects while some may be behind. So don't worry about it. If she is not speaking as much as other kids who are same age then that could be due to her language development or some learning disability. I would suggest you to consult a pediatrician and get her evaluated for autism spectrum disorders, ADHD, learning disabilities etc.

Patient query: Hello doctor,My 13 year old daughter has been suffering from vomitings and loose motions since two days. She had a fever of about 101.3 the day before yesterday. Our doctor advised her to take Oflox OZ and Sporolac DS. She has had five doses of Oflox OZ till now.The fever has gone and the number of motions has also reduced, though still watery but she is not eating anything. Her appetite is lost and even if she eats a little she complains of nausea though she is not throwing up. I am giving her Emeset for nausea. Is this a normal stomach infection?
Doctor response: Hi welcome to Chat Doctor forum.  Thanks for calling Chat Doctor. Forum.  Your daughter may be having gastroenteritis or some viral infection. The symptoms like vomiting and diarrhea are commonly seen with such type of infections. The vomiting may be due to the disease itself or due to the medicines which were prescribed. The loss of appetite could be due to either of the above causes. For your information, the antibiotics used for treatment of gastrointestinal infections have no effect on any other infections except those occurring in the gut. So it would be better to consult a pediatrician and get treated accordingly. Wishing good health to your daughter.

Patient query: Hi doctor,My front tooth got chipped away before two days. I am so nervous about it. How to recover my tooth?
Doctor response: Hello, It is possible to repair the chipped tooth by using composite restoration or porcelain veneer. However, if the damage is severe enough that the nerve inside the tooth becomes exposed, then root canal treatment may be necessary. For this reason, I recommend you to visit your dentist and get an x-ray done of the tooth. After examination he can suggest you the best option. Hope I have answered your query. Let me know if I can assist you further.

Patient query: Hi doctor,My son hit his mouth on the bathtub while playing when he was 9 months old, causing both top front teeth to be pushed up into his gums. They came back down, and the dentist said they were fine. Now he is 4.5 years old, one of the teeth is ready to fall, and his dentist wants to pull out the other front tooth with a strong root. He says it is best if they both come out at the same time, but did not explain further. Is pulling an absolutely good tooth the best option? I am attaching the x-rays of the teeth.
Doctor response: Hi Dear, Welcome to Chat Doctor. I have gone through your query and can understand your concerns. As per your complaint in case of trauma the tooth has to be removed as it is nonvital and there is no chance of saving it. The tooth which has already erupted can be saved by RCT (root canal treatment) or extraction depending upon the status of the tooth. In case of traumatic injury the tooth has to be extracted as there is risk of infection spreading to adjacent teeth. For any more queries you may contact me. Wishing him good health and early recovery.

Patient query: Hello doctor,I suffered from terrible anxiety and OCD that seems to come and go over time. My mother had exactly the same disorder like myself. She was diagnosed with an under active thyroid and autoimmune thyroid issue. On taking medication to sort her levels she has been free from the mental health problems.I recently started getting the issue again and took a thyroid function blood test. All levels were within range but my FT3 was slightly elevated at 8.97 pmol /L. I would love an expert opinion on if periodic FT3 level increases could be causing the anxiety, depression, and OCD issues. I am currently on Sertraline 150 mg. Coupled with my mother's exact issue, and cure, I am not sure what these results could mean? What should my next step be and could this elevated FT3 cause my anxiety to start?
Doctor response: Hi, Your TSH is normal (3.2) and so is your Free Thyroxin Index (FT4). The only thing which needs attention is your Free Triiodothyronine (FT3). It is raised. So, it is essential for me to know whether you have any symptoms of hyperthyroidism or not. As you are using sertraline, it may take some time to show its effect. So, I suggest you continue taking sertraline for at least another month before changing anything. You need to get a repeat FT3 done after about a week. If it is still high, then you will need to get a scan done to see whether there is any problem in the gland itself. And then change the treatment accordingly. Hope this helps.

Hope this helps. Good day!!

Hope I have answered your question. Let me know if I can assist you further.

Hope this will help you. Let me know if I can assist you further.

Patient query: Hello doctor,We are a newly married couple and had sex two days back without any prevention from pregnancy. Could you please suggest any prevention tablet which can prevent the pregnancy after sex without any side effects?
Doctor response: 1) Emergency pill should be taken within 72 hours of unprotected intercourse to prevent possible pregnancy. 2) Condom is the best form of contraception as it prevents both pregnancy and STDs. It must be used every time before sexual act.3) In case of emergency pill failure, I would advise you to go for urine test for pregnancy after 4 weeks of missed period. Hope this helps you.

Patient query: Hi doctor,My daughter had braces for four years but her midline is off and she has a gummy smile. Her bite is fine but her teeth are not properly aligned and she does not have bone on her left side. Her orthodontist referred her to a maxillofacial surgeon who says she needs her upper jaw broken and rotated clockwise and slightly up to compensate for the lack of bone and her bottom jaw also has to be broken and rotated clockwise. It would all then be held by plates and screws. My biggest concern is that she is a beautiful girl and he says that her face will not change at all. Is that true with this kind of procedure?
Doctor response: Hi, Thanks for writing in. This is an excellent question from your part. I can understand your concerns about the facial changes due to surgery. I would like to tell you that facial surgery is done to improve function or appearance of the face. Facial structures remain unchanged except some minor changes as mentioned above. So, there should be no major change in the face after facial surgery. However, if any change in the facial structure is noticed during the post-operative period, it can be reversed only by reoperation. So, my suggestion to you would be to get a thorough examination done by the maxillofacial surgeon before proceeding further. Hope this helps.

Patient query: Hello doctor,I am a 21 year old female. Yesterday, doctors have checked my blood. I am visiting a hospital frequently as I have iron deficiency anemia. The thing I am scared about is, my doctor asked me why my ferritin has not increased (just the opposite, it has decreased from 5.79 to 5.77) after three months of taking iron supplements. My other iron levels are at 39 which has increased considering those references. But, that was probably because I did not use the medicine correctly, I was only taking 5 mg a day. Another thing I am worried about is, my lymphocytes kind of got increased in my blood: (52.8) - the reference is 19.4 to 44.9, and the other one is 3.57. My neutrophils kind of decreased too (36.9) and the reference was between 41.0 to 73.0.In the last week, I had a viral infection as both my parents were sick. Is it why my levels got high? My WBC is 6.77 and RBC is 4.52. My hemoglobin is also increasing actually, last time I checked, it was 11.0 and now it is 11.2. Still low, but it was good to see that it was increasing. My thrombocyte levels got higher again, unfortunately. The first time I was told that I was anemic, my thrombocyte levels were on 485, then in my second blood test (after using iron supplements correctly it decreased to 380. And yesterday, when I checked, it increased to 435 (reference is 156 to 373).I was also told that I have an infection in my urinary system and he gave me antibiotics. Honestly, I have been always getting suspected about it since my anemia has started. Should I be worried about my condition or is it normal?
Doctor response: 1. Iron deficiency anemia may take long time to treat. It requires continuous follow up and treatment with iron supplementation. You need to continue your iron supplements for few more months before the results can be seen.2. Your hemoglobin level is gradually increasing. It will help you improve your energy level.3. Viral infection may cause your immunity to decrease and therefore increase the number of white cells in the body. This includes neutrophil and lymphocytes. So once the viral infection is treated the numbers should come down.4. Thrombocytosis may occur with the presence of any inflammation in the body. Inflammation may be due to virus, bacteria or parasites. So if you are having infection anywhere in the body it is possible that this could be the reason for your thrombocytosis. Hope I have answered your query. Let me know

Patient query: Hello doctor,What is HMD (hereditary macular degeneration) and what is the maximum possible impact of this disease in future on a person? Can this disease make one blind?
Doctor response: Hi, Thanks for writing to us. Hereditary Macular Degeneration (HMD) is an inherited eye disorder which causes progressive degeneration of the macula, that is the part of retina responsible for sharp vision. It is caused by mutations in genes called LMNA and CNGB3. This can lead to loss of central vision, but does not affect peripheral or side vision. The main symptom is blurring of vision. Treatment options include vitamin supplements, photodynamic therapy, laser treatment etc. Hope I have answered your query. Let me know if I can assist you further.

Patient query: Hello doctor,I have been diagnosed hypothyroid. I am currently taking WP Thyroid. I have taken Armour and Nature-thyroid. They all make me sick to my stomach. So better to avoid them.

Patient query: Hello doctor,I am a 46-year-old male. A month ago, I had a heart stroke and underwent angio for blood clotting thrombus. My CBC report at that time shows a platelet count at 24 lakhs. I received CALR Exon 9 mutation analysis report today. It reads "CALR Exon 9 mutation is detected by PCR amplification of Exon 9 of CALR, followed by sequencing of coding and junctional region of the Exon. The sequence is compared with the reference sequence NM-004343 for the analysis of mutations." Hematologist prescribed me Anagrelide 0.5 mg. Do I have to worry? Can it be cured by medication?
Doctor response: 1) The mutated gene in your case is called CALR (Congenital Amyloid Receptor). This type of mutation is associated with an increased risk of developing blood clots. 2) There are many different types of mutations and the treatment depends on the type of mutation you have. You should discuss this with your hematologist.3) In general, mutations that cause an increase in platelets can be treated with medicines like aspirin or clopidogrel.4) Mutations that decrease platelet production may require additional medicines such as anaglide. Hope this helps

Patient query: Hi doctor,My scar revision surgery is not healing well, and it seems worse than last week. Please see the attached picture. Involuntary frowning causes lines to run through the scar, can this be causing problems? Is it worth taping my forehead, so I cannot make frown lines? I cannot tell if it is this or the creasing making it worse. I am starting to get very depressed about this scar revision. It was bad enough getting mugged and getting this wound. Now it is not healing even after a scar revision surgery. Thanks.
Doctor response: 1) The scar is still redder than at first surgery. 2) It looks like a hypertrophied scar with thickness (not just color) 3) Vitamin C and silicon may help but it will take some time for them to work. 4) The creases in your face may cause more stress on the scar, so it may be best to wait until the scar has settled down before trying to do anything else.5) Botox would likely reduce facial movement which could lead to less creasing of the scar.6) You could try tape to prevent wrinkles from forming while healing.7) Taping alone won't fix a hypertrophied scar, but it should help reduce the amount of redness.8) I hope that helps.

Patient query: Hello doctor,I play games on my laptop for hours a day and after a few hours, my eyes become little blurry especially my left eye. Doctor response: Hi, Thanks for writing in. Your mothers symptoms seem to be related to proptosis of the eye only. Patient query: Hi doctor, My 2-year-old son is having a lot of trouble sleeping. He snores every night and tosses and turns and has trouble breathing through his nose. Doctor response: 1) sleep apnea is a common condition in kids with large tonsils & adenoids. The symptoms of sleep apnea include restlessness during sleep, loud snoring, frequent awakening from sleep, difficulty in breathing etc. You need to consult an ENT surgeon who may advise you to remove the tonsils or adenoids by way of surgical removal. 2) there is no harm in removing the tonsils if they cause obstruction to the airway while sleeping. As far as sleep apnea is concerned, it needs to be treated immediately to avoid long term complications like poor academic performance, behavioral problems, daytime sleepiness etc.3) the most appropriate treatment for sleep apnea is surgery to remove the tonsils/adenoids. However, your doctor might prescribe some medications before deciding for a surgery.

Doctor response: Hi, Welcome to Chat Doctor. I understand your concern regarding the height of your child. It is not unusual for a child to grow at different rates during infancy and early childhood, but it is important that parents become aware of the normal rate at which a child should grow. The average boy reaches his adult height by age 21 years. The average girl reaches her adult height by age 19 years. In general, boys reach their full growth potential sooner than girls. This means that boys usually attain their maximum height between ages 11-14 years while girls reach their maximum height between ages 9-13 years. At birth, the baby is approximately 25 cm in length (a little more than a foot) and weighs about 3.5 kg (7.7 pounds). By age 2, the baby has doubled its birth length and tripled its birth weight. By age 4, the baby will have reached

Patient query: Hello doctor,Seven years ago, I ruptured my right eardrum. I recently went to my doctor because I lost some of my hearing, and I have been having pains in my right ear. My doctor told me that the ear drum healed but there is a lot of scarring on it. Why is my eardrum hurting if it is improved?

Patient query: Hello doctor,The stomach blossoms without food, even in the morning. It is felt more in the upper part of the stomach.

Patient query: Hello doctor,I am getting a cardiac cath this morning. I am currently on Suboxone 12 mg, 6 in AM and 6 in PM. When I asked what they will be using to sedate, they said Fentanyl and Versed. I asked for Profol but got no answer. I spoke to a male nurse, not an anesthesiologist. If the Fenytal overrides the sub will I be in withdraw? Also, are there safety issues combining these medicines? Should I cancel this procedure?
Doctor response: The use of fentanyl is common during cardiac catheterization. It has been found that it does not affect the efficacy of the catheterization or the outcome. The use of Suboxone should not interfere with the use of fentanyl. Combining these medications may increase your risk for respiratory depression. However, you should discuss this with your physician as he/she will be able to assess if the benefits outweigh the risks. You can still have the procedure, however, you should be aware of the potential side effects of the medication.

Patient query: Hi doctor,I had unprotected sex on day 13 of my cycle and had an I-pill a day later. Again, I had sex in a gap of three days after the intake of tablet. I am really worried if I should take the pill again. This was a terrible mistake. Please help.
Doctor response: 1) You did not mention what kind of pill you took.2) The only thing that is important is the timing of the pill relative to your ovulation date or the time when you would have expected to ovulate. If the pill was taken prior to the release of your egg/ovulation then it will prevent pregnancy.3) But if you were already past the point of ovulating then there is no reason for you to worry as long as you do not become pregnant within the next 72 hours.4) The other thing to be concerned about is having any side effects from the pill like nausea, vomiting, breast tenderness etc. These symptoms usually start about 5-6 days after taking the pill.5) There is no reason to repeat the same mistake again.  Be more careful next time around.

Patient query: Hello doctor,I have an important query about the contraceptive pill. On the 2nd, my girlfriend started her period. It is now the 16th. So, I believe she is in her ovulation phase. Since her period stopped, she has begun, for the very first time, taking the combined contraceptive pill consistently at 8 AM every morning. She took the pill yesterday morning. Last night, on the 15th of March, we had unprotected sex (we thought one night without condoms would be fine). However, this morning she was in a rush and forgot to take her pill for today. It is 2:16 PM now and I have a few urgent questions:Should she take the morning after pill?How effective will the morning after pill be in protecting from pregnancy?How much will the pills previously taken lower the risk of pregnancy?Given her current stage of ovulation, what is the risk of her becoming pregnant? The period of time between the missed pill at 8 AM this morning and the time that she will take the morning-after pill (around 4 PM)?Do you recommend taking today's pill today if she is also taking the morning after pill today?Is there anything else we can do now to minimize the risk?Should we be worried?Thank you.
Doctor response: 1. No need to worry, she should not take emergency contraception. Emergency contraception is meant to prevent conception when it occurs around fertile days. But since she was already on birth control pills which are effective in preventing pregnancy, and even though she missed one day, it still provides protection against pregnancy. 2. Missing one day of pill does not reduce its efficacy. 3. Yes, she should avoid sexual intercourse until she starts her next pack of pills. 4. Pill reduces the probability of pregnancy by more than 90%. 5. She may get delayed menstruation with pill. 6. Morning after pill should not be used as regular means of contraception.

Patient query: Hello doctor,I am taking Paxidep 12.5 daily from last one and half year as prescribed by the doctor. It cures my uncontrolled thought and panic attacks. Now sometime I feel shocks in my head. I also want to know that, is there any side effect of this medicine after long time use?
Doctor response: 1/31Paxidep is a benzodiazepine which has sedative and anxiolytic effects. It can be used for short term relief of anxiety symptoms. It should not be taken for more than six months without consulting your psychiatrist because it may cause dependence or addiction. Dependence means physical tolerance develops, so that same dose doesn't work anymore. Also, if stopped suddenly, withdrawal symptoms like dizziness, tremors etc. occur. So I advise you to visit your psychiatrist soon and get evaluated.

Patient query: Hello doctor,I am 18 years old. I did an 8-week cycle that ended 14 days ago. Doctor response: 1. Your concern is very valid, as there are plenty of adverse effects associated with anabolic steroid use.2. It has been suggested that steroids can cause premature closure of epiphyses, which may lead to short stature in adult life.3. Other long term side effects include gonadal atrophy and testicular failure, which may result in infertility.4. Anabolic steroids also affect liver enzyme levels, which can lead to hepatotoxicity.5. Short-term effects include acne, oily skin, hair loss, aggression, irritability, behavioral changes, depression etc.6. So if you want to go ahead with this, I suggest you to consult a qualified physician who will advise you accordingly. Hope this helps. Regards
