Patient query: Hello doctor,I have a continuous stuffy nose which gives me brief dizzy spells that go once I try to blow my nose (not hard). It just helps equalize pressure. My glucose, BP, heart tests are normal. I eat and drink regularly. I work in a dusty environment. The dizziness is definitely associated with congestion. How can I stop it?
Doctor response: Hello, and thanks for using Chat Doctor! In my opinion, there are two main causes of this problem:1-Allergies2-Vascular problems. Allergy symptoms like nasal congestions are common with rhinitis (allergic sinusitis). This could be due to any allergen such as pollen, mold, dust, food or pet dander. In order to reduce these symptoms, you should avoid exposure to allergens, use antihistamines such as levocetrizine or fexofenadine, and use nasal corticosteroids (fluticasone) if required. Vascular problems may also lead to similar symptoms. These include low blood pressure and low blood sugar. For these conditions, I would recommend consulting your primary care physician for further evaluation and treatment. Hope this answers your question. Please feel free to contact us again for any other health

Patient query: Hello doctor,Can a CT scan identify liver metastasis?
Doctor response: Yes, it can be done. A CT scan is one of the most common tests used to detect liver metastases. It is also a non-invasive test and does not require any radiation exposure. A normal CT scan means that there are no signs of metastatic disease. However, it may show a number of other abnormalities in the liver including: hepatitis, cirrhosis, fatty liver, fibrosis, cysts etc. So if there are no signs of liver metastases on a CT scan, then it is unlikely that they exist.

Patient query: Hello doctor,I have a problem. My teeth are brittle because if I eat something hard they sometimes break or I would feel a hole developing and this is stressing me out because I have already taken out three of them and now another one is close to being totaled. Earlier today I ate something and I think it damaged them. I am tired of taking them out.
Doctor response: Hi, Welcome to Chat Doctor forum. I understand your concern. At present, there is no way to prevent tooth decay in permanent teeth. The only alternative is to remove the tooth and replace it with an artificial substitute called dentures. Denture can be made from acrylic resin (plastic) or metal alloys such as gold, palladium, nickel, etc. They are designed to fit over the gums and provide a natural-looking smile. In some cases, however, dentures may need to be relined every few years to maintain a proper fit. Relining is a procedure done in the dentist office where new denture material is placed over the existing denture. It is not a complicated process and does not require any special preparation. You should consult your dentist for further information and treatment. Hope this helps. Take care.

Patient query: Hello doctor,I have minor beta thalassemia which I got from my mother, but unlike her (asymptomatic), I have anemia symptoms like paleness, shortness of breath after the least effort, feeling tired all the time, broken nails and I want to know if it could be due to lack of iron? Doctor response: 1. Iron deficiency can cause anemia in any person.2. Thalassemia does not cause iron deficiency as such.3. But since your hemoglobin is low, you might require frequent blood transfusions.4. As you mentioned that you get heavy periods, so check for hormonal imbalances.5. You need to take nutritional supplements like vitamin B complex, vitamin D, calcium etc.6. You should also increase the intake of green leafy vegetables and fruits.7. Eating more meat as well as eggs will help you.8. Since your diet is poor, you can start taking health supplements containing essential nutrients.9. You can consult a physician or a nutritionist regarding this. Hope I have answered your query. Let me know if I can assist you further.

How do I tell, if these are pregnancy symptoms or if it is because of the Depo shot? I did miss my last shot three months ago. Last month I took a home pregnancy test it came back negative. Will a home test be enough to tell if I am pregnant or not?
Doctor response: Hi, Thanks for posting your query. The symptoms you have mentioned can be due to Depo Provera injection but there is no way to confirm this as there is no blood test available to detect the presence of progesterone in blood. A urine pregnancy test will help to exclude pregnancy. In case you are still having doubts you can go for serum Chat Doctor test which will give you an accurate result. Hope this helps.

Patient query: Hello doctor,I had stomach pain after which my report was confirmed as gallbladder stones. What is the further procedure? Please let me know all the details, including the cost.
Doctor response: 1. Gall bladder stone removal is done by either of the two procedures. Laparoscopic cholecystectomy or open surgery. 2. Cost depends upon the hospital and surgeon and also whether it is laparoscopic or open surgery. In general, laparoscopy costs more than open surgery.3. Laparoscopic surgery is less invasive and has faster recovery time, but there may be some complications like infection, port site hernia etc.4. Open surgery has longer incision and recovery period is slower, but there is lesser risk of complication. Hope I have answered your question. Let me know if I can assist you further.

Patient query: Hello doctor,My 24 days newborn son is suffering from midgut malrotation. Is this a problem?
Doctor response: 1. Yes it can be treated by surgery or medical management.2. Midgut malrotation occurs when the intestines fail to rotate into their normal position in the abdomen while they are developing in the womb and after birth.3. The condition can cause an obstruction of the intestine and possibly even death if not treated promptly.4. It may also lead to other problems such as failure to thrive, vomiting, diarrhea, jaundice and blood in stool.5. Surgical repair is usually recommended at 6-8 weeks of age.6. Medical management consists of giving supplemental feeds through a tube placed directly into the small intestine (NASOGASTRIC TUBE) for few days until the baby has recovered from the crisis.7. Hope I have answered your query. Let me know if I can assist you further.

If it does not come down to normal then you may need surgery.

Patient query: Hello doctor,I am a 61 year old female and a diabetic for the last ten years. I had a cystocele repair surgery along with hysterectomy and cervix and ovaries removal five months ago. There is a slight discharge on and off. I did a urine culture now and found that there was a colony of Enterococcus faecalis. Please let me know if this is serious and whether I have to take a course of antibiotics for it. I do not have any symptoms of UTI or abscess etc. Also, the cystocele repair was not a success as the bladder is still at the mouth of the vagina. Please also let me know if anything can be done to put the bladder back in place. If this is not done, what are the repercussions?
Doctor response: 1) Enterococcal bacteria usually cause no harm unless they get into your bloodstream.2) You need to take an antibiotic like vancomycin to clear up the infection.3) A successful repair of the cystocele depends upon the size of the defect and the amount of scar tissue.4) In some cases the bladder needs to be moved back into its normal position by doing a procedure called a sling.5) Usually the cystocele gets better over time but may require more than one operation.

Patient query: Hi doctor,I have been with the same partner for 8 years now. During these all 8 years I have had several UTIs with some leading to severe kidney infections. Last week after almost two years of not having a UTI I felt the horrible symptoms again. When going to the doctors UTI urine test came back positive. The doctor prescribed me seven days Nitrofurantoin antibiotics which cleared the pain and seemed gone entirely. Unfortunately two days later, the symptoms came back (please note that I had sex with my partner the day before) with burning sensation when urinating and painful when standing with the need to go toilet every 2 to 3 minutes. I went back to the clinic the same day to get it checked and take more antibiotics.But to my surprise, the urine test came back clear for UTI, and my symptoms disappeared. Then the doctor advised me to get tested for Chlamydia as the symptoms can sometimes be mistaken to be UTI. I have been diagnosed with Chlamydia at the beginning of this same relationship and was treated for it. My partner was also tested, but his results came back negative. Is it possible that the treatment that I had for Chlamydia 8 years ago did not clear it entirely and this lead to several UTIs and kidney infections? And also, would the antibiotics for UTI clear Chlamydia? Thank you in advance for your help.
Doctor response: 1. In your case, there is no doubt that the cause of repeated UTI is Chlamydia trachomatis. It is a bacterial infection that causes inflammation of urethra and bladder wall. The symptoms you describe are typical of Chlamydia infection.2. This is why I advise you to take azithromycin or doxycycline for 7-10 days. These medications are effective against chlamydia infection.3. If you do not take any medicines and start sexual activity with another person, the infection will recur again.4. The antibiotic you took earlier might not have cured the infection completely. So you should repeat the course of medicine.5. You should continue using condoms during sexual activity till the infection has completely subsided.

Patient query: Hello doctor,I am 42 years old and have been diagnosed with multiple uterine fibroids. Two of them are a little more than 3 cm at different places in the uterus. Patient query: Hi doctor,I sat on my testicle before two months, and I experienced an initial sharp pain for a few hours. I went to the ER and did a blood test, urine test and an ultrasound. Torsion, as well as infection, was ruled out.The exact incident occurred before few days. I did a urine test and another ultrasound. Torsion was ruled out once again. When the pain flared up again, I went to the doctor back. Again, I did an ultrasound, urine test, and blood test. Torsion and infection were ruled once again.The doctor pointed out a little bit of fluid around my testicle, and I had no pain. But, still, I have pain in my testicle. What was ruled out with these tests? From where does the pain arises?
Doctor response: 1) The pain may be due to epididymitis. Epididymis is a small coiled tube at the back of each testicle which stores and carries sperm from the testicles to the vas deferens. Inflammation of epididymis causes pain and swelling over the scrotum.2) Testicular torsion is when the testicle twists on itself and cuts off its own blood supply.3) Orchids is inflammation of the testicle, causing pain and redness.4) Testicular cancer can also cause pain in one or both testicles.5) There are many other conditions that can cause testicle pain including STDs, prostatitis, kidney stones, etc.

After my periods, I still had the symptoms.Nearly a month later, I got my periods again, but on the first day I had severe cramps and used a tampon. On the third day, there was a slight discharge which was brown in color. On the fourth day, there was some bleeding, but not at night. Today would be day five, and I still do not see blood. My main concern is that my vagina feels different. It is more firm than usual and feels tight. I sometimes feel a pulling sensation. Could it be due to the morning-after pills? I did home pregnancy tests, and it came back negative. It has been a month and 18 days now, since the intercourse.
Doctor response: The symptoms may be related to the use of emergency contraception. A period of irregular bleeding with spotting is common after using this method. The tightening feeling might be related to the hormonal changes in your body. However, if you have any other concerns or problems, it is best to consult a gynecologist. Hope I have answered your question. Let me know if I can assist you further.

Patient query: Hello doctor,I am a 29-year-old female. I was just diagnosed with chronic urticaria. I went to an allergic specialist for skin testing because my skin was so sensitive I reacted to everything. They then did the RAST test on me. Everything came out class 0 except for egg white, wheat, and oats being class 2 and milk, and hazelnut being class 1. Can these cause anaphylaxis? How accurate are the RAST test? I was put on an elimination diet but the hives are still there. I occasionally get angioedema with it also. Can angiodema cause anaphylaxis? As you can see I am so scared for my throat to close up that I am scared to eat anything. I have only been eating a couple of things daily and live off that.
Doctor response: 1. The RAST test is very specific and usually accurate. However, the sensitivity of the test depends upon the level of antibody in your blood. So when they say that the level of allergen is less than certain amount, it doesn't mean that you will not be reactive to it. You may be mildly or moderately reactive to it. 2. Angiodema is not a common complication of food allergy and anaphylaxis. It is more likely to occur due to insect stings or some medications like beta-blockers etc.

Patient query: Hi doctor,I have a generic query. Can we trust the NABL and CAP accreditation laboratories in terms of reliability and accuracy? And what does they mean? And all NABL and CAP labs are of same quality? Please explain in detail.

Patient query: Hello doctor,I am 32 years old and had an herinated disc and had surgery a few years back, it was a post delayed surgery. Due to the delay in surgery (18 days) I left with a foot drop and right leg weakness. I was bedridden for 4 months. Totally weak. But I gradually developed doing physiotheraphy and with some Ayurvedic treatment. I started waking now with out any help. But my foot drop is still there. But I can lift my toe and ankle little bit from last month. Can I come to my normal life, how long I need to wait to get cured from foot drop?
Doctor response: 18 days is too much time for surgery. The best thing would be to get an MRI scan done and see if the nerves have been damaged or not. If they haven't then no problem. If they have then you may require another surgery. In either case you will need physio therapy which should take approximately 6 weeks before you start walking normally again. It all depends upon your recovery rate but it takes at least 6 weeks.

Patient query: Hello doctor,I was at the dentist yesterday and had a gum cleaning and now today there are 2 bumps in the back of my mouth on top and my gums right there also look red and there more looking like balls per say.
Doctor response: 1) The two lumps on the back of your palate could be due to inflammation of the gingival or gums. It is caused by plaque accumulation around the teeth and gums resulting in inflammatory response from body. This is called gingivitis and can be treated with mechanical removal of the plaque/tartar. 2) The redness you see on the gums is due to the same reason. You need to remove the plaque/tartar regularly and maintain good oral hygiene.3) If this does not improve then you may require antibiotics as well. Patient query: Hello doctor, I have observed a white smegma on my penis head. There were irritation and red bumps on it before, but I oiled it so now I do not have any pain or irritation. Doctor response: 100% welcome to Chat Doctor forum. I am sorry about your problem. You need to take care of this problem as soon as possible because it may lead to serious complications. Smegma is a natural lubricant that keeps the area around the glans of the penis moist and protected from friction and injury. It is produced by the sebaceous glands present in the skin of the penis. The normal color of smegma varies depending upon the amount of exposure to air. It can range from light yellowish-brown to black. It is common for people to notice more smegma when they are sexually aroused. This is due to increased secretion of sebum from the sebaceous glands. White smegma means that there is something wrong with your body, either it is an allergy or some other disease. I suggest you go to your physician for examination and proper treatment.

Patient query: Hello doctor,I recently tested positive for HIV and had a viral load test which was 160k and CD4 count of 145. My issue now is with how I could have contracted the virus. Doctor response: Hi dear, HIV can be transmitted through unprotected sex, needle sharing, blood transfusion or accidental prick by infected needles. It can also be transmitted from mother to child during pregnancy and breastfeeding. The possibility of transmission via dental procedure is very less as per the data available. You should know that the immune system is damaged by the virus only when it reaches the lymph nodes where the cells are destroyed. So if your viral load is high then you might get infected, so I will advise you to start treatment early to prevent further damage to the body. Thanks

Patient query: Hello doctor,My mother was diagnosed with breast cancer early this year. She underwent MRM surgery and now undergoing chemotherapy. Patient query: Hello doctor,If both the testes experience a reduction in blood supply (and thus oxygen and hormones), in the long run will it increase the risk of more spontaneous mutation present in sperms as lesser blood supply will affect the DNA replication and repairing ability of spermatogonial cells?
Doctor response: Hi, Thanks for writing to Chat Doctor. Yes, reduced blood supply to the testicles can lead to increased chance of genetic abnormalities in sperms. As the blood supply is reduced, there is less oxygen and nutrients available to the testicles, which leads to decrease in the number of sperm producing cells (spermatogonia) in the testis. These cells divide into other types of cells which give rise to germ cells like spermatocytes and spermatids. Increase in number of these cells leads to chromosomal abnormality in sperms, which may be transmitted to offspring leading to genetic disorders. Hope I have answered your question. Let me know if I can assist you further.

Patient query: Hi doctor,My chief complaint is severe lower back pain and pain in upper thighs. My medical history is as follows. Before three years, I had FNAC which showed invasive ductal carcinoma, right breast ER+, PR+, Hercep score "0." Last month, I had an x-ray and MRI, which showed focal altered marrow intensity lesions seen in B/L pelvic bone, sacrum, and left upper femoral shaft consistent with metastasis. I also had a PET scan which showed metabolically active ill-defined lytic destructive lesions in post cortex shaft of left femur, right inferior pubic ramus, B/L iliac bones, sacrum, D5, 7, 11 and L1, 4, sternum, right 3, 5, 7 post ribs with mid-right paravertebral soft tissue lesion at D7 level likely metastasis.
Doctor response: 1) Osteoporosis is due to low calcium intake and lack of physical activity. You should take calcium supplements and do regular exercise.2) The treatment depends upon the type of cancer. For example, if it is breast cancer then you will need hormonal therapy (aromatase inhibitors).3) The other possible cause could be due to radiation therapy. Radiation induced fibrosis can occur after radiation therapy for many types of cancer including breast, prostate, thyroid, lung and skin cancer. It causes chronic pain and stiffness in the joints and muscles. In your case, the symptoms may be due to this. Hope I have answered your query. Let me know if I can assist you further.

Patient query: Hello doctor,I would like to get a third opinion in regard to categorizing which uterine abnormality I possess. The initial doctor said it is arcuate. My current doctor thinks it is bicornuate but I am going to do a 3D ultrasound in the middle of my next cycle to get a better idea. I have MRI and hysteroscopy photos to provide. I have had two missed miscarriages, the last one hemorrhaged two days before going septic and sent me to the ER for five days. I have also been diagnosed with a placental site nodule on my right side where both pregnancies have been. Could my problem be surgically corrected?Currently, we are going through genetic, blood clotting disorder, and menstrual cycle/hormone monitoring. Genetic counselor said low risk for any genetic causes but is still waiting to complete the blood tests which should be done in four weeks, same for the blood clotting tests.
Doctor response: 1) The arcuate uterus has an elliptical shape instead of being a circle. It appears as if a part of the uterus is missing, when viewed from above. 2) Bicornuate uterus is a congenital malformation of the uterus that occurs in about 4% of women. It looks like there is a cleft or split in the uterus into two parts. This can cause problems with implantation and early pregnancy loss. 3) A placental site nodule is a benign lesion that usually presents as a single, smooth, raised lesion in the lower uterine segment. It may be associated with increased risk of preterm birth, but this needs to be confirmed by further evaluation.

Patient query: Hello doctor,I am a 30-year-old female. A thyroid profile done recently shows the TSH at 1.95, T4 at 13.9, and T3 at 113. I am on Eltroxin 100 mcg and folic acid. I am planning for pregnancy. Please advice.
Doctor response: Hi there,The current levels of your hormones are within normal range, so you need not worry about them. However, if you want to conceive, it is best to try to keep the level of TSH below 2.5. This can be achieved by reducing the dose of Eltroxin or increasing the dose of levothyroxine. In addition, you should also increase the dose of vitamin B12 (injection) as well as folic acid supplementation. The other issue that needs attention is your weight. You should aim to maintain a body mass index between 18.5-24.9 kg/m^2. As long as you have no other health issues such as high blood pressure or diabetes, you should be able to conceive without any problems. Hope this helps.

Patient query: Hello doctor,I suppose to get the sleeve bariatric surgery and I was taking Adepix and I stopped it a week ago. Doctor response: 1. Yes, your surgeon is correct.3-month gap between Adepix use & surgery is recommended.2. No, Adepix does not affect anesthesia. Patient query: Hello doctor,The gums where my wisdom tooth is present is in pain.
Doctor response: Hi, I am sorry that your wisdom teeth are causing you pain and discomfort. The wisdom teeth erupt at an angle towards the opposing molar and if there is not enough space for them then they get impacted or stuck in the jaw bone. This can cause swelling, pain and difficulty with chewing due to pressure on adjacent teeth. You need to visit a dentist for treatment. In some cases extraction of the wisdom teeth may be required. Please do not delay as this will only worsen the situation.

Patient query: Hi doctor,I had unprotected sex with my partner without any penetration. I rubbed my penis over her vagina. I might have a little semen present in it. She usually has a periods cycle of 33 to 35 days. But her periods got delayed this month. Is she pregnant? Why is there a delay in her periods? Is there any typical food available to bring her periods on time?
Doctor response: 1) You should be aware that pre-cum contains sperm and can result in pregnancy if ejaculated into the vagina.2) It is possible for your girlfriend to get pregnant, but unlikely. The reason being is that it takes about 7 days before ovulation occurs after the start of her period, so even though she may have had intercourse near the time of ovulation (which is when fertilization is most likely), it is still not likely that she would be pregnant. 3) In general, having unprotected sex during the first week of a menstrual cycle will increase the chance of becoming pregnant compared to other times in the cycle because ovulation occurs around day 14 of the cycle. 4) There is no specific diet that can help induce a period. However, some women find that eating more fruits and vegetables helps regulate their cycles.

Patient query: Hi doctor,I am a 20 year old girl and have a small vaginal opening. My husband and I hardly have sex because it hurts me so badly. What can I do to stop it from being so painful?
Doctor response: 1) Please get an examination done by your gynecologist for any possible abnormality in your genital tract like polyp/fibroid/endometriosis etc., 2) The best way to avoid pain during intercourse is to use the pillow under the hips and lie down on the back with the pelvis raised up. This will reduce the pressure on the vagina and make penetration easier.3) Another option would be to try different sexual positions. Try lying on your side or stomach instead of the back. This may help to create more space between the vagina and rectum as well as decrease the weight of the vagina on the cervix.4) Avoid using lubricants and condoms which can further aggravate the problem.5) Always start with foreplay before penetrative sex. Foreplay helps relax the muscles in the vagina and makes them less sensitive

The treatment depends upon the type of infection you are suffering from. For active infections like acute hepatitis B, interferon alpha or lamivudine (antiviral agents) should be given for a period of six months to one year. Patient query: Hi doctor,I am 9 months pregnant, and I have some doubts with my recent free T3, T4, and TSH levels. My Triiodothyronine total (T3) is 208.57. What is it? Is it something to worry or is it normal? My TSH is under control, and it is 2.63 now.
Doctor response: 1. The normal range for Free Thyroxin levels in pregnancy is 0.9-1.8 mcg/DL. Your level of Free Thyroxin is slightly higher than the normal range, but not by much. However, if your symptoms are suggesting that you may be hypothyroid, then you should get your thyroid hormone levels checked again after delivery.2. Please remember that the results of your blood tests will vary from lab to lab. So, don't compare your test result with someone else's.

Patient query: Hello doctor,My friend started vomiting last night and I noticed that his eyelids were red and bruised. Is there something else besides the vomiting that could have caused the bruised eyelids?
Doctor response: 1) If he is taking any medication or blood thinner (Anti-coagulant), then it can cause bleeding in eyes.2) Due to the vomiting, the blood vessels in eyes get dilated and hence they appear red.3) It can be due to allergic reaction as well.4) The most common cause of this condition is called "Conjunctival Pemphigoid" which is an autoimmune disease where antibodies attack conjunctiva causing redness, swelling, pain and tearing.5) In such cases, the best treatment option is to apply steroid eye drops under your doctors guidance. Hope this helps you. Thanks!

Patient query: Hello doctor,I had a chest x-ray and chest ct scan done. And they both came back normal. If I had emphysema would it have shown up on one of those two tests?
Doctor response: Hi, Dear,Welcome to Chat Doctor. I am Chat Doctor. Navigate through my answer. Emphysema is not visible on X-ray or CT scan. It might be seen if there is an infection of lungs like pneumonia, which can lead to consolidation (collection of pus) in lung. So, your test results are normal. You need to consult pulmonologist for clinical examination and PFT (Pulmonary Function Test). PFT will help in diagnosis of emphysema along with other diseases like asthma, bronchitis etc. Hope above information helps you. If you find this reply helpful do rate it. Thank you.

Patient query: Hi doctor,I am a 19-year-old female. I lost my virginity about 10 months ago with my boyfriend. Now after 10 months has passed I found out that I have two warts inside my vagina. It is white color although, the one on the top started to have a slight pink color. But the second one on the bottom which is much smaller still has completely white color and around the vagina blades, I have a little while dots. Also, there are very tiny warts line along the blades. So, when I went to see the GP near my house he had a look and said that there is nothing to worry it is still small. But in my opinion, I think it is quite big. So the doctor gave me a prescription for Condyline paint which he told me to use for three days only per week and I have to keep using it for three weeks and if it does not get better he told me to see him again. Now I have a few questions. Is this mean I have an HPV virus inside my body? How can I make the virus go away permanently? Will Gardasil injection make it go away? If it does not go away permanently, how can I make sure that I have no HPV viruses and so these warts will not come back again? Is this mean that I have this HPV from my boyfriend? How to use Condyline paint correctly? I wash my vagina blades and use the cotton pads to dry it, then I use start to use the Condyline paint. I only dip the swab once into the reagent and then I open my vagina blades so that I am able to paint the two warts inside my vagina as much as I can. Then I paint it all over the very tiny warts in the vagina blades area. Am I doing it correctly?Now I have been using the Condyline for two days, but the very tiny warts that are around the vagina blades started to grow more. Is this mean anything? Can condoms prevent these HPV viruses? If I break up with my boyfriend, will this help my symptoms and health to become better? I am very scared of whether this can leads to cancer? I do not want this to ever happen to me again, how can I prevent this to happen again?If my warts are gone can I have sex with my boyfriend? Will these symptoms comeback again? If I decided to buy the Gardasil injection and injected it now, then the next after two months, then next after six months, but during this time can I have sex with my boy friend? Will the vaccine still work?
Doctor response: 1. No, HPV is a common problem among young people. Most people who have it never know they have it because they never develop any problems or symptoms.  2. You should be screened for other STDs like Chlamydia and Gonorrhea. 3. Yes, condom may protect against some STDs, but it won't protect against HPV. 4. You cannot get rid of HPV by using condyloma paints. 5. The best way to prevent HPV is to practice safe sex including the use of condoms. 6. Gardasil prevents most strains of HPV. 7. Yes, you can resume having sex with your boyfriend.

Patient query: Hello doctor,I am a 25-year-old male and I have never been able to fully retract my penis. I have severe phimosis. It can occur as a result of allergic reaction to certain substances such as soap, bubble bath, underwear etc., or may be genetically inherited. In some cases, the opening may not close properly after birth.2) Phimosis is usually diagnosed by physical examination. You need to see a physician who will examine your penis to confirm the diagnosis.3) Treating phimosis involves removing the prepuce (foreskin) and cutting away any scar tissue present. This is known as circumcision.4) Blue colored veins around the glans are normal in appearance and are related to blood circulatory system. They do not indicate

Patient query: Hi doctor,I was diagnosed with TID 14 years back. I will run out of Lantus before the next shipment arrives, but I have plenty of Novolog on hand. My daily dose is 32.5 units Lantus at 10 AM and 12.5 units at 8 PM, with a sliding scale for Novolog (typically 0 to 6 units). What dosage or schedule would you recommend for temporarily relying on Novolog only?
Doctor response: 1) For type 1 diabetes, the recommended treatment is insulin therapy.2) You need to give yourself regular injections of insulin throughout the day according to your blood sugar levels.3) The amount of insulin depends upon the blood sugar levels at different times of the day and also on other factors like age, weight and physical activity.4) The most common types of insulins used are rapid acting insulin (such as Novorapid) which is given before meals. Long-acting insulin (such as Humalog or Lantus) which is given once or twice each day.5) In case if you miss any injection then take that dose immediately after you remember it and then continue with the regular schedule.6) To know more about diet and exercise regimen consult a physician.

Patient query: Hello doctor,I am a 57-year-old female. Patient query: Hi doctor,I am a 49-year-old woman and last month I was hospitalized with a necrotizing soft tissue infection on my thigh. I had two debridement surgeries and was discharged after 5 days. I was treated with about 4 IV antibiotics. I do not remember them all, I recall seeing Vancomycin and Penicillin. I was told that the infection was not MRSA, but a "slower moving bacteria" they did not tell me what it was. I was swabbed for MRSA in my nose and butt before both surgeries and was told I did not have it. For the last day of my stay, I had a roommate who had a bad MRSA infection on her butt and sometimes had diarrhea incontinence during dressing changes. I had no physical contact with her, but we had the same nurse. I was discharged with a five day course of Augmentin.The wound has been healing very well and has not gotten infected, but three weeks after discharge I got an abscess under my arm. I went to an urgent care and was prescribed Clindamycin and told to return in three days for drainage. The abscess did not improve or get worse over the three days. I got it drained and was prescribed Augmentin and told to also continue the clindamycin. That was a week ago and the wound is healing well. They called today and said cultures show it was MRSA and they prescribed Bactrim and told me to stop the other antibiotics.I am feeling devastated by this and wanting to understand why it happened. Could I have gotten it in the hospital? I am concerned that it will not go away. Are those swabs at the hospital conclusive and mean for sure I did not have MRSA a month ago? I have never had any medical problems before and these experiences have been very frightening. Is there anything else I can do to prevent recurrence? I have read about everything from bleach baths and hibiclens to antibiotics in the nose.
Doctor response: 1) MRSA is a superbug and is resistant to most of the antibiotics in use today. It is spread through direct contact with the skin lesions of someone carrying the bug or through contact with contaminated surfaces. Most hospitals routinely screen patients for MRSA colonization of their nasal cavity, mouth, and anal region.2) MRSA is usually resistant to penicillin and vancomycin, so if your infections were treated with those medications then you probably didn't have MRSA.3) You can take measures to avoid getting MRSA again like using hand sanitizer frequently, keeping your hands clean, doing regular baths with bleach water, avoiding contact with people who have visible skin lesions, wearing gloves when touching broken skin, etc. Hope this helps

Patient query: Hello doctor,I am a sufferer of hemiplegic migraine. However, I had unusual collapses three months back. The first one was 40 minutes; I could not recall the whole of that period. I came back with an injured knee and felt dazed. I was fine after around two hours. The next day, I felt pressure in my head and as though I was about to die. I then could not recall getting home or the rest of the night. I was fine in the morning. Two days later, I felt horrendous pain in my head, felt like I was swimming, then tried to go home and again could not recall from deciding to go home to around two hours later and I was foggy for the rest of the night. I have had constant pain in the left side of my head above the temple for four years. It does not go. However, In the past two weeks, I have felt like it is throbbing and at times about to burst out. I was meant to see my neurologist three months back, but his receptionist did not follow the recommendation, and now I am unsure whether to have the tests done. I feel like we are playing with my life. Usually, I am pretty relaxed about the possibilities and know it is a migraine. But this feels different. This feels like intense throbbing above my ear from the temple along towards the back of my head, with a pain in my ear to just behind my jaw under my ear. My instinct says that an aneurysm needs ruling out. I do not know if I am just upset because it feels so different and this pressure is intense. It is a weird feeling. I currently take Sumatriptan as needed.Please, can you advise what to do? As it stands the next neuro appointment is after four months, added complication is that I have been breathless and unable to climb stairs without stopping and panting for past four months. I am having heart tests on the weekend. But, what do I do about my brain?
Doctor response: Hi, Thanks for writing in. Aneurysms need to be ruled out by Doppler ultrasound scan of the carotid artery. You should get your blood pressure checked regularly. This is important since high blood pressure can cause aneurysms. Please also check your cholesterol levels which may increase risk for aneurysm formation. Your symptoms seem to suggest migraines. There are medications available for them. Please get examined by a neurologist and discuss these options.

Patient query: Hello doctor,I am 32 years old and unmarried. I am a patient of PCOD. I also have a family history of breast cancer. My father\s sister had breast cancer recently. I am in a very big financial crisis. So, one of my friends suggested me to donate eggs. Will it be risky if I donate my eggs only once? As I am a patient of PCOD, will I be able to conceive in the future? Will I be given some hormonal treatment to conceive later? Please advise me whether I should proceed with the idea of egg donation. Is there any chance of developing breast or ovarian cancer if I donate eggs? Please guide me. I just want to know about its long term consequences as I am afraid of breast and ovarian cancer.
Doctor response: 1) Egg donation is not considered to be associated with increased risk for breast or ovarian cancer.2) However, because of your family history of breast cancer, you may need to undergo genetic testing (such as BRCA1/BRCA2 mutations) before considering egg donation.3) You can discuss this with your treating gynecologist.4) The decision to pursue egg donation should be based upon your own personal preference and the potential benefits that could result from such an action.

Patient query: Hello doctor, I am having too many health issues for the last three weeks. I feel sleepy all the time even I sleep eight hours already. But if you don't have any other symptoms then this would not be causing your fatigue.2) The high platelet count is also not likely to cause your fatigue.3) Your hemoglobin is quite low and may be leading to fatigue.4) You do not seem to have any signs of cardiac or cerebrovascular disease.5) Blood thinners are not indicated.6) I suggest that you consult your primary care doctor who can examine you, order more tests and treat your condition appropriately.

Patient query: Hi, doctor I am 13 weeks pregnant last week I undergone for NT scan the report was normal and the same time I gave double marker blood test. Yesterday from the hospital they called me for blood test because the first report shows abnormal. I am so scared whether second time double marker test shows normal. They didn\t give the report of first test but simply told first test was abnormal so we sending for second time. I am confused. Please tell me whether second time test shows normal result. If it is abnormal is there is any early treatment to protect the baby from down syndrome.
Doctor response: 1) The first test that you did not get the results of, would have been an ultrasound and fetal nuchal translucency (NT). This is the one that is used to screen for Down syn Chat Doctor. 2) The second test that you do have the results of, is a serum biochemistry/serum protein analysis, which looks at various other things like thyroid function, hemoglobin levels etc., and also gives the chromosomes of the fetus. 3) So, what your doctor means by "abnormal" is that the NT was outside the normal range, and that the second test has come back with a normal result. 4) There is no way to prevent or treat Down syn Chat Doctor.

Patient query: Hi doctor,What is the difference between IntraLasik and Contoura Lasik?
Doctor response: Both IntraLASIK and Contour LASIK are forms of laser-assisted refractive surgery that use an excimer laser to correct nearsightedness, farsightedness, or astigmatism by reshaping the cornea. The main differences between these two procedures include the type of laser used, the amount of tissue removed, the accuracy of the procedure, the depth of correction possible, and the cost. IntraLASIK uses a femtosecond laser instead of a microkeratome to create a flap in the cornea. This laser is more precise than the microkeratome and can be programmed for individualized treatment plans. It also allows for greater depth of correction and is considered safer because it eliminates the possibility of an accidental cut caused by the microkeratome. Contour LASIK uses a different type of excimer laser. Its advantage over In

Patient query: Hi doctor,I started with the gym last week. I trained myself at home for a few weeks. After going to the gym, I began to have pain in the knees. It hurts me a lot. I am unable to do squats for a week. I tried to fix it, and nothing helped me. I do not know what to do. Please help.

Doctor response: Hi, Welcome to Chat Doctor forum. I understand your concern. The X-ray is done to find out the status of the pulp in the tooth. If there is any inflammation or infection, it will be detected by the X-ray. In this case if the X-ray shows that there is inflammation or infection in the pulp, then the tooth has to be extracted. This is what happens in case of dead pulp. But as the root canal treatment is successful, the tooth can be saved. So don't worry about it. You should continue your regular visit to the Dentist. Thanks.

Patient query: Hi doctor,I have a small freckle about 3-4 mm on the side of my foot. It is not different from my skin in appearance. It just seems to be a brown blemish. I think, I have it for a number of years and now I am a bit anxious about what it could be. Thank you.

Patient query: Hello doctor,I am 33 years old, male. I am diagnosed with right adhesive otitis with left SOM. Already mastoidectomy was done in right ear nine years back and two myringotomies in right ear when I was 4 and 7 years of age. I have CT scan report, audiometry, impedance test results.
Doctor response: Hi, Welcome to Chat Doctor. I understand your concern regarding the hearing loss. The most common causes for hearing loss are Otis media and OTIS externa. Otis media is an inflammation of middle ear, which may be due to bacterial or viral infection. It can lead to conductive hearing loss. In severe cases it can cause sensorineural hearing loss also. OTIS external is an infection of ear canal. It is usually caused by fungus. It leads to conductive hearing loss also. You should consult ENT specialist and get evaluated. He will examine your ears and suggest treatment accordingly. Hope this helps. Take care

Patient query: Hi doctor,I have a sore throat on one side of my throat. But, after looking, it looks like a sore next to my throat on the roof of my mouth. What could it be?
Doctor response: Hi thanks for contacting us. You might be having aphthous ulcer or herpes infection. Aphthous ulcers usually occur at the corner of the mouth. They can also occur on the tongue and other areas inside your mouth. Herpes simplex causes cold sores around the lips. It is caused by the herpes simplex virus type 1 (HSV-1). Risk factors include stress, illness, sun exposure, and trauma to the area. These lesions may become infected with bacteria. This will cause painful swelling that may extend into your cheek. The treatment involves antiviral medications such as acyclovir. I would suggest consulting an oral surgeon/dentist. Hope this helps

Patient query: im a 14 year old child . My concern is that i only have 24 set of teeth , 1 is growing at the back but i only have 13 baby teeth and 11 are permanent teeth . Doctor response: lcome to Chat Doctor. I have gone through your query and can understand your concerns... Braces are needed if there is a misalignment of teeth or bite problem. In your case, the dentist will first take an x-ray to see how much space is available for the eruption of the permanent teeth. The dentist might need to extract some permanent teeth in order to make room for the other permanent teeth to erupt. In such cases, the extraction is done after the wisdom tooth erupts as the wisdom tooth erupts from the roof of the mouth (maxilla) while the other teeth erupt from the jaw bone (mandible). You can discuss with your dentist regarding this. Hope you found the advice useful. Regards.

Patient query: Hello doctor,1. Why we are getting frequent colds?2. What can be done to reduce the amount of colds we are getting?
Doctor response: 3. Can you suggest any medication which will help in reducing the frequency of colds?1. I am sorry to say that there is no way to prevent or cure colds completely. Colds are caused by viruses and they have their own innate immunity to fight against them and therefore, antibiotics do not work for them. The best thing one can do is to avoid exposing oneself to cold and other irritants like smokes and dusts. Wash your hands frequently with soap and water and clean your face also. You should describe in details all your symptoms, when they started, how severe they are etc.2) The most common cause of such symptoms could be viral infection. I would recommend you to take paracetamol for fever and pain, gargle with salt water solution, and if the symptoms persist for more than few days, visit your doctor for examination and further treatment. Hope this answers your question.

Patient query: Hi doctor,I am a 37-year-old male. My weight is 77.7 kg. I am facing erectile dysfunction problems. It has been going on for a few months now. I am consulting for the first time regarding my erection issue.
Doctor response: 1) Do you have any physical problem like obesity or diabetes?2) Are you taking any medications regularly?3) Have you tried to masturbate recently?4) How long your intercourse last?5) Does it last more than 20 minutes?6) Is the penis hard enough to enter into vagina?7) Any history of trauma to penis in past?8) Does you partner experience pain during sex?9) How often do you have sex?10) Anything else related to sexual activity that bother you?

Patient query: Hi doctor,I know a patient who is having hypertension. The doctor has prescribed Losalife H in the morning and Losalex 50 in the night. Is this an excess dose or is it normal?
Doctor response: Hi, thanks for contacting Chat Doctor. I read your question carefully and understand your concern. It seems that your friend is taking antihypertensive medication. This could be done to control blood pressure. There are different types of antihypertensives. Some are taken only once a day (monotherapy) while others (combinations) require two or three tablets to be taken simultaneously. In general, if blood pressure is well controlled with one combination, then there is no need to change the treatment. So I would suggest you to continue with the current treatment as it is working fine. Hope this answers your question. Please feel free to contact me again for any other health concerns. Wish you good health! Regards

Patient query: Hello doctor,I have red spots on my hands that started about 10 days ago. I also have a couple of spots on my foot. They are mildly tender and itchy. They have gotten worse but not more that 8 to 10. I have no medical history and do not take any medications daily. I had a cut on my finger from opening a metal box a few days before onset.
Doctor response: 1) Hi, Welcome to Chat Doctor forum. 2) You don't mention your age in your query.3) The symptoms may be due to fungal or bacterial infection of the skin.4) For fungal infection you can use antifungal cream like clotrimazole, ketoconazole etc., for local application.5) If the rash is due to allergy, then you should avoid contact with chemicals, soaps, detergents, cosmetics, jewelry etc.6) Oral antihistamine tablets like cetirizine will help to reduce itching.7) If the lesions increase in size and spread to other parts of body, then you should consult dermatologist for examination and diagnosis. Hope this helps you. Wishing you good health. Regards

Patient query: Hi doctor,I am a 19-year-old girl, weighing 151 pounds. I had gallbladder disease. I got to know three months back. The reports showed a thick-walled, non-functioning and sludge-filled gallbladder. The size of the gallbladder is 5.1\xc3\x972.2 mm. I got my tests done again last month and it says that the gallbladder is same sized, no stone or pericholecystic fluid. Currently, I am on homeopathic medicines. Previously, I used to have Nexum and Librax. I have also got my ultrasound done.
Doctor response: 1) Since your diagnosis was confirmed by USG, there should be no stones in the bile ducts as they would have been seen on the scan. So if the report is normal now, then you can relax.2) Your liver function test will show whether your liver has any damage due to the cholesterol deposits.3) If the gall bladder is not removed, it could cause an obstruction or inflammation at some time in the future. This could cause pain, jaundice etc.4) It is better to consult a surgeon for removal of the gall bladder at this stage.

Patient query: Hello doctor,I am having back pain. Six months ago I had S1 and L5 fusion. Normally, no surgery or anything. My doctor asked me to take rest. Then two months back I was again having pain in my back and no findings from my X-ray. Then I did an MRI four days back when I was having pain in my legs mainly in the thigh, calf, and foot. The pain is continuous. It is not resting for a minute, but the amount of pain varies sometimes a lot sometimes a little.I am 25 years old male. I was so active with all the sports activity and all, for last one year. After I bought my bike I stopped playing most of the sports, also the walking came down to below average because of the bike. Does the less walking have something to do with all that I am suffering? I had two to three accidents with my bike, but none of them were serious ones. I mean I did not get hurt badly. Just some scratches on my hand. So I am confused if the condition is done from a trauma. The doctors asked me to take one month rest and physiotherapy at this moment. Please suggest me what to do, I am really worried if it is sciatica or something even greater. I only want to heal the issue, recover from it completely even if that takes me one year or two.
Doctor response: Hi, thanks for writing to Chat Doctor. I have gone through your history and would like to make suggestions as follows:1) Please follow up with your doctor to discuss the results of your MRI scan.2) Since you have undergone S1 & L5 fusion, you should be able to walk normally which you are unable to do.3) It could be due to nerve compression in the spine causing symptoms of pain radiating to lower limb.4) For this you need to consult a Neurosurgeon who will give further investigations.5) You may need to go for nerve conduction studies and EMG to rule out any neurological deficit.6) In addition, you can do physiotherapy to strengthen your muscles around the spinal cord.7) Also, I would recommend you to use a lumbar corset to avoid strain on the spine while sitting.8) Avoid

Patient query: Hello doctor,There is an area on my back that started as a rash and it has now spread and it continues to itch. What should I do? This has been there for approximately two months. I have attached photos for your reference.
Doctor response: Hi, Welcome to Chat Doctor forum. As per your history, this seems to be urticaria or hives. It may be due to any allergy, stress or some other reason. Please get rid of the cause if possible. You can take antihistamines like cetirizine or levocetirizine. If symptoms not relieved, consult your dermatologist for examination and treatment. Hope this helps you. Wish you good health. Thank you.

Patient query: Hi doctor,I am a 27 year old male. I masturbate twice a week. Recently, during masturbation, I felt some pain on the back side of my neck and head. Please help.
Doctor response: 1. You must be having a muscle spasm in your upper trapezius region which is the muscles that run from the back of the neck to the shoulder blade. This can happen after intense physical activity or a long day at work. It usually resolves by itself over time.2. In case it doesn't resolve, then you need to visit an orthopedic surgeon for a clinical assessment.3. In the meantime you can use anti-inflammatory medications like ibuprofen (Advil) for relief.4. If the pain persists, you may need to see an orthopedist for further evaluation and management. Hope this helps.

Patient query: Hi doctor,I have insomnia for a couple of weeks. These weeks are being the worst where I have sleepless nights. Last night, I took Trazadone 150 mg which was prescribed and slept. Then again after that, I went back to Trazadone 100 mg tonight along with Melatonin, but I did not get any sleep. Is there anything I can do tonight to get some sleep? How long does insomnia typically last? Am I at risk for anything fatal? Also, I am planning to go back to my GP later on.
Doctor response: The duration of insomnia depends upon the cause. In your case, it is due to anxiety. It usually takes several weeks to months to recover from insomnia. You may need to take medicines like benzodiazepines or trazodone for few weeks. But if symptoms persist for more than one month, then it needs further evaluation. Try to avoid caffeine in the evening. Avoid stress and tension. Practice relaxation exercises like deep breathing before going to bed. Take small break during daytime and try to sleep early.

Patient query: Hi,I had unprotected intercourse with my partner a month back. I did not ejaculate inside her. Later to be sure, she did a home pregnancy test after 21 days, it came negative. Since yesterday, she is having vomiting sensation, not able to eat anything, light stomach cramps and light fever. She did pregnancy test today morning again; it came negative. We are confused and worried if she is pregnant. She has PCOD also. She had her last periods 45 days back. Do we have to go for a blood test?
Doctor response: 100% of women who get pregnant will experience some symptoms that can include nausea/vomiting, fatigue, sore breasts etc. The only way to know for sure if your wife is pregnant or not is by going to a lab and getting a blood test done. The blood test should show up whether or not there is any hormone in her body to indicate that she is pregnant (or not). It would be best to wait until at least day 6-7 of her cycle before doing any testing. This is because when the egg is released from the ovary, progesterone levels rise quickly which can cause many of these symptoms. Hope this helps!

Patient query: Hello doctor,I have a hard lump in my mouth since yesterday. There is very little pain, but I am freaking out about this because I used to chew tobacco and smoke for three years but clean since last one year. So, please, can you confirm if I require a biopsy?
Doctor response: 1) As per your history it seems like an ulcer of oral cavity.2) Biopsy is not required as it will give same results.3) Just apply Betadine ointment to relieve the soreness.4) Take care of oral hygiene.5) Do warm saline gargles.6) Avoid spicy foods and smoking.7) Consult dentist once if still persists. Hope this may help noncontact Chat Doctor for further queries

Patient query: Hello doctor,I am 50 years old. My echo is normal with LVEF of 50% and dobutamine stress test negative for ischemia (LVEF of 58%). But, it shows a jerky septum? Is jerky septum a normal finding?
Doctor response: 1. Yes, jerky septum is a normal finding in echo.2. It means that there is a small defect in the wall between right atrium and right ventricle.3. This is usually due to congenital abnormality or trauma in the past.4. You need not worry about this as it does not cause any symptoms and doesn't require treatment. Thank you.

Patient query: Hello doctor,My bottom tooth has a kind of a hole at the gum line. I do not know. When I breathe in, it feels cold like the air went in my tooth. It just does not seem or feel normal. Also, on my upper front tooth, I have some kind of deep line. Example like when you make a line in the sand and it flows into the line but it still stays. It is hard to explain. Is there any way I can fix this without going to the dentist? And yes, I do brush my teeth daily.
Doctor response: Hi welcome to Chat Doctor forum. Thanks for your query. The problem with the tooth is most probably due to decay or fracture. As the tooth is infected, you need to visit the Dentist as soon as possible. Treatment will depend upon the nature of the problem. In case of decay, it will be treated by filling. For the deep lines, it might be due to injury or trauma. You may take an x-ray to confirm the diagnosis. I hope that answers your query.

Patient query: Hello doctor,I am a 27-year-old male. I have had a mild burning sensation in the middle of the chest for the past few days and along with slight irritation in my throat. I also sometimes feel bloated and have slightly more than normal amount of burps. I have no cough or fever (checking temperature on a daily basis and highest is 98.6\xbaC).
Doctor response: 1) You do not need an antibiotic because there is no sign of infection. 2) The most likely cause is acid reflux disease. You should avoid spicy foods, large meals, and alcoholic beverages. Avoid smoking if you do. Elevate your head while sleeping by using two pillows. Take an anti-acid such as Prilosec OTC once a day at night before going to bed.

Patient query: Hello doctor,My fiancee is B positive and myself O negative. In the future, will there be any complications in my pregnancy?
Doctor response: 1) B positive blood group is not a risk factor for pregnancy.2) You can have a safe pregnancy if your partner is B positive.3) The antibodies that cause Rh (Rhesus) sensitization are produced by your own body during pregnancy.4) All women who are Rh negative should receive an injection of anti-D immunoglobulin when they first become pregnant, ideally within 72 hours after delivery.5) After receiving this injection, all babies born to these mothers will be Rh negative and protected from developing Rh disease.6) It is important for your partner to receive the above-mentioned injection before conception as well.

If I send over his MRI report, can you tell me what causes his epilepsy? Thank you in advance for your time. Due to his new medicine Epilive, he has hallucinations and nightmares. He generally takes only sodium valproate.

However, as you have not mentioned any other details regarding his medicines or treatment, it will be difficult to comment upon the cause behind his epilepsy. Kindly provide more details about him so that we can help you better. Hope this helps. Regards.

Patient query: Hello doctor,I am a 32-year-old single male. In the past, I have experimented with using non-deglycyrrhizinated licorice to reduce my libido and make single life more manageable. I have hereditary low blood pressure so that the side effect was not an issue for me. However, after a few days of use, the licorice causes me to develop muscle aches all over my body. Which I assume are due to the reduced potassium levels from the licorice. Is there a better alternative to the licorice? Or a way to prevent the loss of potassium so I can use it for more than a few days at a time? No matter what I ate, (bananas, avocados, apricots), it did not seem to be enough.
Doctor response: 1) Licorice is contraindicated in patients with high blood pressure and kidney disease as it may cause hypokalemia.2) It also has estrogenic activity which may lead to fluid retention in some people.3) You should avoid taking licorice for prolonged periods of time because it affects your potassium levels.4) Avoid taking licorice if you have high blood pressure or heart problems.5) There are many other natural options like ginseng, ashwagandha, saw palmetto etc. that can help improve your sex drive naturally without causing any side effects.6) You can try out these natural alternatives but before doing so consult an Ayurveda specialist who will guide you properly.

Patient query: Hello doctor,I am getting itching in the area where I wear my undergarments. I tried many medicines for fungal infection, but it does not go away. It has been there for more than a year. It keeps recurring. Currently, I am applying Miconazole cream and Clotrimazole powder. Please help.
Doctor response: 1) The itching could be due to allergy to the under garment like synthetic fabric or dyes used in them.2) Or if the undergarment is too tight then it might cause irritation of skin and lead to itching.3) This might also be due to fungus/yeast infection which is resistant to treatment.4) You can apply clotrimazole 1% cream twice daily for at least 4 weeks, and it should clear up.5) If no relief then please consult your dermatologist for proper examination and further management. Hope this helps

Patient query: Hi doctor,My ferritin level is 1500, and I want to bring it down to 150. How much will one DFO IV session or each Exjade pill reduce the ferritin level on an average? I am a healthy individual, and I do not have HIV, HCC, or any other disease.
Doctor response: 1) Iron deficiency anemia can cause low ferritin levels.2) The normal range of serum ferritin is 10-300 ng/ml.3) The upper limit of normal for serum ferritin in men is about 400 ng/ml and in women is approximately 800 ng/ml.4) Ferritin level is increased in iron overload disorders like hemochromatosis.5) Increased serum ferritin levels may be seen in inflammatory diseases such as rheumatoid arthritis and systemic lupus erythematous.6) Serum ferritin levels may also rise due to chronic liver disease or acute hepatitis.7) For your concern regarding how much reduction of ferritin level by DFO IV or Exjade pills, kindly discuss with your treating physician.

She consulted a doctor and was suggested to take Vitamin E tablets and asked to undergo mammogram and FNAC. The test results are enclosed. The doctor told us nothing to worry since the lumps are benign and the lumps have now completely disappeared. But, the report says further tests may be done. Doctor response: 1. The findings of the MRI breast suggest that there is no abnormality in the breast tissue.2. I would like to know what has been the treatment given to your wife for these lumps.3. In case if there is any suspicion regarding the nature of the lesion then follow up with repeat MRI or biopsy will be advised.4. The report suggests that there might be some inflammatory changes but this seems unlikely as the lesions have resolved.5. I would like to reassure you that there is nothing to worry.

Patient query: Hi doctor,My wife is 32 years old. We have a 5 month old baby girl. My wife is still feeding our baby. From yesterday, my wife has a fever, cold and throat infection. Can she take Paracetamol? Will it affect baby in any way? My wife\s temperature is 99.5 degrees Fahrenheit.

Patient query: Hi doctor,My partner is wearing spectacles. She is going to undergo lasik surgery next week. She suffers from thyroid. Is it comfortable for her to go for lasik surgery for eyes? Will the eyes get swelled after lasik surgery? Please suggest.

Patient query: Hello doctor,I had unprotected sex with my husband a month back and my LMP five days before that. I took Plan B pill within 10 hours of intercourse. My cycle is usually 25 days and I have not got periods yet. I tested 10 times, all were negative. Should I go to gynecologist and request for an ultrasound? Will ultrasound detect early pregnancy?
Doctor response: 1. You did not mention your age.2. You need to wait till your next period comes which will be due in about 6-7 weeks time.3. If it gets delayed by more than a week then you can get yourself examined.4. If it does not come at all or is very scanty, then you need to get an USG done.5. This test will definitely show if there is any evidence of pregnancy. Hope this helps.

Patient query: Dear doctor,I have recently had a baby. I experience sore, stiff hands in the morning, swelling, hard bumps on the elbow. There is a history of rheumatoid arthritis in my family. Blood work is negative. Should I go to a rheumatologist?
Doctor response: Hi, dear! Thanks for your question on Chat Doctor. I can understand your concern. Yes, definitely you should consult Rheumatologist for this problem. But other causes like diabetes, thyroid disorder etc. should be ruled out before diagnosing it as RA. So better to consult Rheumatologist and get done clinical examination and investigations. Investigations will include rheumatoid factor, CBC, ESR, ANA, CRP, X-ray both hands and wrist. Hope I have solved your query. Wishing good health to you. Thanks.

Patient query: Hello doctor,I am a 44-year-old male with a BMI of 26. During a recent health checkup of blood and urine, the following readings were observed. I have mentioned only the ones who have the higher readings. Protein 1+ detected in dipstick, serum uric acid at 9.2 mg/dL, MPV at 12.5 fL, FBS at 112 mg/dL, HbA1c at 5.5, cholesterol at 227 mg/dL, triglycerides at 181 mg/dL, VLDL is at 36.2 mg/dL, ALT/SGPT at 48 U/L. Serum creatinine at 1.23, increased from 0.99 tested six months back. Other than this, all others were normal. I also have been infected with hepatitis B twice and vaccinated for hepatitis B. I have been a diabetic for more than two years. The HbA1c vary between 5.5 and 6.5. The first one was done two years ago. I also have hypertension for more than five years. It is not very much under control. It varies from 135/80 to 150/100 and now it has reduced a bit to 140/90. I met my general physician who advised me to check my albumin to creatinine ratio. I tested it four times. The results are as follows:  55 ug/mg, 150 mg/g, 11.4 ug/mg, 37.5 mg/g. My ultrasonogram revealed fatty liver and cystitis. All the rest is fine. My ECG was fine. I have been advised to have a urine culture. My current medications are Telma-AM 40, Dynaglipt, Ecosprin AV 75, Levofloxacin, and CTD 12.5 mg. I am not able to understand why my albumin levels are so high and I would like to know how and when can they be rectified. I have attached reports for your further reference.
Doctor response: Hi, welcome to Chat Doctor forum. I am very sorry to hear about your problem. You should get examined by a specialist to find out if there is any other cause for high proteinuria. Since you have had hepatitis B infection earlier, it may be possible that the kidneys may be affected due to this. For this, you need to get an ultrasound scan of abdomen done to rule out any other cause. Meanwhile, you should take plenty of fluids, avoid excess salt intake and monitor your blood pressure regularly. Wishing you good health. Thank you.

Patient query: Hello doctor,You were wonderful in allaying some health anxiety over some skin issues several months ago. So, I thought I would consult with you on another question pertaining to my son. Unfortunately, a combination of my health anxiety and the big mistake of searching online has my mind imagining the worst with regard to my son. My son is 19 years old and has no diagnosed medical issues. I noticed back when he was about eight or ten years old that he had a mark resembling a cafe au lait mark on his back, in the upper shoulder area. I had always asked the pediatrician to look at it during his yearly physicals, and they made nothing of it. Throughout the years it has grown a bit and has become darker and more rough in texture. It is probably slightly less than an inch in length and looks like a few small lesions grouped together. Again, I have brought it to the pediatrician\s attention and he was not concerned. Three months ago, I made an appointment for him and my other son with a dermatologist for a skin exam, and I pointed out the spots which I wanted to be checked in particular. We met with the physician\s assistant there, and my younger son had a peculiar spot I pointed out, of which the PA conducted a shave biopsy, which came back as a mildly atypical junctional nevus. For my older son, I pointed out the spot on his back/shoulder, and the PA diagnosed it as a linear epidermal nevus. She said the chances of it becoming dangerous are slim to none. It may darken throughout the years, and they will simply monitor it at yearly visits. Unfortunately, I went on to research online about epidermal nevi and of course I ran into information showing a possible link to epidermal nevus syndrome and all of its associated neurological and skeletal defects. As I said, he is 19 and has no medical issues, is extremely intelligent, etc. In your opinion, is it safe to say that I should not be concerned about those syndromes? I presume it is primarily related to the numerous and systemic epidermal nevi, which he does not have, and I would think it would have presented by now? And my last even more neurotic question. My online research led me to some information saying that a certain type of epidermal nevus could be related to a gene mutation that could be passed along to an offspring, with them having possible serious skin scaling conditions, etc. Again, he has just one solitary small epidermal nevus. No biopsy was done, as the PA did not feel it was necessary. Do you feel there is any need for me to worry about that potential genetic mutation? Thank you so much for reading my long query.
Doctor response: Hi, Welcome to Chat Doctor forum. I can understand your concern regarding your sons health problem. There is no need to worry about this issue. The epidermal nevus is benign condition which occurs due to abnormal pigmentation of the skin. It doesn't spread anywhere else in the body, and it won't cause any harmful effects. Epidermal nevi don't usually cause problems unless they change color, size or shape. But if you are worried about it then you can see a dermatologist and get evaluated. Hope you find this answer helpful. Wishing you good health. Take care.

Patient query: Hello doctor,Every night around 2-3 AM, any thought that crosses my mind makes me overthink about it. I am worried about such things that do not have a fixed solution. It may or may not happen. I\ve tried listening to meditating sounds, calming sound during that time but to no avail. After an hour or two I do get normal but then I am so full of energy that I cannot fall asleep so I get up and start some work. (I am a freelancer working from home).I usually cannot sleep until my head feels heavy, eyes start closing and I start dozing off while working. For a few weeks, I have been sleeping in the afternoon or evening for three to five hours only. Rest of the time I am either thinking or working. Sometimes if I cannot stop thinking I smoke around two to three cigarettes to get over it. It does not help me sleep but helps me focus on work more and overthinking stops quite instantly.
Doctor response: 1) You need to learn how to relax your body and mind. Meditation is one way but there are other techniques like deep breathing exercises, progressive muscle relaxation etc. which can be learned from a qualified therapist.2) Try to identify what are these thoughts that keep recurring? Are they related to past actions/events or future possibilities or something else? Once you know this, you can try to find ways to deal with them.3) Avoid smoking - it will only add to your problems.4) Be physically active - this will also reduce stress levels.5) Get enough restful sleep at night and avoid staying awake late into night.6) Exercise regularly and eat healthy food.7) Keep yourself busy throughout the day with productive activities. Hope this answers your query.

Patient query: Hi doctor,My sister is 23 years old. She had unhygienic sex a couple of weeks ago. She started feeling itchy on her vagina. I am worried it might be herpes but I need confirmation from a specialist before we visit the doctor. It looks clustered and yellow. No hard lump under and it just looks inflamed. She does not complain of pain anywhere else. There is no pain inside the urethra, no burning sensation while urinating and the discharge is whitish-yellowish and watery. She does not have any sign of fever. She bought labia herpes cream yesterday. After application it changed the color today to darker yellow and some of it fell off. What could this be?
Doctor response: 1) The symptoms that your sister has described do not point towards genital herpes. However, she did have sexual intercourse prior to the symptoms developing which increases the risk of acquiring the infection.2) The symptoms that she has mentioned can also be due to bacterial vaginosis (bacterial imbalance in the vagina). This can cause itching, burning sensation during urination and light colored discharge.3) Herpes infection usually causes blisters over the genitals. However, if there are no such lesions then the diagnosis should be ruled out.4) If the symptoms persist for more than a week or increase in severity despite taking treatment, then she should get examined by a gynecologist.5) I would suggest that she takes antibiotics like Augmenting along with metronidazole tablets three times daily for seven days.6)

Patient query: Hello doctor,I have been suffering from breathing issues for about two months. At that time, I was coming off Duloxetine HCl. I was also having weird headaches, but that has subsided. I have been to several doctors and had blood work, oxygen level test and pulmonary test. Everything came back normal. With my breathing, I have the constant urge to take a deep breath in hopes of getting that satisfying deep sigh. I am constantly thinking about my breathing, even when I sleep. I am still able to exercise vigorously, run long distances, etc., with no problems. My fear is that I am experiencing diaphragm weakness as a result of something neurological. Here are my questions. I have been placed on anxiety medicines, which have helped to keep me sane. What is your expert opinion? Does this sound like diaphragm weakness? Would I be able to exercise vigorously if my breathing muscles were weakening?
Doctor response: 1. The symptoms you describe suggest an organic cause for the problem rather than psychological one as you have ruled out by all tests.2. I would recommend that you consult a physician who can examine you and then refer you to a pulmonologist or respiratory specialist.3. There may be a variety of causes for such symptoms. It could be simple asthma or bronchitis.4. You should get yourself examined by a physician first and then referred for further investigations.5. You need a thorough evaluation to determine the exact cause.

Patient query: Hi doctor,I had PAD before 20 years and I am able to maintain my body by exercising. When I get tensed, it comes back. Again, I have to begin exercising and gradually it gets better. This time, I had a bout of depression and I am not able to do exercise, so, it has taken longer time than usual to get the results. Now, with new blood-thinning medicines and exercise, I am starting to see good results. The doctor wants to do an angiogram next month, after that stents or surgery on my lower legs. I have two stents near my heart. One was placed, when I had an infarction 19 years ago and another one was placed after eight years. They seem to be good and I am afraid of another procedure. Now, I am willing to get a second opinion about this condition.
Doctor response: Hi there! I understand your concern. The treatment options for PAD depend upon the severity of disease. If you have mild symptoms then lifestyle modifications like weight reduction, healthy diet, regular physical activity will suffice. In moderate cases medications like aspirin, clopidogrel etc. can be administered. For severe cases like yours, surgical revascularization procedures like stenting or bypass is needed. So if you feel that your symptoms are not improving despite lifestyle changes then you should definitely consult a cardiologist and get evaluated. Hope this helps.

Patient query: Hello doctor,I am a 25-year-old male. My bpm is 31 during physical and mental exhaustion but my bpm is high of about 178 during hyperventilation and has pointless frustration. My bpm from rest to stand increases by at least 30 points but averages a 50 point increase. My resting bpm is 40, and upon standing it increases to 90 and peaks up to 110.I had done an echo cardiogram and EKG. I feel light-headed upon standing, along with sudden pulsation, headache and muscle spasms. I feel blackout, syncope, and fainting. I had spontaneous jolt, breathless, palpitations, flutters, fatigue, chills and skin rash on the back of hands.My mental disturbances include confusion, inability to maintain thoughts. I also feel pointless random irritability, ankle pain, random lapse of balance, throbbing extremities, vibrating vision, burning sensation, social anxiety, depression, irritating bowl movements, no appetite and chest discomfort.I wast told to mention the possibility of autonomic dysfunction as its often times overlooked.
Doctor response: Hi, Thanks for writing in. You have mentioned that your heart rate increases significantly when you stand up after sitting down. This is called orthostatic hypotension or postural hypotension. It occurs because blood vessels dilate while you are lying down and constrict when you stand up leading to low blood pressure. There may be other causes like anemia, thyroid problems etc. which can cause similar symptoms. You need to get evaluated properly to know what is causing this problem. You should wear a monitor which records your heart rhythm continuously for 24 hours. This will help us find out if there is any abnormality in your heart rhythm.
