Patient query: Hello doctor,My 4 years old daughter has an inward turn in her right eye after concentrating for a while. We had an eye test recently. Can you tell me if her results mean she needs glasses as she keeps saying her eyes hurt watching television and readings of her results are: Right eye sph +1.50 cyl -0.50, left eye sph +1.50 cyl -0.50. They told me she is long sighted and we have a strong family history of squints and glasses. I do not know if I should get a second opinion.
Doctor response: 1. Long-sightedness (hyperopia) means that light focuses behind your eye, instead of on it. This causes objects to appear blurred unless they are very close to your face.2. Short-sightedness (myopia) means that light focuses in front of your eye, instead of on it. This causes distant objects to appear blurred.3. Astigmatism is when the shape of the cornea or lens of your eye is irregular, causing light to be focused at two points rather than one point. This causes objects to look blurry at all distances.4. Eye strain can cause headaches, tiredness, and other symptoms. These symptoms usually improve with resting your eyes.5. In my opinion your child need to wear glasses for both the eyes. But you can take second opinion from another opthalmologist before taking any action.

Doctor response: 99% of abortions are successful if the procedure is done within 6 weeks from conception. The failure rate increases beyond that time. After 7-8 weeks, the fetus may be too large for successful removal by the procedure. Therefore, it is important that you have the abortion as soon as possible. You can take misoprostol tablets orally 100 mcg every 3 hours for up to 4 doses. This is taken in combination with mifepristone 600 mcg by mouth. This causes contractions and expulsion of products of conception. In some cases, surgical evacuation of the uterine contents may be necessary. If there is heavy bleeding, you will need to be hospitalized. This type of abortion is safe and effective.

And now he did not poop for the past two days and trying very hard and cries in between feeds by trying to poop. Is this an effect of enzymes? Please help.
Doctor response: 1. I think your kid is having some bowel problem and so he is passing more gas than normal.2. You can try adding some probiotics like Lactobacillus GG or Saccharomyces Boulardii to your diet for 5-7 days3. You should also try reducing the amount of milk you give your kid at one go.4. Also, do not feed your child immediately after feeding because it will cause excessive gas formation.5. Keep your baby upright for about 2 hours after feeding.6. Give your kid plenty of water throughout the day.7. Try giving rice water as a laxative if the condition persists.8. Do not use antibiotic unless absolutely necessary.9. Use anti-emetic like dimethicone when needed. Hope I have answered your question. Let me know if I can assist you further.

Patient query: Hello doctor,I am a 62-year-old male. I went for a routine X-ray, and the radiologist found some streakiness in the lower left lung. He said it appeared small and not significant, but it was adviced that I should come back in six months for a comparative X-ray and that it could just be a scar from an earlier infection.I have read that a small scar area is probably non-progressive but I have also read about IPF, and that fills me with fear. Spirometry test was normal as it was a physical exam. I am so scared that it might be a progressive disease, but I hope that it is just an old scar as it is really small. Otherwise mostly healthy with no cough or difficulty breathing at all. Are all lung scars progressive?
Doctor response: 1) Yes, all scars are potentially progressive. However, there are many different types of scarring and they don't all behave the same way. The most common type of scar seen in lungs (and other organs) is called fibrosis. This is when the body repairs itself by forming collagen, which forms dense tissue. Fibrotic scars can be very bad if they form too much collagen, however this doesn't happen in most cases.2) Your doctor was correct to say that this was likely due to an old infection. Infections can cause some degree of scarring, and these are usually reversible.3) It is possible that your scarring is related to IPF, but this would require further testing such as CT scan or bronchoscopy to rule out other causes. You will need to see your doctor again for a repeat chest x-ray and possibly a pulmonary function test.

Patient query: Hello doctor,I did my body checkup. I found that some of the reports are not in the normal range. So, I just want to know if I need to check further for some diseases. What should I do to bring it to the normal range? Currently, I am very normal.The following are not in the normal range:Total RBC: 6.05 X 10^6 /\xce\xbcL Range: 4.5-5.5.Mean corpuscular volume (MCV) 81.2 fL Range: 83-101.Mean corpuscular hemoglobin (MCH) 26.8 pq Range: 27-32.Red cell distribution width - SD (RDW-SD) 37.1 fL Range: 39-46.Platelet distribution width (PDW) 15.3 fL Range: 9.6-15.2.You can even check the report file. Thanks.
Doctor response: Welcome to Chat Doctor. I understand your concern regarding abnormal blood results. You have mentioned only few values and hence I would like to know more details about other parameters such as hematocrit, hemoglobin, total leukocyte counts etc. I also suggest you to get your CBC done once again after 1 week. If you still find same results then we will be able to say something about it. In case of any doubt, I would advise getting a peripheral smear examination done which will help us to diagnose the cause of anemia. Hope this helps. Take care

Patient query: Hello doctor,My penis skin end has got tiny cuts around and it is not healing for more than one month. Please help.
Doctor response: 1) You should take care that you do not get infected with any bacteria or virus. You must wash your hands properly before touching your genital area.2) Please see if there is any discharge from the wound. If yes, then you might need to be treated for an infection.3) Apply antibiotic ointment over the wound.4) Take anti-inflammatory medication like ibuprofen for pain relief.5) Avoid sexual intercourse till the wounds have completely healed up.

Patient query: Hello doctor,My daughter is 7 years old. One month back, she had fever and after that, she has got severe hair fall. It is almost one month, still, hair fall is there. It is not at all decreasing. Even when washing her hair, lots of hair loss is seen. I am worried about it. What could be the reason? Any remedies?
Doctor response: 1stly, thank you for trusting Chat Doctor doctors with your health related queries. 2ndly, I would like to know in detail what kind of hair fall, how much hair is falling out per day, if you see any bald patches or if she is having any other symptoms along with this. 3rdly, if you have been using any new shampoo/conditioner then it may cause irritation which can lead to hair fall. 4thly, excessive stress or anxiety can also lead to hair fall. Please consult your dermatologist who will make sure that its not due to scalp infection.

Patient query: Hi doctor,I and my fiance had unprotected sex a month back but he did not ejaculate inside me. Due to confusion, I had an Ipill after two hours of intercourse. On the eighth day after taking the pill, I got a light bleeding (enough to use a pad) which lasted for three days. My last period started 40 days back and lasted for five days. I missed my next period which was supposed to be a month later. Now after that I did the urine pregnancy test in the afternoon which came negative. I just want to know is there a chance of me getting pregnant. Am I safe now? Please answer it
Doctor response: 1. The possibility of pregnancy can never be ruled out completely with any one method. So, if you have not taken a reliable test then you should take another test after a week or so.2. There can be some hormone imbalance which might lead to irregular periods. You need to consult a gynecologist to rule this out.3. Since you had your period recently, it is unlikely that you will get pregnant soon. But, it is always better to go for a test as there are cases where women do conceive even after taking emergency contraceptive pills.

Patient query: Hello doctor,I am 29 weeks pregnant. From the last two days, I am not feeling good. There is sudden nausea. The baby movement is fine but I am not able to eat anything because of nausea and frequent urination. Burning feet is also there accompanied by gas and constipation.
Doctor response: 1) You can try taking ginger in powdered form with honey or water. Ginger has anti-emetic properties and may be useful for your symptoms.2) You should also take plenty of fluids and have small meals throughout the day instead of large meals at one time.3) Take some probiotic supplements like Lactobacillus reuteri DSM 17938 which helps in improving digestion and absorption of nutrients from food.4) Avoid spicy foods as they can cause irritation to the stomach lining and cause pain.5) Avoid smoking if you do smoke.6) Avoid alcohol consumption.7) If you are still having problems after trying all these measures then consult your treating physician.

Patient query: Hello doctor,My mother is not able to walk properly and she cannot move properly. She met with ischemic stroke eight years back and she is diabetic and has BP, and seizures (epilepsy) treated with Insulin, and BP suppressants, Atorvastatin, Levetiracetam, Phenytoin (Eptoin) since seven years, but she is not able to walk properly and she is not able to move her hands and legs properly. Her thinking and behavior have also become very mild. Please suggest me the correct medication for her.
Doctor response: 1. Since your mother had a stroke in the past, it is important that she gets evaluated by a neurologist who can perform an MRI scan of brain to see if there is any damage or new lesions.2. Epilepsies are known to cause cognitive impairment and I would suggest you get a complete work up done by a neurologist to find out what could be the cause of the current problem.3. In addition, she may need speech therapy as well as physiotherapy.

Patient query: Hi doctor,I got a minor surgery for liver abscess and a drain was installed. Pus in the color of chocolate and little thick is coming out. Is it normal? How much time it will take to recover? For how many days the drain has to be installed?
Doctor response: 1) It is normal to have pus discharge from the incision site after a surgical procedure.2) The amount of pus that comes out depends on the size of the abscess.3) I don't know what type of surgery was performed but generally, a drain should remain in place until all the pus has been completely evacuated from the abdominal cavity. This usually takes between one to two weeks. Hope this answers your question.

Patient query: Hello doctor,I am 60 years old. I always had stomach issues but now at the end of the day I have terrible gas trouble, and it does not matter what I eat. Beano helps a little. Could this be IBS?Lab tests performed: All lab test are normal.
Doctor response: 1) No, you do not need to worry about having IBS as your lab results are all normal.2) It is very common for people over 60 to have similar symptoms that you describe.3) The best thing to do would be to try a medication called omeprazole (Prilosec). This will help decrease the amount of acid in your stomach which should relieve some of your problems.4) You may also want to consider taking an antacid such as Pepcid or Zantac.5) Sometimes just changing your diet can help with these symptoms. Avoid large meals, and try eating smaller, more frequent meals.6) Try avoiding foods that cause you problems and see if that helps.7) If none of the above works, then you may need to get evaluated by a gastroenterologist.

Patient query: Hello doctor, I was recently diagnosed with asthma, bronchitis, and pharyngitis. I am currently on some temporary medicines, and antibiotics to treat these sicknesses along with an inhaler. I do not feel that bad, but I need to take the pills. However, being in college, I have a big game this weekend. This question may seem to be a little stupid but, would mixing of alcohol with antibiotics be deadly? Or would it just slow down the process of making me better? I know it is a silly question to ask, but I am half minded on it and would prefer not to end up in the hospital.
Doctor response: 1. Alcohol does not mix well with antibiotics as they both affect your liver functions.2. Antibiotics can cause side effects such as nausea, vomiting, diarrhea, rashes, etc., which might aggravate if mixed with alcohol.3. In addition, alcohol can also increase dizziness or lightheadedness caused by the antibiotic.4. Therefore, it is best advised to avoid taking any alcoholic beverages when taking antibiotics.5. It will not harm you if you don't take alcohol while you are taking antibiotics.

Patient query: Hello doctor,About 6 years ago, I engaged in some urethral play with my partner. I put a small pen into the urethra, only about 2 to 3 inches in. Since then, I feel I may have done damage to the smooth muscles in the corpus spongiosum or the tunica albuginea. I can feel, right inbetween the corpus spongiosum and corpus cavernosa what feels like an enlarged muscle and seem to run the entire length of the urethra, maybe compression damage done to something there. As a result, I have slight difficulty urinating and very very bad premature ejaculation which did not ever happen. I also have nocturnal emissions frequently on a full bladder. I know I may need to have an MRI, but if the muscles are damaged here, what are the surgical options? Can anything be done? I also tried Priligy and it made no difference (10 to 20 seconds).
Doctor response: Hi, Thanks for writing in. It is possible that you might have injured your urethra during sexual activity. This is called urethritis. This injury may cause painful urination and difficulty in passing urine. You should consult a Urologist who would examine you and take a detailed history. A clinical examination will reveal any abnormality in the genital region. He will order routine blood tests and an ultrasound scan of the scrotum and pelvis. In case you are found to have an inflammation, he may prescribe antibiotics and anti-inflammatory medications. However, if required, he may send you for further investigations including cystoscopy and biopsy of the urethra.

Patient query: Hi doctor,My doctor has advised taking Adava stat F tablet to reduce cholesterol. I have type 2 diabetes and my cholesterol 175.6, triglycerides 297, and HDL 24.5. So, do I need to take this and how long I need to take? The doctor said only three months or lifelong.
Doctor response: 1. You should be also undergoing lifestyle modification like - avoiding saturated fatty foods, increasing fiber intake through fruits and vegetables, losing weight if obese, doing regular physical activity for at least 30 min/day.2. Statin is indicated in all persons with high LDL levels (>190) and at least one other risk factor such as smoking, age over 45 years old, family history of premature coronary artery disease, female gender, hypertension, etc. It can be prescribed for life but your doctor may decide to discontinue it after some time depending upon your response.

Patient query: Hello doctor, I am 24 years old. I had my kidney stone removed a year ago for causing mild hydronephrosis at my right kidney. During the treatment, I was exposed to full of radiation, abdominal CT scan, lithotripsy, fluoroscopy, and another fluoroscopy during stent insertion. I am not sure how the doctor manages the radiation. I did my treatment abroad and it is not really a well-developed country. He might not even care bout it. I studied some about radiation when I was in dental school so I am very scared of the side effects.So if I am to have another case of hydronephrosis, should I just remove the kidney rather than undergoing such radiation which may cause me high risk of future cancer? Because as you can see, I am still so young and I just started my career. What do you suggest? Do the pros outweigh the cons or vice versa? Is there another less risky treatment in terms of radiation? How about invasive treatment? Is the risk higher aside from the slow healing? And I am serious about the removal if indeed it has lower radiation risk, even though I know kidney is very important. Please suggest.
Doctor response: 1) The chances of developing cancer after exposure to radiation are low (<10%) but the possibility cannot be completely ruled out.2) The prognosis of cancer after exposure to radiation is usually good if detected early.3) There is no other less risky treatment option except surgery.4) Invasive treatments like ureteric stents carry a higher risk of infection and slow healing.5) You can discuss with your doctor before any further treatment regarding kidney stones. Hope this helps.

Patient query: Hello doctor,For the past week I have been experiencing a \x80\x9cscratchy\x80\x9d feeling on just the left side of my throat right below my Adam's Apple region. Now, it feels as though whatever it is has transformed into a feeling of paralysis from my voice box up to behind my left nasal passage. I am also experiencing shortness of breath.

An ENT examination would help me rule out any other possible causes for your symptoms like a mass or enlarged lymph nodes.3. A course of antibiotics and anti-inflammatory medications will help relieve your symptoms.4. You may need to see a specialist if the condition persists. Hope this helps.

Patient query: Hello doctor,My 29 year old brother had a pacemaker placed three years ago after survival from a sudden cardiac arrest. Doctors found the cause of the cardiac arrest to be a ventricular fibrillation. Last week was the first time he received a shock from his pacemaker, that is, exactly three years after his first episode. My question is, whether we can find the root cause of his ventricular fibrillation. What is the best treatment for his case?
Doctor response: 3 years ago your brother has been diagnosed with VF and then pacemaker implantation. Now again he receive shock from his pacemaker. It means there is some problem in heart. And this can be due to many reasons like congenital heart disease or any other cardiac disorder. So my advice is that consult your cardiologist and get done ECG and 2d echo. This will help you to know about heart functioning and also to know about condition of heart valves. With these reports cardiologist can guide you regarding treatment.

Patient query: Hello doctor,I have hemoptysis.

You should also get your blood checked for CBC and ESR.3. In the meantime, if you have any cough, I suggest you take a course of antibiotics like cephalosporins and antihistamines.4. If the x-ray chest comes normal then we can think about other causes of hemoptysis like bronchitis etc.5. I hope this helps.

Patient query: Hi doctor,I had an extraction of a molar in the morning, and a bone graft was placed over it. My surgeon placed a collagen plug over it to make the graft to stay in place. Can I have a blood clot below it? I am afraid of getting a dry socket. Last time, I had a dry socket, when I had a wisdom tooth removal, and I am scared. Please help.
Doctor response: 1) No you cannot get a blood clot below the graft.2) You should be very careful about your oral hygiene for next few days after surgery.3) Avoid smoking, alcohol etc.4) Do not open your mouth wide.5) Take painkillers as prescribed by your dentist. Hope this answers your question. If you have additional questions or follow-up questions then please do not hesitate in writing to us. Wishing you good health.

Patient query: Hello doctor,Eight days ago, I had a deep cut in my foot from a puncture. I got five stitches. A couple of days later, it got infected. Should I go get more antibiotics?
Doctor response: 1. The wound has been cleaned and Chat Doctor. 2. It should be kept clean and covered with bandage.3. If there is any discharge from the wound then it needs to be cleaned and treated again.4. If the pain is unbearable, you need to take analgesic like ibuprofen.5. You can take antibiotics after two days if you still have pus coming out.6. If the wound does not heal, consult your doctor or surgeon and get checked.

Patient query: Hello doctor,I have an infected piercing. It is already one month since I have got a piercing. My infection is getting worse so I removed it. What should I do to my wound? I removed my piercing. It is my first time to be pierced so I do not know how to clean it and I am using fake pieces of jewelry. I think I am allergic to that earrings. Every day it is getting worse and the hole of my earrings its getting bigger like the size of my earrings. I do not know if it is okay to remove it.
Doctor response: Hi there. Welcome to Chat Doctor forum. I understand your concern regarding infective complications of the piercing. The best way to treat this is to take antibiotic course such as Augmenting or Ciprofloxacin for at least 10 days. You can also apply triple antibiotic ointment over the area. Apply warm compresses over the area several times a day. Take adequate rest. Avoid any kind of heavy physical activity. This will help heal faster. Avoid wearing any type of ornament till the wounds heals completely. Hope this helps.

Patient query: Hi doctor,I am suffering from severe hair loss since the past 45 days. I am only losing my hair on the top and front part of my head and it all started like a month ago. Also, you need to take multivitamin supplements along with minerals daily. Avoid stress and tension as they can lead to excessive hair fall. Use mild shampoo once or twice a week. Use conditioner after washing your hair. Regular oil massage helps to maintain the healthy scalp and also stimulate hair growth.

Patient query: Hi doctor,I am a college teacher. I feel fatigue and dizzy for past one year. I slept very late one night and the next day while taking class had a dizzy feeling for a second. I felt that my head was reeling and on that afternoon I took off. It did not happen again but I felt myself weak with less energy, as if I am about to fall if I do not sit somewhere. Sometimes, I get a sudden panic too, with increased heartbeat, dizziness, etc., with a frightful feeling that something is going to happen. An MRI scan was done which is alright. Hypertension, thyroid, and sugar tests were done and that too fine. The doctor said it may be a stress reaction and he gave a tablet for fatigue. After having that tablet for a while, fatigue was gone, but other symptoms of panic attack, occasional tiredness still continues. Please help.
Doctor response: 1) You have mentioned that your MRI brain is normal, so there is no need to worry about any physical problem.2) Symptoms like fatigue, dizziness, weakness, panic attacks, palpitations, etc. can occur due to psychological reasons in many cases. So, you should consult a psychiatrist and take treatment from him/her.3) The medicines prescribed by your doctor are helpful in treating such problems.4) In case, you require more details regarding these problems, you can ask me directly through this website.

Patient query: Hi doctor,I have a pain in my parotid gland for about two months. It hurts when I am eating. The first taste of my food was worst. Doctor response: Hi, Welcome to Chat Doctor forum. As you describe, it seems that there might be an inflammation of the parotid gland which can be caused by many reasons like bacterial or viral infection, trauma, any foreign body lodged in the gland etc. You have already taken the treatment prescribed by your ENT specialist. But if the symptoms still persist, then you need to consult an Internal medicine specialist. Meanwhile, you can take anti-inflammatory medicines like Advil or Tylenol regularly. Hope this helps. Take care.

Patient query: Hello doctor,My mother is suffering from arthritis. Is cow milk harmful to consume in her case (she drinks it daily)? Which foods are very beneficial for this disease or diet plan to remove it from the body as early as possible? Please reply. I need your help.
Doctor response: 1) Cow milk is not harmful to consume in cases of arthritis. It does contain calcium which is needed for bone health and helps to maintain the strength of joints.2) She should take food rich in vitamin C like fruits and vegetables.3) Eating fish once a week can be helpful.4) Include plenty of green leafy vegetables in the diet.5) Take plenty of water throughout the day.6) Avoid fatty, oily and high calorie diet.

Patient query: Hello doctor,When I was 19 years old, I slipped in a wet road and my hips bumped on the ground. As per your complaint it seems that you may be suffering from disc prolapse with sciatica and may require MRI spine to rule out any nerve compression at L5-S1 level. For this consult an orthopedic surgeon and get evaluated. You may need some medication like analgesics and muscle relaxants along with physiotherapy. Hope this information helps. Thanks and regards.

Patient query: Hi doctor,Every morning when I wake up my mouth is full of saliva and many days it comes out of my mouth while sleeping. And in the day, saliva comes to mouth every 2 to 3 minutes. The problem of morning saliva has been there for more than one year. I have to wake up every morning early because saliva starts coming out of my mouth.
Doctor response: 1) You should consult an ENT specialist for your symptoms. 2) You may need to undergo certain tests like blood sugar, serum electrolytes, X-ray of oral cavity and throat etc.3) There are various causes of excessive salivation including gastroesophageal reflux disease, stress, anxiety, allergies, Chat Doctor.

Patient query: Hello doctor,On the my bottom my two front teeth the gums have came up over them but not covered. But the gum is higher up than it is in any other teeth in my mouth. What caused this? Can I fix this in home itself?
Doctor response: Hi, Thanks for your query. It could be due to either of the following reasons-1. Gingival recession2. Improper brushing technique3. Trauma4. Poor oral hygiene. You can consult a Dentist and get evaluated. You will need to do a complete evaluation which includes clinical examination and radiographs if required. After proper diagnosis treatment can be planned accordingly.

Patient query: Hello doctor,My partner had extracted a tooth today at the dentist but there are bony fragments left and he is in a lot of pain. What are the bony fragments? Are they bones of the tooth?
Doctor response: Hi, Welcome to Chat Doctor forum. I am sorry for your partners pain from extraction site. Bony fragments can be remnants of gum or bone covering tooth root which gets removed during extraction procedure. Or it may be pieces of the tooth itself which was not completely removed. It should subside within 4-5 days, if there is no swelling, redness or pus discharge. In case of any of these symptoms, you need to consult your dentist immediately. Hope this helps.

Patient query: Hi doctor,I am a 21-year-old male. Before a month, I started jogging. But before three days ago, I saw my ankles with swelling. During the usual time, it does not hurt. But when I sit for a long time and after that when I start to walk, I have the pain. What can I do now for swelling?
Doctor response: Hi thanks for contacting Chat Doctor... Your symptoms suggest acute soft tissue injury... You need to consult orthopedic surgeon and get done X-ray anteroposterior view of both ankle joints.... Swelling is due to edema of soft tissues... Soft tissue injuries take more time to heal.... For this RICE therapy is useful. Rest, Ice pack application over affected area, compression bandage and elevation of limb helps in reducing inflammation and edema... Analgesic like ibuprofen and muscle relaxant like thiocolchicoside will be helpful..... Take care....

Patient query: Hello doctor,I am a 34 year old. I have no allergies to medications. I am schizophrenic. I take Abilify 20 mg and Solotik 200 mg. But, I suffer from negative symptoms (amotivation, alogia, etc.). I heard about a new drug Vraylar (Cariprazine). I would like to know from a specialist about the efficacy of Vraylar for negative symptoms, especially amotivation and alogia.
Doctor response: 1) Vraylar is an antipsychotic used in treatment of bipolar disorder, depression and schizophrenia. It has not been approved by FDA for use in treating negative symptoms of schizophrenia. However, it is being studied in clinical trials.2) There are many other effective antipsychotics available for treating negative symptom of schizophrenia. These include olanzapine, quetiapine, risperidone, aripiprazole and several others. All these can be used safely in your case.

Patient query: Hi doctor,I am a 33-year-old unmarried female with no disease ever diagnosed. I live a sedentary lifestyle with very little or no exercise. I do not smoke, and I do not diet, I am taking normal oily currys with bread. Recently I got my lipid profile done and saw that my triglycrides are 30. Is it severly low? Am I at a risk of heart stroke or brain hemorrhage? Or do I have undiagnosed cancer or just malabsorbtion? Can you tell me which tests should I get done in order to diagnose the cause?
Doctor response: 1) Triglyceride level of 30 mg/dl is high, but not alarmingly so.2) You need to know your HDL levels (good cholesterol). If HDL levels are also low then there is concern.3) You may benefit from an ultrasound abdomen to see if there is any mass.4) A liver function test would be useful.5) An ECG and ECHO will help rule out cardiac issues.6) Blood sugar levels should also be checked.7) Please consult a physician for further work up and management.

Patient query: Hello doctor,I have a headache all the time, like a spinning head. Whatever I eat, my headache does not go. I use simple Panadol, but no effects on my headache. It is from the last 10 months, after my pregnancy.
Doctor response: Hi welcome to Chat Doctor forum. I can understand your concern regarding your problem. The symptoms that you mention in your query suggest that it could be due to migraine. Migraine is a neurovascular disorder and is associated with abnormal functioning of cerebral blood vessels. It is characterized by severe headaches, usually unilateral, aggravation by movement of the head or eyes, nausea and vomiting. I would advise you to consult a physician for proper diagnosis and treatment. You may need MRI scan and some other investigations. Treatment will depend upon the cause. You may need some medicines like propranolol, topiramate etc. I hope this information helps you. Thank you for choosing Chat Doctor. Wish you a good health. Best regards

Patient query: Hi doctor,I had my last menstrual period before 15 days, and I have 26 days cycle. Before two days, my partner did a blow job and hand rubbing. I am not sure whether he did ejaculation or not. I took two dosages of Unwanted 72 within 14 hours. Am I at risk of getting pregnant? As I was near my ovulation period, Is there any chance for me to get pregnant? What can I do to avoid pregnancy?
Doctor response: 1) You should know that in unprotected sex during fertile period (within 6 days before and after ovulation), pregnancy is possible. 2) Condoms are 98% effective if used correctly.3) You could use emergency contraceptive pills up to 120 hrs after intercourse. But they will not prevent pregnancy if taken more than 120hrs after intercourse.4) Natural family planning method is also very effective in avoiding pregnancy.5) For further information regarding your query, kindly visit our website www.ChatDoctor.com

Patient query: Hello doctor,I think I have water trapped in my left ear. I feel a moving water sensation in my left ear. I have a ringing sensation in my left ear after water got trapped in the ear. Will this ringing go away if my ear is dried? If the water is removed, then will the ringing sound stop? I do not have any ear pain and ear discharge. And also, I do not have any hearing loss. Please help me.
Doctor response: Hi there, I understand your concern. I can understand that ringing sensation must be very irritating for you. But let me assure you that this is not related to water getting trapped in the ear canal. This is a tinnitus or noise which is heard by some people even when there is no external source of noise. The exact cause of this condition is still unknown but it could be due to damage to the auditory nerve or certain problems with the inner ear like anemia, diabetes etc. I would suggest you to consult an ENT specialist who may prescribe you an antibiotic along with decongestants. You should get yourself checked up for the possible causes mentioned above. Hopefully this helps.

Patient query: Hello doctor,I am worried about the weight gain of my baby. She was born three years back and had weight: 3.36 kg, length 51 cm and head circumference 35 cm. We started exclusively breastfeeding. On the 30th day appointment she had weight 4 kg, length 56 cm, and head circumference 38 cm. 60th day appointment: weight 4.75 kg, length: 57 cm, and head circumference 40 cm. 90th day appointment, weight 5.58 kg, length 61 cm, head circumference 41 cm. Since then she did not gain any weight for two weeks, so we started giving also Formula, without much success, she barely drinks 120 ml for one meal. Her weight gain has not been good since, on the 120th day appointment, she was 5.91 kg. How can I make her drink more at each meal? Would my baby be described as failure to thrive? What are the long-term effects of this slow weight gain pattern?

After that it should increase gradually. However, if there is no significant weight gain after these months then it may be due to some other reason like illness or malabsorption etc. So get your child examined by a pediatrician and ask him/her for a proper diagnosis. Hope this information helps you. Take care.

Patient query: Hello doctor,I am a 19-year-old male. I have been to a few ophthalmologists about this and they seem to think it is benign. But I want to get some other input on this. If I widen my eyes and move my head around, I can see shadows in my far peripheral vision moving as my head does. And it seems that the shadows change and become different sizes as time goes on.Now I do have astigmatism in my right eye and from time to time I get aching, almost gnawing pains that are with the movement of the eye. And has happened in both at the same time before. Patient query: Hello doctor,Yesterday, my wife had bleeding for a minute after we had sex for the first time. What would be the reason for this problem?

Patient query: Hello doctor,I am a 25 year old unmarried girl. I am curious to know about the various options for abortions (medical and surgical) and up to how many days they can be done. I tried to look online but, I got several different answers. So, I thought of asking a doctor about it. Also, I want to know how safe is emergency contraceptive pill. I have PCOD and I am on ayurvedic treatment since the last four months.
Doctor response: 1. The safest way for an abortion is through the use of Mifepristone and Misoprostol Combination. This is available as a kit in most pharmacies and is used safely up to 9 weeks of gestational age.2. Emergency contraception pills are also available as a kit containing Levonorgestrel or Ulipristal Acetate. These too are safe up to 9 weeks of pregnancy.3. Abortions by Vacuum Aspiration or Dilatation and Curettage can be performed up to 6-7 weeks of pregnancy.4. After that, only Surgical procedure like Suction Curettement or Manual Evacuation can be performed which are safer than the above two procedures.5. Please note that all these methods require the presence of a trained Doctor and should not be attempted at home.

Patient query: Hello doctor,Does Methamphetamine interfere with local anesthesia? My friend was told she would not have to stop Adderall before surgery. I know that is not the same, but is there anything particularly dangerous about methamphetamine and local anesthesia? What about Phentermine?
Doctor response: Hi, Thanks for writing in. I am not aware of any such interaction between methamphetamines and local anesthetics. Phentermine is used as appetite suppressant and is safe when taken under medical supervision. It does not interact with local anesthetics and hence no need to worry about it. Hope this information helps.

Patient query: Hello doctor,Can you please suggest any good skin lightening cream not such that like magical whitening but I meant for healthy skin and color does not matter that much. I have heard about the Golite cream. How is it? Can it be used like other fairness creams? I want to use, Clin shine cream which is newly available in the market. Please suggest me.
Doctor response: 1) There is no such thing as a "good" skin lightening cream. Creams containing hydroquinone or mercury are contraindicated for use by pregnant women because they can cause birth defects.2) The safest way to lighten your skin without causing further damage is to stay out of the sun. Wear clothing that covers most of your body, including a hat and sunglasses.3) Use a broad spectrum (UVA/UVB) sunscreen with an SPF of at least 30 every day. Reapply frequently, especially if you are sweating or swimming.4) Apply a vitamin C serum to your face twice a day.5) If you must use a skin-lightening cream, look for one that contains kojic acid, licorice extract, soybean extract, or comic acid instead of hydroquinone or mercury.6

Patient query: Hi doctor,A heavy ladder fell on my head. Then, dizziness occurred twice and I have some constant chest pain in the middle of the chest. Also, I am feeling chest heaviness. Please help.

Patient query: Hello doctor,I am a 30-year-old man. Recently, I was tested for complete STD checkup with TORCH test. I have a few doubts:Are HIV 1 and 2 with p24 duo test after 28 days window period conclusive? My result is nonreactive.I got a positive result for rubella. CMV and HSV 1 and 2 IgG positive but IgM negative. Am I an eligible person for marriage and sexual relationship?What is the treatment plan for those TORCH IgG positive results?Of note, I had unprotected oral sex twice and protected vaginal sex three times in the last two months.
Doctor response: 1) Yes, the p24 antigen test can be used to detect HIV infection. It is not as accurate as the ELISA tests which measure the antibodies against HIV but it is still helpful. The window period of the p24 antigen test is 6 weeks.2) Rubella is usually mild and self limiting illness. However, if you are pregnant, then you need to take prophylactic medication to prevent fetal congenital anomalies.3) Cytomegalovirus (CMV) is also a common viral infection and most individuals will clear the virus from their body without any complications.4) Herpes simplex virus type 1 (HSV-1) and herpes simplex virus type 2 (HSV-2) are both very common viruses that cause cold sores.5) No, there is no treatment for these conditions

Patient query: Hi doctor,My mother is 78 years old now. Before 12 days back, she had a cough and high fever. She had a wheezing problem along with a cough. She was given Azithromycin and Cratex expectorant. Her temperature got subsided after five days. But the coughing problem has not stopped. Her X-Ray finding suggested COPD. Currently, she is taking Domperidone, Etizolam, and Olmesartan.
Doctor response: 1) Your mothers symptoms do point towards a chronic lung disease. The most likely cause would be Chronic Obstructive Pulmonary Disease (COPD).2) COPD is a progressive disease which means that over time it will get worse.3) It can take many months or even years for her to recover fully from this condition.4) In addition to medications, she should also try deep breathing exercises. These can help increase her lung capacity and make it easier for her to breathe.5) If her symptoms continue to worsen, she may need additional treatment such as inhaled bronchodilators or corticosteroids. Hope I have answered your query. Let me know if I can assist you further.

Hope this helps you. Wish you good health. Take care.

Patient query: Hello doctor,Right ovary contains 3.6x2.1x3.1cm cyst, thick septation and few punctate echogenic lesions within lumen. Previously cyst measured 3.8x2.4cm abutting ovary. Doctor response: 1) Small amount of fluid in para-adnexal area and posterior CDS. This is normal. 2) The 6 mm and 15 mm follicles in ovarian parenchyma. These are normal.3) Thick septation and how it is formed. It is formed by hormonal stimulation of ovaries.4) The lesions in my lumen. These are also normal.5) The cyst fell under. It could be either serous or mucinous cyst. It is difficult to say which without seeing an ultrasound. You can discuss with your treating physician regarding the same.

It occurs when muscle tendon insertion becomes inflamed or injured. As you mentioned you are taking rest from badminton. You need to stretch your muscles regularly to prevent further strain. Exercises like static contraction and static stretching will prevent further strain. Warm water bath can be taken. You may apply ice pack for local application. You should consult physiotherapist for proper guidance about exercises. Hope this answers your question. Patient query: Hello doctor,I just want to get my brother\s CBC annual report checked. Is everything fine? I see lymphocytes little high. Is that dangerous? I am worried and he is actually very healthy and fine last week he had loose motion but now he is fine and fit again.
Doctor response: 1. The high lymphocyte count may be due to infection or inflammation.2. I would like to know about his age, sex, weight, etc., to give more specific information.3. In general, a normal range of total leukocyte counts ranges from 4000/mm3 to 11,000/mm3. Lymphocytes comprise about 20% to 40% of all white blood cells.4. A slightly higher than normal amount of lymphocytes can occur during an active infection.5. There are many types of lymphocytes so it is important to have a complete blood count (CBC) which will identify the type of lymphocytes present.6. If your brother has any symptoms such as fever, chills, night sweats, etc., then I would recommend having a CBC done immediately.7

Patient query: Hi doctor,My teeth have become yellow. I also have stains on my teeth. I am trying to reduce the stains by cleaning the teeth. What can be done? Do you recommend any toothpaste or whitener?

Patient query: Hello doctor,My fiancee took four Yasmin pills as emergency contraception. But after that, she felt so weak and had heavy breathing. So due to that, we decided not to take another four pills after 12 hours. Will the first four pills stop unplanned pregnancy? That was taken within less than 30 hours after we had sexual intercourse. Looking for your kind advice. She is feeling better now but I am afraid to continue with another four pills. Also, I have read that Yasmin can increase blood clot which can be deadly. Please advise.
Doctor response: 4 yasmin tablets will not prevent an unplanned pregnancy if taken later than 72 hours of unprotected sex. It is effective only up to 72 hours. If taken in time then it is almost 95% effective. The side effects of yasmin include nausea vomiting, breast tenderness or swelling, headache, weight gain, dizziness etc. These symptoms generally subside after few days. Its effectiveness decreases if used more frequently or for long duration. There is no increased risk of blood clots associated with its use. Hope this helps you.

Patient query: Hello doctor,Would NorLevo pill work if a female has taken Ecstasy pill and after 10 hours she takes the morning-after pill. Will this have an effect or not? Please, can you advise me on this and ovulation? And also, how long does it take a female to fall pregnant?
Doctor response: Hi, I think that some women may be very lucky with taking the emergency contraceptive pill within 72 hours of having unprotected sex, but there is no guarantee. The best way to prevent any unwanted pregnancy is to use regular birth control. It will be better for your mental health if you do not rely on emergency contraception as a regular form of birth control. In terms of getting pregnant, it varies from woman to woman. Some women get pregnant immediately after stopping regular birth control while others may take months before they become pregnant again. There is no way to predict this. Hope I have answered your query. Let me know if I can assist you further.

Patient query: Hello doctor,I have applied steroid cream (Betnovate-C) and my skin has become extremely thin and dark now. A dermatologist recommended me to try dermaroller so I want to know is it safe? And will it work? Please explain in detail as nothing has worked for me.
Doctor response: Hi, Dermarollers are used for collagen induction therapy. In this procedure, micro needles are used to create tiny channels on the surface of the skin. These channels stimulate the body to produce more collagen and elastin fibers which help to restore normal texture and appearance of the skin. It may be done under local anesthesia or without any painkillers. They can be used to treat acne scars, pitted scars, stretch marks, wrinkles, fine lines, deep furrows, etc. You should discuss with your doctor about its advantages and disadvantages before starting treatment. Hope I have answered your query. Let me know if I can assist you further.

Patient query: Hello doctor,I have been on Lo Loestrin Fe for four months. I have never missed the pills on any days. I started to develop pregnancy symptoms such as nausea, food aversion, breast tenderness, dizziness, crying and fatigue. I stopped taking the pill and took three pregnancy tests in the morning using fresh urine. All the pregnancy tests were negative and I have been bleeding bright red blood for a day. I have to change the tampon every three to four hours. I am still experiencing nausea, food aversion and have chills. I am not running a fever. I had experienced similar symptoms before also on a 30 mg combined birth control pill. That time, the symptoms resolved when I stopped using the pills. Though my urine pregnancy tests are negative, will these symptoms suggest that I am pregnant?
Doctor response: 1. Symptoms of nausea, vomiting, food aversion, breast tenderness etc. may occur with pregnancy or due to hormonal imbalance during the menstrual cycle.2. In case of pregnancy, these symptoms appear at around one week after conception (fertilization).3. Since your pregnancy test is negative, it suggests that you are not pregnant.4. However, it does not mean that you are definitely not pregnant either. You can get an ultrasound done to confirm/rule out pregnancy.5. It is important to rule out pregnancy because if you are pregnant, you should continue your medications because the fetus may be harmed by stopping them abruptly.

Patient query: Hi doctor,I visited an Asian massage parlor and received anilingus and a whole body tongue massage on an exposed pimple on my back that was slightly bleeding from irritation during the massage. After the massage, I immediately showered with soap. Am I at risk for any STDs or STIs? I do not currently have any symptoms or visual changes but I am still worried. I did not notice any bite marks on her and she appeared in good health but I am still worried. Is rabies a concern at all?
Doctor response: 1) No need to worry about STDs/STIs as you do not have any symptoms.2) Rabies is a concern at all. You were not bitten by this masseuse.3) Anilingus is a high-risk activity, so you may get infected with some viruses like HPV etc., but these are not serious and will resolve within few months.4) In case if you develop fever, headache, muscle pain, skin rashes then you must see your doctor without delay.5) Wishing you good health

Patient query: Hello doctor,I am a 22 year old healthy male. Last month, I had undergone Nesbit plication surgery for congenital penile curvature. The surgery resulted in a deep wound that is not healing properly. I had the same surgery five years ago, and there was no wound at all. Now, it has been a month, and I do not seem to notice any improvement. Does penile skin grow back or would I need a skin graft? How long will it take to grow back? I am currently using Jelonet and gauze. I do not smoke or drink alcohol. I do not use drugs. How can I speed up the healing process? I have attached a picture of the wound. Kindly look into it.
Doctor response: 1) Wounds usually heal within 3-4 weeks after surgery unless there is infection or other complications.2) You may be having some kind of infection which is causing the slow healing. You should consult your surgeon again & get examined by him/her.3) If it is infection then you will require antibiotics along with steroids.4) If it is due to some other reason then you may require another surgical procedure.5) You may also require a skin graft if the wound does not heal even after taking antibiotics.6) Smoking and alcohol consumption may delay the healing of wounds so avoid them as much as possible.7) You may apply some moisturizers like petroleum jelly over the wound to improve the healing.8) Take care...!

Patient query: Hi doctor,I am 35 years old and my weight is 56 kg. My daughter is 3 years 3 months old. My doctor advised me to take one Femilon tablet daily from the first day of my period for contraception purpose. Last day of my period was 22nd of last month. At 21st night of this month, I felt that my period has started and took one tablet at bedtime. But, yesterday and today I got only spotting and the period has not started properly. I am continuing the tablet regularly at night for the last two days. Should I continue to take the tablet regularly till completion of the pack of 21? Will protection start from the first month or do we have to use extra protection like a condom? Should I start taking a fresh pack on the first day of every period?
Doctor response: 1. You should take the pill regularly as prescribed by your doctor. Spotting can occur in some women during the first few cycles of the pill due to hormonal imbalance. It will settle down within a few months. 2. The pills provide protection against pregnancy if taken regularly and correctly. 3. Yes, you should start a new pack on the first day of each cycle.

Patient query: Hi doctor,I have irregular periods with very heavy bleeding, clots, cramps, stabbing pains in my pelvic area with no pattern connecting to bleeding. Some days, I am so fatigue and cannot function. This started five years ago. I had constant bleeding following coil insertion. Then it was removed and had a miscarriage at six weeks. When I was pregnant, there was no bleeding but had spotting throughout. Since delivery I am suffering again with irregular and heavy bleeds. It became worse for the past eight months. I have IBS which is stress related. I am taking Adalat for high blood pressure, which is under control. I was prescribed Mefenamic acid and Tranexamic acid as I refused coil due to previous bleeding with one and refused Esmya due to side effects. My transvaginal ultrasound found two polycystic ovaries and bulky adenomyotic looking anteverted uterus vascular ++ on anterior wall. The size was 2 x 3 x 0.9 cm. There are no fibroids or polyps or other pelvic masses or free fluid. Then what is it?
Doctor response: 1) I would suggest that you do not take mefenamic acid and tranexamic acid. These medicines can cause blood clotting problems. They should be avoided.2) You need to get an evaluation from an endocrinologist who will order blood work that includes thyroid and prolactin levels.3) Polycystic ovarian disease (PCOD) does involve hormonal imbalance and can result in irregular cycles.4) Adenomyosis involves growth of the lining of the uterus into the muscle wall.5) Anteversion means the uterine cavity is facing upward instead of downward.6) Bulk of this information has been obtained from your ultrasound examination.7) I recommend seeing an endocrinologist who can help with treatment options.

Patient query: Hello doctor,My 1-year-old child has been diagnosed with tetralogy of Fallot. She has been experiencing fast breathing, difficulty in feeding, failure to thrive, clubbed fingers but the cardiologist told me they will not be in a rush to fix the problem. I cannot stand what she is going through. What is her survival rate? Can I have the problem solved early? Of note, she is currently on Lasix and Aldactone.
Doctor response: 1) The Tetralogy of Fallot is a congenital heart defect that occurs when there is an obstruction to blood flow from the right ventricle to the pulmonary artery. This causes oxygenated blood to mix with deoxygenated blood, which can cause cyanosis (blue color of skin).2) The survival rates for this condition are very good. The majority of patients who undergo surgery at 6 months of age or earlier, will have a normal life expectancy.3) In your case, since she is already one year old, it might be too late for surgical correction. However, she should still continue taking medication prescribed by her doctor. Hope I have answered your question. Let me know if I can assist you further.

Patient query: Hello doctor,I am 18 years old. I have chronic pain in joints and morning stiffness. I have normal C3, C4 blood work. My vitamin D level was 12.6 ng/ml before and at present it is 28 ng/ml.
Doctor response: 28ng/ml of Vitamin D is within normal range. You may need to get your Vitamin D levels checked again after a few months. It would be helpful if you could provide additional information such as any other symptoms that you might be experiencing, medications that you might be taking (including over-the-counter medications), and any other relevant medical history.

Patient query: Hi doctor,I have A+ blood group. But, will marrying a girl of the same blood group (A+) create any problems in having children or they lead to a diseased child?
Doctor response: 1. There is no problem with getting pregnant if both partners have the same blood group.2. The only problem that can occur is Rh negative women who need anti D injection after delivery. This is not a serious problem and it cures itself within few weeks.3. Most importantly, your baby should be immunized against Hepatitis B at birth. If not done then consult your pediatrician for the same.

Patient query: Hello doctor,I have mild scoliosis convex to the left and was wondering if a left knee arthroscopy can be the cause of my posture and/or pain issues. For example, sitting, standing. Also, having scoliosis, would that cause a blood clot (pulmonary embolism) after this surgery? With being a severe asthmatic.
Doctor response: 1. Yes, it is possible for a knee arthroscope to cause your posture issue.2. No, there is no direct link between scoliosis and pulmonary embolism.3. Asthma should not hamper your surgery, but make sure you get anesthesia which is compatible with your disease. Hope I have answered your query. Let me know if I can assist you further.

Patient query: Hello doctor, I think I was bitten by a bat, so I wanted to know how to know that if I was really bitten by a bat. I did not felt anything at that time but some itching after that. I am not sure that I was bitten by a bat, so I wanted to know how do we feel when bitten by a bat. Also I saw that the thing which landed on my neck was small but had small wings that looked like a bat. I was asking ways to distinguish that I was bitten by a bat or not.
Doctor response: 1) You should look for signs of bite marks as well as symptoms such as fever, headache, rashes etc.2) A blood test can confirm presence of rabies virus in your body.3) Examination of the bat and its behavior is also important as there have been cases wherein bats were found to be healthy even though they were known to transmit rabies.4) If you have any doubts then consult a physician who will examine you and advise you accordingly.

Patient query: Hello doctor,My wife aged 38 has been suffering from abnormal hair loss for the last few years. Hair continuously falls the whole day. It is so severe that we have to clean the rooms every few minutes. Even without any touch on the head, it falls continuously.We have a daughter aged 10. We consulted with a doctor and she is taking medicines as per his advice but the condition has not improved. Kindly prescribe for her.
Doctor response: 1) I would like to know what type of medications she is taking?2) Is there any family history of hair fall or baldness?3) Is she under stress?4) Does she suffer from any chronic illnesses(thyroid problems)?5) What is the texture of hair?6) Any other associated symptoms?7) Are her periods regular?8) Is her weight normal?9) How much does she exercise?10) Does she take any supplements/vitamins regularly?11) What is her diet like?12) Does she have any scalp/skin conditions?13) Are her nails brittle or discolored?14) Is she a smoker/alcoholic?15) Does she have any allergies?16) Is she having menstruation abnormalities?

Patient query: Hello doctor,I am suspicious of lymphoma. In the summer, I had an itchy rash on my neck, it went away, came back, and now went again. I have bilateral hip and bone pain. I have night sweats two to three times weekly. I had a low-grade fever right before my period and will go away. No palpable or noticeable lymph nodes except in thigh about an inch away from the groin. I have had CBC's and sed rates completed at least five times in two months. I took a chest x-ray, head and abdomen CT scan, and pelvic ultrasound. I consulted an ENT who looked down the throat with a scope, and everything is negative, so doctors will not pursue lymphoma any further. Do you think with everything so far, should I still be investigating lymphoma?I am currently on Lisinopril 20 mg.
Doctor response: 1) Your symptoms are suggestive of lymphoma but all your tests are negative. You need to get a FNAC done of that lump which is in the groin area. The treatment for this depends upon the type of lymphoma. A biopsy would help us to know what type of lymphocytes are present in the tissue and then we can treat accordingly.2) The other possibility is that it could be reactive hyperplasia. Please visit a good surgeon and get a FNAC done of that lump.

Patient query: Hi doctor,My 9 months old baby had a high fever, cough, and cold. Initially, it was the fever that was concerning. Later the cough was severe and hospitalized for bronchiolitis. He was put on a nebulizer and after three days his condition has improved. So, the doctor suggested moving from the nebulizer to Asthalin huf puf. Later that night, he had a continuous cough for one hour and was then back on nebulizer. He is put on oxygen support as his SpO2 dropped to around 86. We are much worried as he is premature and was formula fed mostly. Please let us know if this behavior is normal with bronchiolitis.
Doctor response: Hi, Welcome to Chat Doctor forum. I am sorry to hear about your child. Bronchitis usually occurs due to viral infections of respiratory tract. It can be caused by bacterial infections also. But in most cases, it is viral. The symptoms like fever and cough will come down spontaneously within 7-10 days. The asthma medications will help him to breathe better. Continuous coughing can be because of post infectious wheezing or reactive airways disease. The best treatment for it is inhaled bronchodilators and inhaled corticosteroids (ICS). You may need to consult a pediatrician who will advise you accordingly. Hope this helps you. Wishing your child good health. Best regards.

Patient query: Hi doctor,I was on a business trip and my friend and I went to a high-end brothel. My friend hired two girls and brought them back to the hotel. He had to take a phone call and while the girls were waiting for him they performed oral sex on me for a few minutes without a condom. They had no symptoms in their lips and facial region. I am worried, I contracted herpes. I got tested for chlamydia, syphilis, gonorrhea, hepatitis, and HIV and they came up negative. It has been four weeks since the incindent and I have no herpes symtomps. What are my chances of having herpes? I know people might not show symptoms. I am married and I felt very guilty for what I had done and told my wife. We are planing to have kids. What are the chances of her getting herpes and passing on to our baby? I appreciate all your help with my concerns.
Doctor response: Hi there, Thank you for writing to us at Chat Doctor. If you have never had any symptoms of genital herpes before then your risk of developing it is quite low (0-1%). You should be happy that you did not get infected by these girls as it would have caused much more problems if you get infected now. But it looks like you have taken care of yourself well. The most important thing is that you do not develop any symptoms of genital herpes soon. If you do, kindly consult an Infectious Disease specialist who can diagnose this condition through a simple blood test and prescribe antivirals which will prevent further complications. Hope this helps you. Take care.

Patient query: Hello doctor,How accurate are skin prick tests for predicting positive reactions? My family is interested in a pet and I have had negative skin prick and blood work tests for dander. Before we bring a pet in and before my kids become bonded, is it reasonable to assume negative tests will translate in no reactions. Occasionally, when I interact with animals, I have a reaction but it is difficult to determine whether it is actually the pollen which I am highly allergic to.
Doctor response: Hi, Welcome to Chat Doctor forum. Skin prick test can be very helpful in diagnosis of allergy. It is positive if there is redness at least 10 mm within 20 minutes after testing. It should be done by an expert dermatologist or immunologist as they know how to interpret them. You may need to repeat once or twice to get correct result. But generally they are very reliable in prediction of allergies. Hope this answers your question.

Patient query: Hello doctor,I had the Skyla IUD inserted two months ago to lighten my very heavy menstrual flows hopefully. My first period after insertion was very heavy and painful, more than usual, but I heard that was likely to happen. It lasted for two and a half weeks. Since then, I have had spotting daily, some days heavier than others, but very frequent. I also have been experiencing mild cramping and bleeding after intercourse. Is this a dangerous condition?
Doctor response: 1st of all, you need not worry as the symptoms you are describing are common in early post-insertion stage of IUDs. 2ndly, it is not dangerous at all, however, if you want you can remove the IUD and see how your periods are going to be. 3rdly, you should also take progesterone pill for one week after each period to reduce the frequency of spotting. Hope this helps.

Patient query: Hello doctor,I began taking Ortho Tri-Cyclen Lo at the start of this month due to follicular cysts. I have observed two bruises on arms and one on my leg. Are these side effects of the contraceptive?
Doctor response: Hi, Yes It is possible that you may get some bruise while taking contraceptives like ortho tri cyclen lo. But it is not common. The most common side effect which can be seen in about 10% women is nausea or vomiting. If you are experiencing any other symptoms then you should consult your gynecologist immediately. Hope this information helps.

Patient query: Hello doctor,I am scheduled to receive a frenectomy to close the gap in my two front teeth, but I have done some research and it has all told me I need to get braces following the procedure but my dentist told me it was not necessary although my gap is quite large. I was wondering if you could help me understand the process more. Thank you.
Doctor response: Hi welcome to Chat Doctor forum.  I understand your concern. Frenectomy is a surgical procedure for treating gum problems. In this procedure, the gingival tissues covering the jaw bone are cut and sutured together with the help of stitches. In case of wide gap between the two teeth, the surgeon may recommend braces after frenectomy surgery. But it depends upon the condition of the oral cavity. The decision will be taken by the surgeon only at the time of surgery. So do not worry about that. Hope I have answered your query. Let me know if I can assist you further.

Patient query: Hello doctor,I had a boil on my lower leg last month. It was paining and in five days it was filled with pus. Doctor advised it poping and after that, I took Amoxiclav 625 twice daily for three days and keep on dressing.After 15 days another one appeared on the upper side of the knee on the same leg. I used black tape (Atropa) and it popped in five days. On the fifth day, another appeared on the same leg and I took Amoxiclav 625 for five days twice daily. It popped yesterday and today is the fifth day of medicine. Now today, I am feeling another coming near it. What should I do? Please suggest.Should I use Mupirocin on it three to four times a day? Should I continue Amoxiclav more?Please guide me if anything else should I do including any home remedy I can not bear more pain and I do not want to take medicine any longer.
Doctor response: Hi, Welcome to Chat Doctor forum. As your boils have recurred, we need to find out what caused them in the first place. You may be suffering from some sort of skin disease like acne or fungal infection. Boils are usually caused by an underlying infection of hair follicles, which is then spread to surrounding area giving rise to similar lesions. Treating the underlying cause will help cure the boils. To know the exact condition, consult dermatologist and get examined. Also, kindly send photos of the affected areas to us so that we can guide you better. Hope this helps. Take care

Patient query: Hi doctor,Initially, I noticed four red rashes on my chest and neck. On the next day, I got another four rashes on my face and after two days, I got rashes on my hand and fingers. I also have mild fever and joint pain. All the symptoms have started after my treatment for herpes from a hospital. Do all my symptoms say something about HIV? Previously, I was tested negative for HIV on the 27th day of exposure.
Doctor response: 1. It is unlikely that your current symptoms are related to HIV as this virus takes longer than 2-3 weeks to manifest its symptoms.2. The most common cause of skin lesions at times of stress or anxiety is hives.3. In order to confirm the diagnosis, get yourself evaluated by a dermatologist who can do physical examination and if required perform some tests like blood sugar levels and complete blood count.4. Please avoid scratching the rashes as it may aggravate the condition.5. You should take antihistamines and apply calamine lotion over the affected areas.

Patient query: Hello doctor,I am a 37-year-old female. For the past couple of weeks, I have foot ache and feel a cold tingling sensation on and off. My blood reports and ECG are normal. I have no health issues. But I have a cheek tingling occasionally.
Doctor response: Hi, Welcome to Chat Doctor forum. As you describe your symptoms, it seems that you may be having an inflammation in your nerves. This can occur due to many reasons such as diabetes, any injury to the area, infection, etc. You need to consult a neurologist for proper examination and treatment. He will examine your eyes, ears, nose, throat, chest, heart, abdomen, spine, nervous system, muscles, joints, skin, extremities, etc. for any problems. He may order some tests like MRI scan or CT scan if he feels necessary. After diagnosis he will prescribe medicines for you. Till then, take complete bed rest and avoid heavyweight lifting. Avoid stress and anxiety. Take balanced nutritious diet. Hope this helps. Wish you good health. Thank you.

Patient query: Hi doctor,I had high blood pressure, low heart rate. Is my ECG showing infarction? I have no chest pain. At the time of ECG, my blood pressure was 168/100 and heart beat 46.
Doctor response: Hi thanks for contacting Chat Doctor... Read your query as you have high BP and slow heart rate with ECG finding.... Here you can get the cardiac arrhythmia which is a rhythm problem in the heart due to some abnormality like conduction or electrical impulse pathway. It can be sinus tachycardia, atrial fibrillation, ventricular tachycardia etc. You need further evaluation by echocardiography and ambulatory monitoring of heart rate to rule out any cardiac cause. For now take tab Atenolol 50 mg once daily for control of BP and slow heart rate. Hope this will help you.

Patient query: Hello doctor,Does the keto diet positively affect and alleviate stomach issues such as IBS?
Doctor response: Hi, Welcome to Chat Doctor forum. I am sorry for your problem. Stomach upsets may be related to some food allergies or intolerances. Keto diet is not likely to help in this situation. It is mostly useful in controlling blood sugar levels. You should try to identify and avoid any food items that cause these problems. Wish you good health.

Patient query: Hello doctor,I have been prescribed Adderall 10 mg two tablets daily for ADHD and 10 mg Propranolol as needed for anxiety. Adderall is helping my ADHD. However, I have experienced increased anxiety and all the physical symptoms that come along with it, including chest tightness since taking the Adderall. I do not have chest pain or increased heart rate. Is it safe to assume the Propranolol while taking Adderall?
Doctor response: Hi, thanks for posting your query in Chat Doctor. The adderall has stimulants which may cause increase in anxiety. But if you are taking propranolol, then it will help in reducing the anxiety. So, I suggest you should take both medications together. Hope this information was useful to you. Wish you good health

Patient query: Hello doctor,My wife took abortion pills before three weeks, but still, her periods did not stop. She is getting some fiber along with the blood and we think that this is not normal. Can you please suggest?
Doctor response: 1) It may be due to incomplete abortion or retained tissue in uterus2) Get ultrasonography done to rule out any pathology3) If she has prolonged bleeding then get examined by gynecologist4) Take progesterone pill under supervision of gynecologist5) If she does not have any other symptoms like pain abdomen or foul smelling vaginal discharge than it should be fine

Patient query: Hi doctor, I am a 35 year old female. I have on and off sharp pain in the left upper chest. Sometimes, it radiates to the neck and sometimes shoulder and upper arm. My ECG, bloods and chest x-ray were normal. With all these tests, is it likely to be the heart? Movement does not seem to influence the pain. Sometimes, I get a bit dizzy too. Pain seems to come randomly. Doctor prescribed Diclac 50 mg thrice a day and Clorom 500 mg twice a day. What else could it be? Colonoscopy has done recently due to family history of cancer and that was clear. Ultrasound of the abdomen was also clear.
Doctor response: 1. It is unlikely to be heart related as your ECG and other cardiac parameters were normal. 2. The pain could be musculoskeletal in origin. Have you tried exercises for strengthening the core muscles? Core muscle weakness can cause referred pain in the arms and legs. 3. You should avoid lifting heavy weights or straining yourself while performing physical activities. 4. For now, try taking some painkillers like ibuprofen if the pain worsens. Hope this helps you.

Patient query: Hello doctor,Three months ago, I had sex with my partner. Fourteen days later, I had my normal periods. But now two months have passed by and I have not got my periods. Moreover, I have used home fertility kit and that has shown negative results.Am I pregnant?What is the reason for my missing periods?
Doctor response: 1) If your period was regular before this episode of intercourse, then it is unlikely that you are pregnant.2) Missing of periods after an episode of unprotected sex should be investigated to rule out pregnancy.3) Home pregnancy test can give false positive results in early stages of pregnancy (i.e. 5-7 days prior to missed period).4) You may need to get ultrasound scan done at earliest to confirm or rule out pregnancy.5) There could be many other reasons like stress, anxiety etc.which might lead to delay in periods.6) Get yourself examined by gynecologist for further evaluation.

Patient query: Hello doctor,I had sex with my fiance one and a half months back and within an hour, I took I-pill. Eight days later, I had some spotting and after that, I usually had my periods a week later. But, this time it did not happen and I am totally freaked out and I did try sugar pregnancy test at home but it did not show any sign of pregnancy. What should I do now and my periods are delayed by I-pill or some other reasons. What should I do? Please help.
Doctor response: 1st, i-pill is 95% effective in preventing pregnancy if taken within 72 hours of unprotected intercourse. 2nd, spotting may occur due to hormonal changes during the pill use. 3rd, delay in period may be due to stress, skipped meals, hormone imbalance etc. 4th, get investigated for thyroid profile, prolactin levels and ultrasound pelvis to rule out any pathology. 5th, you can take a home pregnancy test as well.

Patient query: Hello doctor,How accurate in your opinion is the Lelli ACL (Lever test)? I am almost three months post-op of having my ACL reconstructed along with a few lesions addressed during the surgery. I am concerned I have ruptured my ACL again after feeling a short sharp pain when turning in the sand on vacation. It has been three days since the incident and the knee now feels a lot looser and I have some pain in different areas. I have tried the Lachman test with no noticeable shifting, and the Lelli test was positive with good leverage hopefully assisted by my intact ACL. I will have to see my surgeon and physio soon but I am just wondering how accurate the Lelli test is. There seems to be no difference when comparing the test in both knees.
Doctor response: 1) You should have an MRI scan done to confirm the diagnosis & exclude any other pathology like meniscus injury or ligament tear.2) The Lelli test is not very sensitive for detecting ACL deficiency. It is better to get it confirmed with MRI findings.3) If there is any doubt then go for arthroscopy; this would help to know the exact status of the knee joint.4) Hope I have answered your question. Let me know if I can assist you further. Take care

Patient query: Hi doctor,I am a student, and I stay in a highly polluted area. I got shifted here five months ago. Early in the morning as soon as I wake up for five to ten minutes, my eyes start paining and irritating. Few times it also turns red. Due to this I could not wake up on time and also feel uncomfortable. When I study I feel some dryness in my eyes. Please help me out with some suggestion.
Doctor response: 1) You should wear sunglasses while going outside because the glare of sunlight can be very troublesome for your eyes. 2) Avoid smoking if you do it.3) Use lubricant eye drops like Restasis or Lumigan.4) Take vitamin C supplements.5) Wash your face before sleeping and use a moisturizer after washing.6) Visit an ophthalmologist who will examine your eyes and suggest the best treatment.

Patient query: Hi doctor,My mother is having difficulty in breathing. We have consulted a doctor. Based up on the diagnosis, he advised a surgery for the polyp in the right side of her nose. She is 45 years old. Her weight is 65 kg and height is 5\4". Currently, no biopsy has been done. Do we need to check biopsy? Can you please provide your opinion and the severity level?
Doctor response: 1) No, it is not necessary to do biopsy if there is only one polyp as per history given by you.2) Biopsy may be considered when there is more than one polyp or when the size of the polyp is large enough to make a definite diagnosis.3) In case of multiple polyps, an endoscopic resection (removal of polyp) with biopsy is recommended before considering any other surgical procedure.4) The severity depends on the number of polyps present and their size.

Patient query: Hello doctor,Just this morning my brother told me he had pain in his ribs the day before and it seemed a bit weird this morning too. But, he did not have any pain. There seems to be a weird bump on one side of his rib cage. What could be wrong?
Doctor response: Hi Dear, Welcome to Chat Doctor. I am Chat Doctor.  I understand your concern. This is most likely muscular strain or soft tissue injury. Rib cage bumps can occur due to many reasons like muscle spasm, muscle strain, fracture, etc. I would suggest you to do following things.1) Take complete bed rest for 3 days.2) Apply warm compresses over the affected area.3) Avoid heavyweight lifting.4) Take analgesic medication like ibuprofen.5) Do stretching exercises to improve mobility of rib cage.6) Do back strengthening exercise to avoid future rib cage injuries. Hope above information will help you. In case of further query, happy to help again. Wishing you good health. Thank you & Regards.

Patient query: Hello doctor,Why do I have dry skin around my mouth and how can I treat it?

Patient query: Hello doctor,I am 24 years old and I have a combination skin type. I have minimal breakouts basically during my periods but these pimples leave a lot of marks. Apply sunscreen gel before going out in daytime.3. Keep your face clean and Chat Doctor.

Patient query: Hello doctor,I have had a rash on my right chest for five months. I asked many doctors but no one can say excatly what it is. It is a red small rash without symptoms. I did try some stuff like hydrocortisone 1% cream for two weeks and an antifungal medicine for two weeks but nothing happened. Should I be careful when I wash my hair or face after touching the affected area? What can I do to make sure this does not come back after it has gone.

Patient query: Hello doctor, I am a 35 year old male. What is the normal range of cortisol in a 24-hour collected urine probe? Is having too low cortisol levels in 24-hours collected urine probe a clinical matter? In the last six months, I had three urine testings with the account of cortisol between 10-12 \xb5g/24 hours. I am dealing with PTSD and a distinct fatigue.
Doctor response: Hi, Thanks for writing to us. Cortisol is produced by your adrenal gland and helps regulate blood pressure, heart rate, blood sugar levels, body weight and metabolism. It also helps in fighting stress and infections. The normal range of cortisol varies from person to person but it is usually between 80 to 290 micrograms per deciliter (mcg/dL). Low cortisol level can be due to any reason like Cushing disease or Addison disease. You need to get evaluated properly if this is the case. Please consult your doctor at earliest. Hope this information was helpful. Any further clarifications feel free to ask.

In the meantime, some orthopedic appliances such as a Twin Block or Herbst may be used to guide the growth pattern of your jaw and head.  If the functional cause cannot be determined then you will need to consider other treatment options.  Hope you got my reply.  Wishing you good health. Regards
