Patient query: Hello doctor,My baby is one year old. She has soft teeth in the front and she is not able to bite anything with the upper teeth. If she bites, the teeth start chipping. What am I to do?
Doctor response: Hi dear, This is because of the lack of strength in the jaw muscles which is called as TMJ dysfunction. The TMJ or temporomandibular joint is the connection between the lower jaw and the skull. It helps in opening and closing of the mouth. When there is any problem like- injury, arthritis, muscle spasm etc., it leads to pain and difficulty in opening and closing the mouth. For this, you can consult an orthodontist who will give you exercises for the muscles of the jaws. Also, a physiotherapist can help you out by giving you some physical therapy. Hope that answers your query. Thanks

Patient query: Hi doctor,I am a male. I had unprotected vaginal sex single exposure with a girl. Nine months later, I found she is HIV positive. My question: I have read that after a certain window period time (three months after getting negative) is conclusive and even after (six months) confirmation is definitely negative. But, why are all these other people saying you can go years without showing positive and that is really freaking me out big time. Is it true that it takes years to come up positive or does it only take six months to know it 100 %? What is true? Also, there is a doctor who says no test is 100 % reliable. I am still 15 months post exposure. HIV RNA PCR qualitative all are negative. 20 months post exposure, HIV-Alere combo test result is negative. Any further test is needed?I am negative now. Will my result change in the future? What is 100 % window period? Please clarify my doubts. Thank you.
Doctor response: 1. The window period for HIV is from 3 months to 6 months. This means if you were exposed within this period then you will be able to detect HIV antibodies in your blood samples.2. People say that it may take years to develop symptoms of HIV but this is not entirely correct. It may take years before the virus starts replicating at high levels and causes symptoms.3. The Alere Combo test is a combination of HIV antigen and p24 antigens. The HIV antigen is detected earliest and the p24 antigen is detected later. Both tests are combined to get an early detection.4. As your HIV RNA is negative, you do not need any further tests as you are already negative. However, you should continue to practice safe sex and avoid risky sexual behavior.

Patient query: Hello doctor,I got hit on my cheek by a rock while doing some work. The area under my eye swole up and caused me to have a black eye. Now a whole one year two months later, I still feel the bruising of under eye similar to the look of a black eye. Is there a certain term for this?
Doctor response: Hi, thanks for your query. Yes, it is called traumatic hematoma. There are many causes but most common are blunt injury to the face with bleeding into the subcutaneous tissue. It usually resolves within few weeks but may take longer time depending upon the extent of damage. You can apply cold compresses over the affected area to reduce swelling. Take anti-inflammatory medications like ibuprofen or naproxen if you have any pain associated with it. Hope this helps.

Doctor response: 1) Alopecia areata is an autoimmune disease wherein body attacks its own hair follicles leading to sudden patches of hair loss. Usually, it occurs in scalp but can occur anywhere, including beard area.2) Folliculitis is also caused by bacterial infection which occurs due to blockage of hair follicle by sebaceous gland secretions.3) Although your dermatologist might have thought it is folliculitis, it would be better if she/he examines it properly to rule out other possibilities like fungal infection etc.4) Since it is not clear from your post whether you have any other symptoms associated with it (like pain, fever, redness etc.), it will be better to get examined by dermatologist again.5) The fact that you have low WBC count could be due to some underlying problem or may just be coincidental.6) Low

Patient query: Hello doctor,I have done RNA PCR test. The report showed that the target was not detected in the collected serum. HIV RNA was detected below, within and above the linear range of the assay. Can we conclude that the virus has entered into the body? After one week, I got western blot test also done. That is showing negative. Please suggest what my next step should be?
Doctor response: 150 copies/ml of plasma indicates low level of virus activity in your case, however it doesn't mean that you don't have HIV infection. Only if viral load is > 500 copies / ml it can be considered as active infection. So wait for another 2-3 months to get repeat PCR test done to confirm whether there is any increase or decrease in copy number. If you remain non-reactive then no need to worry about HIV infection.

Doctor response: 1. Retrograde ejaculation is due to failure of the seminal vesicle which stores the secretion produced by the prostate gland and other accessory organs of the genitourinary system. It is caused by either damage to the sphincter mechanism of the urethra or by obstruction of the urethra itself. The treatment depends upon the cause of retrograde ejaculation. 2. You have to get your blood sugar levels checked as you may have diabetes. If you don't have diabetes, then you can consult a neurologist who would examine you physically and would refer you to a urologist if required.

So if your wife has taken this pill in time then there should be no chance of getting pregnant but as you have noticed she has started having periods. The best way to know whether she had or didn't have a period while using this pill is to check out her basal body temperature. This will help you to find out if she was actually ovulating during those days.

Patient query: Hi doctor,I am taking Larin Fe as a birth control pill. It is a combined monophasic pill with three weeks of active pills and one week of inactive pills. I currently started pill packs a week back but wanted to change it to a weekend to avoid weekend withdrawal bleeding. How can I do so without losing the effectiveness of the pill? My idea was to wait until my placebo week which starts on a weekday and then to take the placebos only up until weekend and start a new pack then. Would this work without changing the effectiveness of my pill?
Doctor response: 1) The first thing that comes to mind regarding your question is that if you are on a monophasic pill (all active pills), there is no need to change any of the doses or timing of these pills.2) You could start the next pack at the beginning of the next week, i.e., the day after the last active pill of the current pack.3) This will not cause any disruption in the effectiveness of the pill. Hope this helps

Patient query: Hi doctor,Is it safe or risk to my healing process, if I smoke marijuana following a root canal treatment?
Doctor response: Thanks for contacting us with your health concern. Marijuana is not recommended in any circumstances during a period of healing. It will impair the immune system and may slow down wound healing. If you are taking pain medication for the root canal, smoking cannabis may also interfere with the efficacy of the medications. In addition, smoking has many negative effects on the body including increased risk of cancer. Please consider quitting this habit as soon as possible.

Patient query: Hello doctor,I have injured urinary bladder and the left side ureter during hysterectomy surgery by laparoscopy. Then, cystoscopy and nephrostomy were done. A catheter is used. Can surgery be done again?
Doctor response: 1. Cystoscope was not done to injure your urinary bladder or ureter.2. Uretero-pelvic junction injury is most common in laparoscopic hysterectomies.3. The risk of injury depends upon surgeon experience and expertise.4. You can undergo repair of ureter and bladder at the same time after removal of catheter.5. Repair may require open surgery if there is extensive injury involving multiple layers of muscle.6. Please consult your treating surgeon for further management. Thank you.

Patient query: Hello doctor,I went to the dentist three weeks ago and had some pain in my top molar and there turned out to be a cavity which I had filled and fixed but a few days later I started to feel the same pain in the tooth and went back to the dentist and he said he could not find anything wrong. I think I may have a crack or some type of nerve ending there and it is really bothering me.
Doctor response: Hi thanks for asking question. Read your query. This is due to the filling material placed over the decayed portion of the tooth. As the filling material is hard and brittle, it might have caused fracture of the tooth underneath. This will cause pain and fissuring. You need to go for RCT(root canal treatment) as soon as possible. Consult an endodontist and get it done. For now take analgesics like diclofenac sodium 50 mg twice daily along with antibiotics like amoxicillin 500mg TID for 5 days.

Patient query: Hello doctor,I am an 18 year old girl and I am starting to notice little moles all over my body. Nothing unusual or worrisome. Doctor response: Welcome to Chat Doctor. I understand your concern for having moles all over the body. It seems like you have congenital nevi (moles) which are very common in people with a family history of moles. There is no specific treatment available for this condition. But, one option would be to go for surgery to remove these moles as they increase the risk of skin cancer. You could discuss with your dermatologist regarding the same. Hopefully, this helps. Take care

Patient query: Hi doctor,I am a 23 year old male, a third-year medical student. For the past seven days, I have had an increased urgency and frequency to urinate. I can go even more than 30 times a day - majority of these times, I feel an increased urgency. However, when I go, only a small amount or drops come out. For the past two to three days, the urgency kind of feels to be getting worse, I feel as if I will not be able to hold it. However, I am still able to as there is no leaking. There is no burning or irritation or any discharge. No recent sexual encounters and no other associated symptoms. I take Coveram 10/10 for essential hypertension and Valdoxan 25 because I also do suffer from anxiety. I have been under stress lately as I was doing my exams this past week and finished today. I have done a few tests at my family doctor: Last week I did a dipstick which was normal apart from +1 protein. Voiding bladder US was normal (450 mL pre voiding, 45 mL post voiding). An initial urine culture was normal according to my doctor. Yesterday, I performed another dipstick and urine culture. The dipstick was normal, and early urine microscopy showed 10 to 100 white cell count. We are waiting for the cultures to return. Due to the result of the white cell count, my doctor said it would be worth a try to undergo a 5-day course of antibiotics (Keflex).Today is my third day of antibiotic treatment, symptoms are largely the same. Today, I attempted to hold my bladder. It felt fine in the morning but as the day went on, my symptoms returned and I am finding it harder to hold my bladder. Also, for the first time, I tried going for a run. The entire time I felt a heaviness in my bladder and felt a strong urge to urinate, even though I went before my run began. What do you think could be going on? My doctor believes that it is either a UTI, or most likely, a hypersensitive bladder due to exam stress. However, there have been days where I have not felt stress at all yet symptoms have continued. I am really worried as I want to go back to work in five days and I do not think I will be able to manage the way things are at the moment. My family doctor does think this will settle down now that I have finished exams. Do you think there is a chance it could? I have mentioned this query to another doctor online, and he believed it may be due to an overactive bladder. However, since I am relatively young to receive this diagnosis, I wanted a second opinion, if that is alright. Do you think this could be OAB? I am worried that it could be something serious, like multiple sclerosis. One and a half years ago, I had an episode of sudden onset numbness in one arm and fearing the same thing, I ended up having an MRI of my brain and lumbar spine which both came back negative. Do you think this could be MS?
Doctor response: Hi, thank you for providing the brief history of you. As per your complaints it seems that you might be suffering from a condition called Urinary Tract Infection(UTI). This happens due to bacterial growth in the urinary tract causing inflammation and pain. You should get a urinalysis and urine culture test done to confirm the diagnosis. Avoid taking caffeine containing Chat Doctor.  You can get treated with antibiotics like Nitrofurantoin and metronidazole, along with anti-inflammatory medicines like Diclofenac sodium. Please consult a urologist for further evaluation and management. Hope this information helps. Let me know if I can assist you further.

Patient query: Hello doctor,I need advice regarding my eyes. I use computer up to 18 hours daily. I want to protect my eyes form damage as well. So let me know if any type of glasses is available. If so, then what is the name and characteristics of lenses used for protection from computer screen?
Doctor response: Hi thanks for asking question in Chat Doctor. I can understand your concern. There are different types of glasses available in market which will help you to protect your eyes. These glasses are called as computer eyewear or photo chromatic lens. These glasses have photochromic properties that is they change their color according to ambient light. They are available in two colors blue and green. When you wear them while sitting in front of computer they turn darker with blue color and when you remove them they become clear. They also reduce the amount of blue light coming out of computer monitor. These glasses are quite helpful but not fully effective. You should also take regular breaks from computer work. Do exercise regularly and avoid eating junk food. Hope this information helps. Thanks.

Doctor response: 1. The vibration you experience is common with pin worms.2. Apple Cider Vinegar will help reduce the number of pinworms, but it won't get rid of them all. After finishing the course, take a stool examination to confirm the diagnosis.8. If you don't see any improvement even after taking Albenza, consult your physician again.9. Also, continue taking probiotic supplements.

But again this month the script was back down to 3 mg per day which means I am going to experience a minor hell again.I am a defense and aerospace engineer who works on a contract basis through an agency and the client had noticed a drop in my performance before month but back to normal last month, now they are going to see it again and I will probably lose the contract job. As you said, after a few minutes your pulse comes down to near normal levels, so you should be fine. As far as TMT test is concerned, it is not mandatory. It is done only when a patient has symptoms like chest pain, dizziness, palpitation etc.

Patient query: Hello doctor,I got a cavity last year. I have left it untreated. It hurt really bad a year ago and stopped, but is not occurring again. I have not gone to the dentist because I do not want to make my parents spend the money. So, I have just been dealing with it. But it hurts really bad. Is there anything I can do?
Doctor response: 1) I would recommend that you visit your dentist as soon as possible.2) The pain may be due to infection of the pulp (nerve inside the tooth), or an abscess formation around the infected tooth.3) In either case, you need to get a root canal treatment done for the affected tooth.4) The cost of the procedure will depend on the number of roots present in the tooth, the complexity of the access and the type of filling material used.5) You can discuss this matter with your dentist before getting the treatment done.

As these are asymptomatic, no need to worry at present. However, if it persists then you can consult an Oral Physician and get evaluated. Patient query: Hi doctor,My sister ate a bottle full of thyroid pills. She feels so weak and nervous every day. And she gets angry and her body temperature is always too warm and I searched the effect of too much of thyroid pills. Her age is 18 what should we do now?
Doctor response: 1000 mg of thyroxine per day is an excessive amount to take for any adult let alone someone who is only 18 years old. It can cause symptoms such as sweating, palpitations, tremors, nervousness, irritability, increased heart rate, and weight loss. The thyroxine dose needs to be reduced. If your sister has been taking this dosage for some time, then she may also need to go through a period of tapered doses in order to allow the thyroid gland to reset itself. In addition, it is important to make sure that there aren't other underlying causes of hyperthyroidism such as Graves disease or a goiter.

Patient query: Hi doctor,  Last month, I was given a Depo shot to stop intermenstrual bleeding that started before six months after Provera tablets did not work. Unable to do a pap smear because of the bleeding. Transvaginal Ultrasound revealed tiny (1x1.3cm) uterine fibroid, three hemorrhagic cysts, and a heterogeneous endometrial cavity. Earlier, I passed clots that look like blood mixed with chicken meat. I am terrified. Is this a side effect or do I need to go to the ER? Please help.
Doctor response: Thanks for your question and welcome to Chat Doctor! I understand your concern and would explain that having fibroids is common in women of childbearing age, and they usually don't cause problems unless they get too large. They are benign tumors made up of muscle and fibrous tissue and can vary in size from pea-sized to as large as a melon. Fibroids usually don't cause any symptoms and may only be detected during an ultrasound examination. However, sometimes they can cause heavy menstrual bleeding, pelvic pressure, painful periods, urinary frequency, constipation, and infertility. It is important to know whether your fibroids are causing these symptoms or not. You should consult with your gynecologist and discuss the symptoms you have been experiencing and get further evaluation and treatment if necessary. Hope this helps!

Patient query: Hello doctor,After a course of antibiotics, I have developed severe dry eyes, dry mouth, and photosensitivity. No tears are coming from my eyes. Doctor response: 1) Photosensitivity is not a feature of Sjogrens Syndrome.2) Dry eye is a common side effect of many medications including antibiotics.3) Dry mouth can occur as a side effect of some medicines.4) Sjogrens Syndrome is an autoimmune disease in which the body produces antibodies to its own glands (salivary and lacrimal).5) There is no specific treatment for Sjogrens Syndrome.6) You may need to use artificial tears or lubricants to help keep your eyes moist.7) You may also need to take supplements such as vitamin B complex and omega-3 fatty acids.8) I suggest that you consult with your physician regarding this matter. Hope I have answered your query. Let me know if I can assist you further.

Patient query: Hello doctor,No one is diabetic in my whole family. My sugar levels are fluctuating. My sugar levels in the past three months were 110 mg/dl, 107 mg/dl and 122 mg/dl for pre-lunch and post-lunch were 83 mg/dl, 120 mg/dl and 172 mg/dl respectively. I have never taken any medicine for diabetes.
Doctor response: 110 mg / dL (6.1 mmol / L) fasting blood glucose level is normal. That means your body is able to produce sufficient insulin to maintain your blood glucose at this level after not eating for about 10 hours. You should check your blood glucose again between 45 minutes and 90 minutes after eating something containing carbohydrates. It will be higher than the fasting level. This rise in blood glucose is due to the action of insulin which your body produces to digest the food. After that it should come down again to the fasting level within two hours. This is called the peak response or the area under curve (AUC). The AUC value can help to know how well your body is responding to the insulin produced by the pancreas. The AUC values of more than 80% are considered good.

Patient query: Hi doctor,I got a stroke but I do not know how to explain it. Twice I was bleeding along with the stroke. One type of bleeding was chronic and the other one was acute. I would like to know which type of bleeding is dangerous? And also explain the reason for the same.

Patient query: Hi doctor,I am 21 and suffering from tinnitus from last four months. The sound in the ears is not constant. It is changing. My doctor told me this is due to cold and prescribed some antibiotics. But it did not work. So he told me to visit an ENT specialist. After visiting an ENT specialist, he told me my ears are fine but I should do an audiogram. And also given me some antibiotics. There was no hearing loss in the audiogram. And the medicines also did not work. Then I again visited the doctor. This time he told me there is nothing to worry about and sent me back home. What I want to ask is, if there are any other tests that could detect why this is happening and how this could be treated?
Doctor response: Hello, Thanks for your query. Tinnitus is a symptom of many diseases, but in most cases, its cause remains unknown. It may be because of ear disorders, such as earwax buildup, or sinus issues, such as sinusitis. Certain medications, including aspirin, ibuprofen (Advil), and certain antidepressants, can cause tinnitus. Loud noises can also damage the tiny hair cells in the inner ear that send signals to the brain. Other causes include high blood pressure, diabetes, thyroid problems, and problems with the heart. You need to get evaluated by a physician who will examine and treat you accordingly. Hope this helps.

Patient query: Hello doctor,I am a 35 year old male. I weigh 68 Kg and my height 5\5". I am in a healthy status. (Blood test done on 20th January 2015) Question 2 : Should I retest for HSV-1? Question 3 : Is HSV-1 transmitted via intercourse or sexual contacts? Question 4: Is HSV-1 a life threatening disease? Question 5 : Does HSV-1 positive at present means that I had infected with HSV-1 3 or 4 months back (but no symptoms at present)? Doctor response: 1. No need to take acyclovir if your doctor has advised you not to take it. If he has advised you to take acyclovir then yes you should take it. 2. Yes you will need a repeat test to confirm the positivity. 3. No transmission through sex. It is spread by skin contact and saliva and semen. You can transmit it to your partner but it needs to be active on his or her skin or mucosa. 4. No, it is not a life threatening disease. 5. No. 6. Not sure about the efficacy of these herbal preparations.

Patient query: Hello doctor,I had chest pain. In my 2D echo report, septum jerky is given. What does is it mean? The doctor said the heart is fine.
Doctor response: It means that there is an abnormality in your heart which causes the muscle fibers to contract or relax at a different rate than normal. This can cause irregularities in the electrical conduction system of the heart and may result in symptoms such as palpitations, dizziness, fainting, or chest discomfort. But if you have no symptoms then it has nothing to do with your heart.

Doctor response: Hi, Welcome to Chat Doctor forum. I have gone through your query. Your problem seems to be due to acne. Acne is caused by hormonal changes during puberty or pregnancy or menopause or stress. It can also occur in people with oily skin or those who use cosmetics. You should avoid stress, cosmetic products containing oil and use mild cleanser twice daily. Take vitamin B12 supplements. Consult dermatologist for proper diagnosis and treatment. Hope this helps you. Thank you.

Patient query: Hi doctor,Whenever I yawn sometimes it feels like I pulled something, and on my bottom jaw I push on it and something goes up.
Doctor response: Hi, Welcome to Chat Doctor forum.  It seems that you have some problem in your jaws or temporomandibular joint. You need to see an Oral Physician who will examine your jaw movements and may advise you for X-ray of TMJ. It is advisable not to open mouth too wide as it can cause TMJ problem. If it is due to poor posture then also it can be corrected by physiotherapy exercises.  Hope this helps you. Wishing you good health. Thank you

Patient query: Hello doctor,I am an 18 years old male. I have been suffering from nightfall for one and a half years. I feel dizzy, tired, and have no concentration. Please suggest me a good medicine to cure it. Is NFcure capsules a good option in curing it?
Doctor response: Hi, thanks for writing to Chat Doctor. Night falls is nothing but a sexual disorder which occurs due to stress or anxiety. You should try to identify the cause of this problem and work towards its solution. You can take some anti-depressants like paroxetine (Brand name - Paxil) or sertraline (Zoloft) which will help you in treating your condition. I would also advise you to do regular exercise and meditation as they will help in reducing your symptoms. Hope this information was useful to you. Regards

Patient query: Hi doctor,I have been prescribed Lymecycline for my skin. I am only in week one and my skin seems to have slightly worsened, with a really big hard lump on one side of my face. Do they work by drawing the impurities to the surface initially, and is my reaction normal?
Doctor response: 1) In case of acne, it may take 4-6 weeks before improvement can be seen.2) Lymecycline is an antibiotic that works against bacteria causing acne (P.acnes).3) It is possible that your lump could be due to inflammation within the skin caused by acne.4) Please do not worry about this as this will resolve once your acne improves.5) You should continue taking the medicines and also apply some topical cream over the affected area.

Patient query: Hello doctor,I have my braces for three or four weeks I suppose to get spikes because my tongue thrusting I was wondering do I get the spikes when I go to my next visit? When will do I get the rubber bands and power chain? I hope you can tell me some more information I am looking forward to.
Doctor response: 1stly, if your tongue is still thrusting then it might cause difficulty in wearing braces & may also lead to food getting stuck between teeth. So better to consult an orthodontist & get evaluated.2ndly, spikes will be placed after 6-8 weeks of start of brace treatment.3rdly, rubber bands & power chains are placed after aligner treatment has started. You should not worry about this as these things will happen only after few months. Hope I could help you.

Patient query: Hi doctor,I took my mother to a dentist. She hit the tooth hard with a hammer and chisel to remove the second molar of upper jaw. She has experience as a dentist for 30 years; still she does not wear gloves. I am wondering, is this practice safe? My mother cried during the procedure, but the dentist told it will not pain. My mother cried because of fear. I am looking forward to hear from you. Thank you.
Doctor response: 1) It is very important that the dental surgeon wears sterile gloves while performing any surgical procedures.2) The reason why doctors wear gloves is to avoid contamination of their hands by bacteria which can cause infection.3) Whenever there is bleeding from the oral cavity, it is necessary to wear a mask to prevent spreading of bacteria in the air through coughing or sneezing.4) Even if there is no bleeding, the bacterial load in saliva is high and therefore it is better to cover your mouth when you cough or sneeze.5) Anytime a person is performing a dental procedure, they should be wearing gloves to protect themselves and the patient.

Patient query: Hello doctor,I made an STD test, and the doctor said that I have antibodies for herpes type 1 but not infected with the virus, exposed. Does this mean I am infected, and will these antibodies transferred to my partner or will disappear with time? I have attached the report. For mycoplasma, it is already treated.
Doctor response: 1) Yes, if you have antibody against herpes virus means you are infected previously with the virus and immunity developed against the infection.2) However, there is no need to worry about your sexual partners as herpes virus is not transmitted through blood/body fluids like semen, vaginal secretions etc.3) Antibody level can be detected even after 6 months of infection, so its presence doesn't indicate current infection. Hope this answers your question.

Patient query: Hello doctor,I am an epilepsy patient. I got seizure before three weeks. There was a brain trauma nine months back. The CT and MRI showed only tumor and no other problem. Last week, the EEG report showed normal. How to find whether the seizure is caused by the tumor or by the trauma or both?
Doctor response: 1) Tumors can cause seizures either directly (by direct compression of brain structures or by metabolic changes in the tumor itself) or indirectly (by hormonal effects). However, this is not usually seen with benign tumors.2) Trauma can also cause seizures if there is any damage to the brain from the injury.3) In your case, it would be best to get a repeat MRI scan to look for any new lesions or changes that may have occurred since the last scan. This will help determine if the seizures are being caused by the tumor or trauma.4) You should discuss these issues with your neurologist.

Doctor response: Hi, Welcome to Chat Doctor forum. As you are having pain in your teeth, it can be due to many reasons like decay under the filling, decay between the teeth, or an abrasion of the fillings. You should consult your Dentist for this problem. If required he will examine and treat accordingly. You may need Root Canal Treatment of the affected tooth. Hope this helps you. Thanks

Patient query: Hi doctor,I am a 26 year old male, and I get severe pain in the backbone and the surrounding area. What could it be?
Doctor response: 1) It could be due to muscular injury or sprain.2) It could also be due to disc prolapse (bulging of intervertebral disc).3) In my opinion, you need to get an MRI scan done to know the exact cause of your problem.4) Till then, take ibuprofen for pain relief.5) Take rest.6) Do hot fomentation over the affected areas.7) Do not lift heavy weights.8) Do regular physiotherapy exercises.9) Avoid long sitting postures. Hope this helps you. Regards

Patient query: Hi Doctor,This is the report of Double Marker test of my wife:Corrected MoM and calculated risks:fb-hCG 165 ng/ml 3.82 Corr. MoMPAPP-A 1.84 mlU/ml o.45 Corr. MoMUltrasound data:Nuchal translucency 1.00 mmCRL 60 mm 0.64 MoMGestational age by CRL 12+ 2 Nasal bone presentGestational age on the day of serum taking 12+ 2Risk at term:Biochem. risk +NT 1:356 (below cut off).Double test >1:50 (above cut off).Age risk 1:1515.Trisomy 13/18 +NT.
Doctor response: 1. The nuchal translucency is normal which indicates that there is no increased chance for Down Syndrome or other chromosomal abnormalities.2. The biochemical risk is high but this can also be due to hormonal imbalance in the mother. This may not lead to any complications.3. The ultrasonography shows gestational age of 12 weeks which is less than the date of conception. This indicates that there is a delay in the development of the fetus.4. This is an indication that the fetus needs more time to develop and it will take longer to reach full term. As such there is nothing to worry about.

Patient query: Hello doctor,I am on a holiday. I wish to delay my period. Kindly advice.
Doctor response: 1. Please take a pill of oral contraceptive (birth control pills) for 21 days in place of your regular menstruation day. This will delay your periods by 7-10 days.2. Do not have sex during this time as it may cause pregnancy.3. Take progesterone tablets from Day 16 to Day 25 of the cycle to maintain pregnancy.4. Have unprotected sex from Day 11 to Day 18 of the cycle to maximize chances of pregnancy. Hope I have answered your query. Let me know if I can assist you further.

Patient query: Hello doctor,Recently, I was diagnosed to have iron deficiency anemia. My primary doctor thinks this is due to heavy menstrual bleeding. Therefore, he advised me to see the gynecologist. I never thought I had heavy periods. What is the actual definition of heavy menstrual bleeding? My period always last for seven 7 days and the first 2 or 3 days will be heavier with some clots. I have to get up during the night once to change the pad only in the first two nights. I usually use about 25 to 30 pads during my periods. Can this be considered as heavy bleeding? For me, this is normal. I have always been this way. My laboratory report showed hemoglobin 8.5, hematocrit 29.7, MCV 66, MCH 19, MCHC 28.6, RDW 18.9, UIBC 430, serum iron 15 and iron saturation and ferritin 3. In addition, I am not sexually active and I am still a virgin. I have never been to the gynecologist and really do not know what to expect. What kind of examination the doctor will perform? How should I prepare for the visit? Please visit.
Doctor response: Hi, Thanks for your query. Iron deficiency anemia can occur due to various reasons like blood loss from gastrointestinal tract, heavy periods, pregnancy, excessive menstruation, etc. You may need to take medicines along with iron supplements. Your doctor may also advise you to take vitamin B complex which helps in absorption of iron. Your doctor will examine you thoroughly. He/she may ask you for complete blood count, peripheral smear examination, bone marrow aspiration, ultrasound of abdomen. If required he/she may even suggest colonoscopy. Get well soon. Take Care Chat Doctor.

Patient query: Hello doctor,My wife is 13 weeks and 5 days pregnant at present. She vomits in the mornings, and she has continuous light stomach pain. Once or twice a day, she has intense stomach pain for 5 to 7 minutes. She takes Doxinate tablet once a day. Is this type of pain common in pregnancy? Can she take Doxinate throughout her pregnancy? Will Digene help in these type of stomach pain and is it safe during pregnancy?
Doctor response: Thanks for contacting us. Doxycycline (Doxinate) is an antibiotic that can be used in pregnancy if there is a risk of developing an infection. It is not recommended for use during pregnancy unless clearly needed as it may cause harmful effects on the fetus. The symptoms your wife is experiencing could be related to acid reflux. This is quite common during pregnancy and is caused by hormonal changes. There are medications that can be taken safely in pregnancy to treat this condition including proton pump inhibitors like Omeprazole or Pantoprazole. I recommend discussing your wives case with her obstetrician who can advise further treatment.

Patient query: Hi doctor,If I have had an open heart surgery, how long should I take Warfarin for?
Doctor response: Thanks for your question on Chat Doctor. I can understand your concern. You had open heart surgery and now taking warfarin. Warfarin is blood thinner medicine which prevents clot formation in your body. It has to be taken lifelong. Its dosage needs to be adjusted according to INR level (international normalized ratio). Your dose of warfarin will be decided by your cardiologist. So consult your cardiologist and discuss all these. Hope I have solved your query. Wish you good health. Thanks.

Patient query: Hello doctor,My dentist went for a crown for my molar because my molar was too sensitive. Now the sensitivity has reduced but not gone completely. My crown was fixed before two years. What can I do?

This will go away with time. Do not chew ice or hard food. Avoid biting on the opposite side. Use desensitizing toothpaste like Sensodyne. If still the problem persists, then you should get an x-ray done to rule out any other pathology.

Patient query: Hi doctor,I and my fiancee do use condoms but sometimes condoms cause me pain due to size issues. So, we get into an intercourse without it. Basically, I never came inside her but I wanted to get educated about the facts like how to avoid pregnancy if I came inside her? I mean what should be our first step? Even if I pull out, is there any chances that she will get pregnant? Which condom is a perfect fit for starters like us? Is there any natural ways too to make sure no sperm left inside?
Doctor response: 1) You can try using a smaller size condom or a female condom.2) Withdrawal of penis before ejaculation in the vagina is considered as one of the most effective methods of contraception.3) However, this method has its own limitations because it requires practice and proper timing. It also needs good knowledge and understanding of the woman.4) Also, there are high chances of slipping off or breaking during sexual activity.5) Another option could be using a diaphragm which is a small cup shaped device made up of soft rubber.6) This is placed inside the vagina before having sex.7) It is not very effective in preventing pregnancies unless used with another form of birth control. Hope I have answered your query. Let me know if I can assist you further.

Patient query: Hello doctor,My husband is away from the past one and half years due to his work. I visited him for 15 days. I had my normal periods there on the 31st of last month. Since I got a bit anxious about getting pregnant, I had four I-pills in these two weeks for protection. I then returned back on the 15th of this month. I had very scanty periods between the 24th to the 28th. And that is it. I had no periods after that until today. I have checked for pregnancy four times and it always showed negative. I do not have any pregnancy symptoms as well. I am leading a normal life. At times, I feel some cramps in the lower part of my stomach. I have already visited my doctor. She suggested I take Regestrone 5 mg, two tablets a day for five days. But, I still did not get my periods. Kindly advice me for the same.
Doctor response: 1. The pill you took will prevent ovulation and thus prevent pregnancy. It does not affect the menstrual cycle.2. If you have taken the right amount (4 pills) within the right time frame, there should be no chance of pregnancy.3. You may try to track your period by using home pregnancy test kit once you miss your next expected period date.

Patient query: Hi doctor,Are you supposed to feel heartbeat on the right side of your chest? I hear heartbeats on both right and left side of my chest and I feel that I have two hearts. Give me your advice.

Patient query: Hello doctor,Six weeks ago, I started to get muscle twitches all over my body and tingling sensations in my skin. This is still happening. I visited my GP four weeks ago who immediately prescribed anti-depressants. I have suffered from health anxiety for the last seven years. It comes in waves. The GP did not even check me over and told me not to worry as he had no concern. I am worrying about motor neuron disease. However, deep down this is unlikely because someone with this illness could not go to the gym (run and push weights). I would like an opinion from an expert.
Doctor response: Hi! Welcome to Chat Doctor forum. I am sorry to hear about your condition. I can understand how distressed you must be feeling right now. As per your complaint it seems that you might be suffering from anxiety disorder. Anxiety disorders are very common mental disorders. They usually occur due to stress, depression or any other psychological problem. There are different types of anxiety disorders such as generalized anxiety disorder, obsessive compulsive disorder, panic disorder etc. You should consult a psychiatrist and get evaluated. He will examine you and confirm the diagnosis. Then he may advise you some medicines which can help you overcome these symptoms. Medicines such as SSRI's, benzodiazepines, beta blockers etc. are effective in treating anxiety disorders. In addition to this, you should also practice some relaxation techniques such as yoga and meditation.

Patient query: Hello doctor,My 2.6 years old son is suffering from cold, cough, and sneezing from three days, and yesterday night, he developed a fever. I am giving him Levolin syrup 5 ml, and for fever, I had given Babygesic 1.5 ml. Is Levolin for both cold and cough, as well as sneezing?
Doctor response: Hi...levolin is not meant to be used in all cases of cold/cough. It contains levocetirizine, which is an antihistamine and it works by reducing the symptoms of allergy (such as hayfever) and the common cold. Levocetirizine can also be used to treat other conditions such as urticaria (nettle rash). The other medicines that you have mentioned are appropriate for your sons condition.

Patient query: Dear Doctor,My mother is 50 years old. According to the report, She has got: Fatty changes in the liver.Bulky uterus with fibroid.Blood sugar 201.0mg/dL.Kindly interpret the report.
Doctor response: 1) Fatty changes in the liver can be due to many reasons including obesity and diabetes.2) Bulky uterus with fibroid may cause menstrual irregularities, pain during periods etc.3) High blood glucose level means that she is suffering from diabetes mellitus. Diagnosis of diabetes requires fasting plasma glucose level more than 126 mg / dl or random plasma glucose level more than 200 mg / dl.4) Fatty liver needs to be managed by lifestyle modifications like weight reduction, avoidance of alcohol, fried and fatty foods. Also, regular exercise and yoga should be performed.

Patient query: Hello doctor,I am 20 years old and I have myopia (-3,50 ). I always avoided smoking, lived a healthy lifestyle and ate a balanced diet but my vision just got worse. I just became worried about my vision. What else can I do to stop this progress?
Doctor response: 1) You need to wear glasses or contact lenses for correction of your vision.2) You should also be doing regular exercise such as swimming, running etc. This will help in strengthening your eye muscles which would improve your vision.3) Avoid reading too much at night.4) Include lots of green leafy vegetables, fruits in your diet.5) Take vitamin E supplements daily.6) Do not worry. You will definitely get good results with these measures.

Patient query: Hi,I sprained my ankle while playing soccer. The ball hit the outside of my foot, causing my ankle to turn inward, and it popped few times. My chiropractor tried adjusting the ankle, and it popped, but it did not affect the dislocated feeling. I have asked other people who I know have sprained their ankle, but they said they have never felt that. Should I be concerned? I am currently taking Advil.

It appears to me like a chronic injury. Please start physiotherapy treatment with traction and ultrasound therapy, and take analgesics. It will help you in long run.  Wishing for a quick recovery. Patient query: Hello doctor,A stray dog came near my 3 years and eight months old toddler. Its mouth was very near his hand. I do not know if it licked his hand or not but I just got worried. He has no open bleeding wound but yes mosquito bite sites and many minute abrasions because of playing. In the last two years, he has been given a tetanus shot also. I do not know what to do. I did not see the dog licking his hand but was very close to his hand, maybe for sniffing it came near.The dog looked fine, not overactive or underactive. It was a stray dog, so cannot watch it also. Please suggest what to do. Such incidents wherein a dog comes near or sniffs might happen in the future also and with kids, you cannot be sure if they were licked or not.
Doctor response: 1) Is the child having any swelling or redness at the site?2) If there is no redness or swelling then there is nothing to worry about. Tetanus immunization is supposed to give protection against tetanus for five years. So your kid should have received the last injection before he turned three years. If he had received all the necessary vaccines then he is protected from tetanus.3) However, if the dog had an active case of rabies then your kid can get infected (rabies). But this would show up symptomatically only after few days.4) The best way to prevent such incidences is to keep your child away from stray dogs.5) If the dog had rabies and bites your kid, then you need to take him to hospital immediately for anti-rabies treatment.6) If the dog had rabies then it would die within 7-10 days

Patient query: Hello doctor,The left side of my tongue has been hurting for a few days, and there is a white raised line on it. What do you think it could be? The image is attached.

Patient query: Hello doctor,My grandmother is 83 years old and has been suffering from a mild form of glaucoma for three years now. When we consulted doctors earlier they suggested using eye drops than surgery. So we have been using Travo Z and Tear Drops daily and she is also able to see properly. Since one week she is experiencing pain in her eyes and has trouble looking at the light directly. Her eyes have also turned reddish. Please help.
Doctor response: 1) The redness is due to inflammation of conjunctiva.2) Glaucoma is an autoimmune disease wherein the body starts attacking its own tissues. There is a certain amount of damage that happens to the optic nerve which causes vision loss.3) As far as treatment goes, it depends upon what kind of glaucoma your grandmothers has.4) In early stages, medicines like brimonidine or timolol can be used to reduce IOP (intraocular pressure).5) Later in advanced stage, laser procedure called SLT (selective laser trabeculoplasty) may be done to reduce IOP.6) If the IOP remains high after these procedures then filtration surgery needs to be considered. Hope this answers your question.

Patient query: Hi doctor,I want to know about body lift surgery procedure. I have lost weight of 50 kilograms. I want to get a full body life. How many surgeries do I need? How are they divided? How much time does it take for recovery?
Doctor response: 1) There is no such thing as a "body lift" surgery.2) The best way to lose weight and keep it off is to adopt healthy lifestyle habits including diet and exercise.3) Body contouring after massive weight loss can be done through multiple procedures. These include liposuction, abdominoplasty (tummy tuck), thigh lift, buttock augmentation/lift, arm lift, etc.4) These are individualized to the patients needs and will vary in length of time depending on the extent of work required.5) Recovery from these procedures may also vary in length so it is important to discuss all this with your plastic surgeon before proceeding.

Patient query: Hello doctor,I am currently experiencing severe lower back and left hip pain and spasms. I have a history of a slight disk herniation at L5-S1 with no nerve impingement. Doctor response: Hi, Welcome to Chat Doctor forum. As you describe your symptoms, it seems that you had a trauma or injury to your back, which might have caused a minor disc prolapse. It is likely to affect your back muscle fibers, causing pain and spasm. You should take analgesics like Advil, ibuprofen etc., for some days. Apply warm compresses over the affected areas. Do not bend forward from the waist to lift objects. Take rest. Avoid heavyweight lifting. Use a back support belt. Hope this helps. Wishing you good health. Take care.

Patient query: Hello doctor,What is the meaning of HSG test? The uterine tubes are patent bilaterally. There is bilateral spontaneous contrast m\xc3\xa9dium spillage into the peritoneal cavity. The contrast filled uterine cavity demonstrates normal morphology with a central immobile smooth spherical filling defect.
Doctor response: hi, I have gone through your question and understand your concerns. A hysterosalpingogram (HSG) is an X-ray study that uses x-rays to examine the inside of the uterus and fallopian tubes. It can be used to diagnose problems such as abnormalities in the shape of the uterus or fallopian tubes, scarring from surgery or previous infection, blockages in the fallopian tubes, and other conditions. In this test, dye is injected into your cervix and passes through the fallopian tubes and out into your abdominal cavity. This dye will show up on the X-ray pictures.

Patient query: Hi doctor, I have Pericoronitis (swelling and pain behind the wisdom tooth). You should consult your dentist for clinical evaluation. I would like to suggest you that till then you can use warm saline rinses. Do salt water gargling by adding one teaspoonful of salt in a glassful of hot water. This will help you to reduce the inflammation. Hope this helps. Take care.

Hence, if you are able to tolerate the procedure then it is worth trying. If not, then the other option would be to go for mesh repair as well. Patient query: Hello doctor,What is colon cleansing? Colon hydrotherapy has been advised, and how effective is the procedure? I have chronic constipation.
Doctor response: 1) Colon cleansing is a process of removing the impacted feces from the large intestine by using enema or laxatives. It should be done only after consulting with your physician.2) The efficacy of this procedure depends upon the amount of feces present in the colon. If there is minimal amount then it may not be required.3) This procedure can also be done by taking certain medications like bisacodyl.4) Once the fecal matter is removed the body gets rid of waste products and toxins.

Patient query: Hello doctor,My mom is 56 years old. She is a patient of hypertension, diabetes, and mild nephropathy. BP 140/80, pulse 96/ min, creatinine 1.3, fasting sugar 125, postprandial 157. From a few months, my mother is suffering from chest pain. The doctor told it is chronic stable angina. All other tests are done like Na, K, hemoglobin, urea, and uric acid. The reports are quite fine. Our family doctor suggests me to take angiography. So, what should I do now? Please suggest. She is taking the following medicines: Aciloc RD, Glimmy 2, Nexovas, Telmikaa40, Febugood 40, Lipikind 10 and Glypten 20.
Doctor response: 1. Chronic angina is due to blockage in heart arteries leading to decreased blood supply to the heart muscle. This can lead to chest pain, shortness of breath (dyspnea), nausea, vomiting and sweating. It can also be associated with arm or jaw pain. 2. Your mother needs to undergo Angiogram to know whether she has significant blockages in her heart arteries. If there are no blockages then she may need only medications for control of her symptoms.

Patient query: Hello doctor, I am currently taking a low dose of combined birth control medication (Femme 20/100) containing 21 hormone tablets and 7 placebo tablets. Currently, I am taking Ritalin 60 mg per day in 3 x 20 mg intervals, Abilify 300 mg depot injection monthly, Femme 20/100 contraceptive pill and Clonazepam 2 mg twice a day as needed. I had unprotected sex on day 6 of inactive pill. I forgot to take active pills on day 1, 3 and 4. But, I had 2 pills on day 2 and had unprotected intercourse. I am concerned about the possibility of pregnancy. It is now day 5 and I am regular on my pill. Am I at risk for a possible pregnancy due to missing so many hormonal pills? Also, what should I do from this point onwards? Should I continue as normal or begin a new packet entirely?
Doctor response: Hi welcome to Chat Doctor forum. Thanks for calling Chat Doctor. Forum. As your question is concerned, it is not clear how much time you have missed the pills. If you miss one pill within the first week it won't affect you. You can start with the next pack. If you miss two weeks then you need to check by urine test to know if you are pregnant or not. If you are pregnant, then you will be advised to terminate the pregnancy. If you are not pregnant, you can resume the pills. Hope this answers your query.

Patient query: Hello doctor,Me and my partner had unprotected sex, and she took I-pill within 72 hours (but after 24 hours), and now after 8 to 9 days of taking the pill, she is having mild cramps similar to period and also mild bleeding (just a few spots), but the discharge is brownish in color, and this is the third day with cramps, although the bleeding is very less. Is it side effect of the pill or is it implantation bleeding? And when can she expect her normal periods?
Doctor response: 1. I-pill is not used as emergency contraceptive anymore. It contains high doses of hormones which cause irregular menstrual cycles and spotting for a few months. This may be due to the I-pill.2. It is unlikely that it is implantation bleeding because she has taken it after 24 hours of intercourse.3. You should wait for your next period to come. Implantation bleeding occurs about a week before the expected date of period.

Patient query: Hi doctor,My son is 14 years old. He got a seizure before 15 days during sleep for 10 to 15 minutes. His EEG and MRI are normal. His doctor suggested two options. They are either we can wait for the second attack or go for treatment Val-Cr 300 for three to four years. Kindly give your opinion. Thank you.
Doctor response: Hi, Welcome to Chat Doctor.com I am Chat Doctor. Mariano Into Bruno Mascaras. I have gone through your query with diligence and would like you to know that I am here to help you. Epilepsy has many causes, including damage to the brain from trauma, infection, stroke, or tumor. A child who has had one seizure may not need treatment if he or she has no other symptoms and does not have any problems afterward. However, some children will continue to have seizures even though they do not appear to be aware of them. These children should take anti-epileptic medications. You should discuss this issue with your neurologist. Hope you find this answer helpful. If you need further clarification, please ask me. Wishing you good health.

Patient query: Hi doctor,I do a couple of sports to have some hip flexibility. I am pretty flexible, and I can do right and left splits. But when doing the center split, I get a stopping pain in my outer hip with no stretch in my inner thigh. If I rotate my knees back and hips forward, I can do more stretch, but there is also a slight stop. What is this and can it be worked? Will stretching help to release that stopping pain or am I anatomically incapable of doing a middle split? There is pain only when I am doing a center split. How to fix it? I do a lot of kicking, and I do not want to injure myself.
Doctor response: Hi, Thanks for writing in. The center split you are referring to is called as the "splitting" of the leg. This is done by rotating the foot inwards while keeping the knee straight. When you do this, your whole body weight gets transferred to the front side of the knee. This is where the pain originates from. When you rotate the knee backwards and hips forward, the pressure is shifted to the other side and hence the pain reduces. It is possible to reduce the pain through stretching exercises. You should start with gentle stretching of the groin muscles and then gradually move onto full splits. However, if the pain persists even after adequate stretching, you may need to consult a physician who will advise you further investigations like X-ray, MRI etc. In case it is a ligament injury, physical therapy along with medicines will help.

Patient query: Hello doctor,I am a 31 year old female. My first trimester NT and double marker test showed a very low risk of 1:3690 for DS and 1:100000 for two other abnormalities. Hope this answers your question. If you have additional questions or follow-up questions then please do not hesitate in writing to us. Wishing you good health.

Patient query: Hi doctor,Can you tell me within how many days angiography must be done after a heart attack?

Doctor response: Hi, Thanks for writing in. I understand your concern. The tests that you have done are appropriate for your situation. DNA PCR test is done when there is a possibility of exposure by genital secretions. It can detect HIV for up to 66 days after exposure. Tridot test is done to detect HIV antigen in blood. It may be positive even if viral load is very low. You should do this test only once as it has high false positive results. The immunofiltration test is done to detect antibody against HIV. It requires fresh serum sample. If it is negative then you need not worry about HIV. You can have unprotected sex with your wife provided she is not infected. However, if she is infected then she needs to take precautions and get tested.

It helps in transport of Oxygen to tissues and organs of body. It also plays important role in formation of proteins, nucleic acids and enzymes. Iron deficiency can lead to fatigue and decrease in physical performance. Iron toxicity is very rare but can occur if large amount of iron is taken. Patient query: Hello doctor,I have had back pain for the last 12 years. I had an l5 s1 disc herniation and later diagnosed with severe lumbar spinal stenosis at l4 l5 as well. My back pain is more critical than the leg pain. However, I have persistent calf and foot spasms and cramping (especially in bed and at night). I am able to exercise and lift heavy objects, but not able to walk more than a mile at a time. I believe the stenosis is more of an issue right now than the disc herniation, and my MRI confirms the disc is not as bad as it was years ago.I have done physical therapy, acupuncture, chiropractor, and epidural injections, but, my lower back pain remains an issue (especially when standing and walking for a long time). My doctors recommend a laminectomy, though I am scared that surgery may leave me in worse shape than I currently am. Can I have some advice? Should I go through with the laminectomy, or should I deal with the back pain since I have built a high tolerance for pain and can do most (but not all) activities?
Doctor response: Hi, Thanks for writing in. From your history, it seems you have chronic back pain with radiating pain down the legs. Lumbar spondylitis and spinal stenosis are common causes for this. The treatment options would be conservative or surgical depending on severity. Physiotherapy and medicines like muscle relaxants, analgesics etc., help reduce symptoms. Epidural injections are helpful in relieving pain temporarily. Surgical option includes laminotomy/laminectomy if there is severe nerve compression leading to weakness and neurological deficits. You need to discuss with your treating physician about these issues. Hope this helps.

Patient query: Hello doctor,From the past five days, I am sending my 21 month old son to a daycare. For the first three days, they allowed me inside the campus. Since I was close by, he was playing well. But, from the last two days, they are not allowing me inside and hence he is crying a lot. Today he was a bit fine but, not actually enjoying. So, I have to either send him to the day care or I will have to send him to my in-laws\. Which is the best option?
Doctor response: 1. The daycare facility should be able to understand your situation and allow you to be around when ever possible. Stress can lead to changes in hormones which may result in behavioral problems.3. The best option would be to find a place where you can take care of your child yourself. This would be the most ideal situation since then you can be sure that your needs and your kids needs are taken care of simultaneously.

Patient query: Hello doctor,My mother had a fall following which it was diagnosed two fractures in the hip joints in front and back. Doctor response: Hi, Thank you for providing the short history of your mother. The first thing that I would like to say is that the symptoms described here are not due to fracture. The x-ray taken shows normal bones without any fracture. The only problem with the bones is osteoporosis. It is a condition in which the bones become weak and fragile. This can lead to fracture easily. As per your post, your mother has undergone treatment for this. Your mother should continue the same treatment. Meanwhile, she should avoid taking any medicines that cause weakness to bones. These include steroids, bisphosphonates etc. You should discuss this with your treating Doctor. Hope my answer helps you. Wishing your Mother good health.

Patient query: Hello doctor,How can I figure out my conception date? My last menstrual period was three months back. I had my dating ultrasound and it put the GA at 9 weeks and 3 days. Also there was a CRL measurement of 26.96. My due date based on LMP and ultrasound are different. Please answer. Also how many "safe" days are there after a period?
Doctor response: 1) The most accurate way to calculate the conception date is by counting from the first day of your last normal menses (LNM). This would mean that if you have a regular 28-day cycle, then the conception date could be calculated as 14 days before the expected ovulation day. However, this calculation is not always reliable as not all women have regular cycles with the same length every month. For those who do not have a regular cycle or whose cycles vary in length, the safest way to calculate the conception date is by using the calendar method. 2) The safest days for conception are the 10 to 17 days prior to expected ovulation day.

Patient query: Hello doctor,A few weeks ago I went to the doctor with an open skin wound on my face. I was cultured as it looked like Staph infection and given antibiotics. As the wound got healed, could it still be in my blood? Do I need to do anything before my visit? Should I push to be seen earlier?
Doctor response: 1) Nocardiosis is not usually transmitted from person to person. It can spread through airborne transmission (inhalation), ingestion of contaminated food or water, contact with contaminated soil, or direct inoculation into the body.2) It is treated with a combination of anti-inflammatory medications, antifungal agents, and antibiotics.3) As long as you don't have any signs/symptoms, and your wounds are healing well, you should be fine.4) Since there are no symptoms, there is nothing to worry about.5) You can consult your doctor if you develop any new symptoms.
