Patient query: Hello doctor,My husband and I will be using a surrogate to have kids. My husband is kell positive (heterozygous). What are the risks to this that the surrogate would need to be aware of?
Doctor response: Hi welcome to Chat Doctor forum.  It is not possible for him to transmit antigen to the baby, and he should not worry about transmitting any disease to the child. He can even work as a father if the surrogate mother has no such antigens in her body. So there is nothing to worry about his condition.  As far as the surrogate mother is concerned she might develop some reaction against your husbands blood group antigens during pregnancy. But it is very rare to happen. Even if happens she may require only few doses of anti-serum which will help her to overcome that problem.  Hope this helps you. Wishing good health to both of you.

Patient query: Hi doctor,My sister is 18 years old, and she has never had periods. Recently, we did a test which said, 46, XY (20), 20 cells were counted, all cells showed 46 chromosomes. Small chromosomal anomalies and small clonal population may not be detected using the standard methods employed. Could you please explain what does it mean? What can be done for her? Will she be able to have kids?
Doctor response: 46XY means that your sister is a male. It is very unlikely that she will be able to produce offspring. The best way to determine if she is genetically female would be to do a DNA analysis. This is usually done by taking a blood sample from an area of the body where there is no hair growth. Hope I have answered your query. Let me know if I can assist you further.

Patient query: Hi doctor,I have low energy for a few days now. I have done a blood test, and I have a ferritin level of 10 ng/mL. After taking supplements, my ferritin got increased to 16 ng/mL. But, still, I suffer from weakness. My doctor advised me to have an iron infusion to raise my levels. I still have low energy, and it is affecting my daily life. Can I take an infusion now? Can it help me? Please suggest.
Doctor response: 16ng/ml is very high, so please do not worry about that. You need to increase your hemoglobin first and then only take iron infusions. Ferritin is a storage form of iron which is released when there is deficiency of iron in body. So if you have normal ferritin this means you don't require any iron treatment. It is important to know what is your hemoglobin and hematocrit. If both these are lower than 13g/DL then you can take iron infusions.

Patient query: Hello doctor,I am a 33 year old female. I got my cavity filled two days back. Now, it hurts when I drink cold stuff. Is there anything I can do?
Doctor response: Hi, Thanks for posting your query in Chat Doctor. Your tooth may have developed an abscess due to the infection that was not treated properly before filling. The pain is because of the pressure from inside the tooth. You need to take antibiotics and analgesic tablets. Visit a dentist and get the tooth examined. If necessary root canal treatment or extraction will be advised. Take care.

Patient query: Hello doctor,My last period was on 24th last month and it went for a regular five days. I had sex on that Friday after my period was over, had Ipill the next day. Again had sex on Wednesday, had Ipill on Thursday and from Thursday, I am getting a brown discharge, a little bit of cramps. Am I pregnant? Because he did not discharge inside me, so I cannot be pregnant but I am scared of pre-cum, but I took Ipill. Still I am getting a brown discharge, please help. When can I expect my next period (on the date or delayed)?
Doctor response: 100% effective in preventing pregnancy if taken within 72 hrs of unprotected intercourse. If taken later than that there is still a chance of pregnancy. I would suggest you to wait for your periods to start, if they do not come then take a urine pregnancy test, and if that comes positive then get an ultrasound done to confirm the gestational age of the baby.

Patient query: Hello doctor,I missed my period last month and after the first late day I took a pregnancy test and it said not pregnant. So I waited for a few more days to go by to take another and it said positive so from that day I scheduled a follow-up appointment and when I went to get an ultrasound they told me that there was nothing there. So she predicted that I may be early, so she used the camera and she still did not see anything. She told me to undergo a urine test and it came out negative meaning I am not pregnant. I left there and took another test at home and it said negative. It has been a whole month and I still do not have my period. What could be wrong with my body?
Doctor response: 1) You must be in your fertile phase of cycle.2) If you had sex during this time, you can get pregnant.3) Missing one or two periods doesn't indicate any pathology.4) You need to wait till the next expected date of period and if you miss again, then repeat the tests and consult gynecologist for further workup.5) In case of doubt, you may opt for blood Chat Doctor test which is very reliable in detecting pregnancy.6) If you are still concerned, get yourself examined by gynecologist and get done USG scan and hormonal assay like beta Chat Doctor to rule out hormonal imbalance.

Patient query: Hello doctor,I am a 68-year-old male. I am currently on Gluformin G2 Forte for diabetes, Cinod-N 10/2.5 for BP and Olmezest 20. My lab report is from last week.HbA1c - 6.8.Uric acid - 7.41.Fructosamine - 299.7.eGFR - 83.APO B / APO A1 Ratio (APO B/A1) - 1.1.SGOT- 54.6.SGPT 59.9.Lipoprotein (A) LP (A) - 30.8.TSH - 6.07.Uri albumin/creatinine ratio (UA/C) - 68.5.25-OH Vitamin D (total) - 20.17.Any advice, please?
Doctor response: Hello, Welcome to Chat Doctor. Your blood sugar level is normal. Lipid profile is also normal. Uric acid is slightly high. The uric acid along with HbA1c can be correlated to determine whether there is any gout problem or not. Fructosamine is a test done to see how well your diabetes is controlled in past two weeks. I suggest you consult your physician regarding this and discuss about these tests and their implications. Hope this helps. Take care.

Patient query: Hi doctor,I am newly married, and we both are first timers. We tried penetration a lot of times, but the moment I come close to her, I lose the erection. Also, I am ejaculating within 20 seconds. I do not have any health issue and morning erection is positive.
Doctor response: 1) If your partner is normal then there should be no problem in intercourse.2) If you are losing erection at the time of penetration it may be due to anxiety or performance anxiety.3) You can take anxiolytic like alprazolam before sex, but if you are taking it regularly then you need to consult psychiatrist.4) If your erections are good in the morning then you can try intracavernous injection for maintaining erection during sexual activity.5) Avoid stress and tension about sex.

Patient query: Hello doctor,I am 26 years old and recently I have started having issues maintaining an erection. I have no issues on my own but once with my partner, I experience shortness of breath and it just does not stay up. Any help is greatly appreciated.
Doctor response: Hi, Thanks for writing to Chat Doctor. Erectile dysfunction can be due to many reasons like stress, anxiety, depression etc. You need to consult a psychiatrist who would examine you clinically and prescribe medicines accordingly. Medicines like Escitalopram/sertraline/clonazepam etc. will be helpful in your case. If you require more of my help in this regard, please use this URL. http://goo.gl/aYW2pR. Make sure that you include every minute details possible. Hope this answers your query. Available for further clarifications. Good luck. Take care.

Patient query: Dear Doctor,I am a 29 year old female suffering from PCOD, taking medicines from past 1 year. But still it has not reduced. I was into Metformin and Folic acid. At the same time I have also taken medicines for conception (i.e, clomiphene).Follicar study has been conducted for four times and only once the egg ruptured, but I did not conceive.From december onwards the follicles are not maturing upto required level.Again during February and March my doctor put me on K-35 as my periods during past 1 year were not regular and still are irregular (I have to take tablet Norgest thrice daily for 5 days and then periods come).Recently I have consulted another doctor, she has prescribed me to stop taking Metformin and instead to start on APCOD sachet (Myo-inositol) and Safegest D (dehydroepiandrosterone) and during periods Adova (Anastrozole).But I have not yet started the medicines. I am a bit confused, whether should I totally stop Metformin and start with these new drugs?
Doctor response: 1. You need to take metformin as its help in ovulation induction and maintenance of pregnancy. 2. You can try other medications like APOD, safeguard D, Anastrazole etc. 3. But first get your hormonal profile done and see if there is any imbalance and correct that first. 4. Also make sure that the ovum size is good enough to be picked up by fallopian tube. 5. As far as Adova is concerned, it is a selective estrogen receptor modulator which is given to avoid estrogen induced side effects.

Patient query: Hi doctor,My prostate-specific antigen (PSA) value has got increased by 30 % from 0.8 ng/mL to 1.1 ng/mL. I am in testosterone replacement therapy also. Please advice.
Doctor response: 1.1 is still within normal range for PSA.2. Increase of PSA is due to benign prostatic hyperplasia and not due to cancer.3. You can be reassured that your PSA level indicates nothing serious.4. Continue with your TRT as well as other medications.5. Regular follow up of PSA levels is advised. Hope it helps.

Patient query: Hello doctor,My A1c is 5.4 and my fasting glucose is 107 and I was taking 800 mg of Seroquel which is a medication for paranoid schizophrenia and is known for causing diabetes and high blood sugar and five minutes after taking a 400 mg pill, one day my sugar went over 200 and the next day five minutes after taking a 400 mg pill, my sugar went up to 495. So, I stopped the Seroquel. According to my A1c, I am a nondiabetic, according to my fasting glucose, I am a pre-diabetic, and according to those two high blood sugar readings, I am a serious diabetic. Those are three different diagnoses. But those two high readings could have just been because of the Seroquel because I have never had high readings like that other than when I was taking the Seroquel and I was taking a high dose. A lot of people only take 100 to 200 mg, but I was taking 800 mg. So, do you think I am a diabetic or do you think it was just the Seroquel that caused the two high readings?
Doctor response: The seroquel has not been associated with diabetes. It may cause weight gain and abnormal lipid profile. But there are no reports of diabetes due to seroquel. Diabetes can occur in response to stress, emotional disturbance, infection etc. It doesn't mean that all the symptoms are due to seroquel. You should get your self investigated thoroughly and see if there is any underlying cause for these symptoms.

Patient query: Hello doctor,I am 38 weeks pregnant (38 weeks and 2 days). I took an ultrasound today.My report shows:Biparietal diameter 8.93 cm (36w 1d)Head circumference 32.17 cm (36w 2d)Abdominal circumference 31.65 cm (35w 4d)Femoral length 6.98 cm (35w 6d)Average age of gestation based on today\s scan: 36 weeksEstimated fetal weight: 2765 grams.I just want to ask if I need to be worried, as my doctor said the baby is small. Is there any problem for the baby because I am on 38 weeks 2 days now, but base on my ultrasound the baby is 36 weeks.
Doctor response: 36 weeks is normal. The fetus size can vary from one person to another. This is why doctors use charts to calculate the expected date of delivery. You may get a few days difference in your due date calculation and actual delivery date. So don't worry about it. As long as the baby is growing well and not showing signs of distress or low birth weight then there should not be anything to worry about. Hope this helps

Patient query: Hi doctor,I have had low B 12 in the past (135 ngl) and seven years back had injections via my GP. These finished five years back. Recently have had symptoms come back and had my B12 checked and it was low, 265, but in the recommended range, however, I do take a supplement with B12 in it which would have pushed my level up a bit. My symptoms are fatigue, pins, and needles in hands and feet, slow cognition. Should I be receiving injections again?
Doctor response: Hi welcome to Chat Doctor forum.  You can take oral vitamin B 12 tablets for your symptoms.  But if you want to get rid of this problem permanently then you should go for an injection of vitamin B 12, as it will give you more benefit than oral medication.  But you should consult your physician before taking any treatment.  Wishing you good health.  Best regards.

Patient query: Hello doctor,I have a question about my voice. As a kid, I had a raspy voice the entire time until puberty. After I hit puberty, I do not think my parents noticed anything, but people have said I sound like Kermit the frog or that I need to stop mumbling. The problem I have is that I have to try quite hard to speak in a normal tone, and I am extremely self-conscious about the way I sound. I breathed through my mouth my entire life until I had a septoplasty three years back. Now I can breathe through one nostril, which I guess is 60 % open, while the other one is always 100 % blocked. What is happening, that is making me sound like this? I know I was not meant to sound this way, there has to be something causing some problem. Any idea or suggestion will be appreciated.
Doctor response: Hi, Thanks for writing to Chat Doctor. I read your query and understand your concern. In my opinion, it seems that you have developed an habitual speech pattern. This is nothing to worry. You should get yourself evaluated by ENT specialist. He may advise you to have voice therapy. I hope I answered your query. Feel free to ask any further queries. I would be happy to help you. Take care

Patient query: Hello doctor,My daughter is 6 years old. About 10 to 11 months back we saw a very very small dark black colored dot on her side of the tongue. But now there are 4 to 5 similar sized dot around her tongue on both sides. The size has not grown. But it is just that new location has emerged. Lately she is continuously touching her tongue and her tip of tongue appears red. She says she feels like there is a hair on her tongue and there is some sensation on her tongue. I do not know if she is able to correctly describe her feeling. I am more worried about the black spots. Rest she is absolutely fine. Please advice.
Doctor response: Hi, Welcome to Chat Doctor forum.  As your child is having a small black spot on her tongue for last one year, and it has increased in number, so I would advise you to consult an oral physician, who can examine her oral cavity under the light and can take an x-ray of her jaw bones.  This will help him to diagnose the condition, and he may prescribe antibiotics and painkillers after examination.  Hope this helps.

Patient query: Hello doctor,I am a 34 year old male. I had anxiety issues since childhood. I have been jumping from one idea to another for a long time but it has been three years I have an issue with frequent urination. It started in a bad time for me when I was obsessing that I have HIV. No burning, just slight urethra burning. I went to a urologist. He told me nothing was wrong, maybe an overactive bladder. I go to the toilet every two hours or three. I never knew what was wrong, but I started to obsess over it and it got worse to a place that my mind is in urination 24/7. I almost gave up until I went on a vacation and during that vacation, I forgot about it totally. The frequency was gone and even the burning urethra. Also, I had to remove my wisdom teeth and when I did, I was so occupied thinking about it that I forgot about urination and I noticed that I do not use the bathroom like I used to. But, I got back obsessing about it again and it got to a point that I urinate a lot of high volumes every hour. It comes suddenly and goes on its own. I use to get those episodes every few months when I had stress but since I got the fear it might never go away I get it almost daily now. I do not know what to do. Can anxiety cause polyuria like this clear urine when I am stressed?
Doctor response: 1) Anxiety can be associated with polyuria. Polyuria is excessive urination more than 2 liters per day. So if your urine volume is less than 2 liters per day then there is no need to worry about polyuria. You should see a psychiatrist as soon as possible.2) You may be having Obsessive Compulsive Disorder (OCD). This is a type of anxiety disorder. OCD patients keep on repeating certain thoughts and behaviors which they think will relieve their anxiety. But these thoughts and behavior are actually making the situation worse. So OCD patients need to learn how to control their thoughts and behaviors. A good psychologist can help you in this regard.

Patient query: Hi doctor,I got red patches on my nose after using chemically made facial products while using Retin-A ointment. I have attached pictures. In that, I have used Cerave ointment for healing the marks. Now, I discontinued using Retin-A 0.025 % ointment.
Doctor response: 1) Please do not apply any cosmetic product or cream over your face which has retinoid in it as this could cause irritation and inflammation of your skin.2) Also, if you are using other topical medications like antibiotics or steroids, then they may also lead to side effects like skin thinning, pigmentation, etc.3) You can apply a moisturizer, sunscreen and emollient (like petroleum jelly/mineral oil) over the affected area twice daily to prevent further damage to your skin.4) After 2 weeks, when the redness subsides, you can start using a mild cleanser containing salicylic acid and glycolic acid which will help exfoliate the dead skin cells and improve the texture and appearance of your skin.5) Regular application of a good night cream containing vitamin C, E and Hyal

Patient query: Hello doctor,My 76-year-old father had urinary infection last month with a high number of pus cells. The infection started with fever and shivering and slight pain with urination. The doctor prescribed Oflox 200 mg twice a day. After that, he was also prescribed ultrasound scanning. In the scanning, it showed that his prostate was minimally enlarged.After antibiotic treatment and based on the ultrasound report, the doctor prescribed Urimax 0.4 mg once per day. The urine culture was also normal. After starting the treatment, the flow of urine is normal now and sometimes little out of control and early. Why is he passing urine a little early even before reaching the toilet?
Doctor response: 1) Please note that a urinalysis and routine blood tests will not be able to pinpoint the cause for your fathers symptoms. It could be an infection or enlargement of the prostate gland which can lead to urinary problems.2) The urethral opening is just below the bladder neck where there is a narrow neck region, so if there is any obstruction here then the urine may spill over into the vagina.3) You need to consult a Urologist who would examine him physically and get some basic investigations done like a Cystoscopy.

Patient query: Hi doctor,I am a 24-year-old male with no health problem except for my problem with premature ejaculation and no second erection. It is very frustrating to last 2 to 3 minutes in the preliminary and then my desire goes down. I had a problem with internet porn where I can have as many erections as I want. I am one month free now but premature ejaculation has always been there. I also cannot hold my pee for a long time. If this can be associated with the problem, I am begging for help beacause it is ruining me and my relationship. I am taking corticosteroids for autoimmune disease.
Doctor response: 1. Please get a full physical examination done by a good physician to rule out any organic cause of your symptoms like diabetes mellitus or inflammation.2. Premature ejaculation is a psychological issue which is related to anxiety about performance. You need to practice relaxation exercises and be confident that you will perform well. You should avoid watching pornographic material. It will only increase your anxiety level and make it difficult to control yourself.3. For holding urine, try to avoid consuming too much water during daytime and do not strain while passing urine. Avoid alcohol and smoking if you are addicted to them.

Patient query: Hello doctor,I am a 51-year-old female. I got sick about a month ago and I went to urgent care. My left kidney was swollen and I had an infection. I have a 2-cm kidney stone and they put a stent in.I do not want to have surgery. I am scared that the use of natural remedies can hurt the stent or move the stone to block where I go to pee. I had a CAT scan at urgent care.Will they use local anesthesia for this instead of general or something else? Can the kidney stones come out from behind? I have diabetes. Can lemons and olive oil help treat this? Currently, I am on Metformin, Aspirin, Simvastatin, and Lisinopril.
Doctor response: 1. You should be very careful with any natural remedy as they can cause serious complications if used without proper guidance.2. I would recommend using only medications prescribed by your urologist.3. Lemon juice can possibly help but it is still better to consult your doctor before trying anything new.4. Olive oil is also good for kidneys but its effectiveness depends on how much is consumed. Hope I could help nourishing you good health.

Patient query: Hi doctor,I am in a little trouble. Summer has started where I live, and I am addicted to playing cricket, whatever the weather or climate be. From last two weeks, I have noticed that my face color has become darker due to the sun. So, I am a little confused about which sunblock cream to use. I need your suggestion on which cream to use. I do not understand the concept of SPF 25, 30, 50 and 60.
Doctor response: 1) SPF stands for sun protection factor. It is a measure of how long you can stay out in the sun before getting burned without wearing sunscreen. 2) A sunscreen with an SPF of 15 will protect you from the sun's rays for about 15 times longer than if you weren't wearing it. This means that if you would normally burn after 10 minutes in the sun, then you would be protected for 150 minutes (or almost three hours). 3) The higher the number, the better. SPF 60 is much more effective than SPF 30. 4) To get maximum benefit, apply the sunscreen at least 30 minutes before going out into the sun, and reapply every 2-3 hours.

Patient query: Hello doctor,I am 32 years old and I am going to get married after two months. I am doing masturbation rubbing penis in bed for many years. Will this affect my sexual life after marriage? Can it lead to erectile dysfunction and other issues?
Doctor response: 1) Masturbation is not considered as bad habit by doctors but it can be harmful if done excessively.2) It has no effect on your marriage or sexual life.3) Erectile dysfunction is common in men with age, and it may occur due to stress, anxiety, depression etc.4) Doing exercise regularly will help in improving your health and also sex life.5) You should avoid smoking and alcohol because they have adverse effects on your health.6) Avoid stress and tension.7) Take healthy diet like green leafy vegetables, fruits, salads, sprouts etc.8) Consult psychiatrist once for counseling.

Patient query: Hello doctor,Positive ANA, weak positive Smith through childhood or teens. Monitored for lupus by pediatric rheumatologist but never really exhibited symptoms. I have abnormal beta 2 glycoprotein that puts me at risk for blood clots. Was told in high school to take Baby Aspirin every day. I am now 28.Recently had full lab tests done for the first time in many years. Platelet count: 402 (had physical labs done three years ago and it was 432), protein: 8.9, ABS lymphocytes: 3.2. I went back to look through all my labs from my teenage years from a rheumatologist. I saw and I never had high protein. Also, my platelets were usually normal so I think the elevated thing is more recent? But it has gone down from 423 three years ago.I show no active signs and lupus and never truly did. I was always just monitored. I have a copper IUD and occasionally take my Aspirin. When I take it often, I bruise super easily. Just concerned mainly about the protein level. I have read about leukemia and other blood cancers. I was fasting for more than 12 hours and drank no water (I hardly ever do). All other labs are normal in the metabolic panel and CBC with auto diff.
Doctor response: 1. The protein level of 8.9 is slightly higher than normal. It may be due to increased muscle mass or liver disease. It should be repeated after a few weeks to see if it increases further. 2. Increased Beta-2 GPS is not an indication for aspirin per se. However, since you are young and healthy, you could continue taking it as a prophylaxis against heart attack.3. Leukemia is unlikely because your other parameters are within normal limits.

Patient query: Hello doctor,I have a spot on inside vagina. Please help.
Doctor response: 1) It is best if you show this to your gynecologist for a physical examination and evaluation.2) This could be a pimple or boil that has been there for some time.3) There is no need to worry about it unless it starts to bleed.4) You can apply antibiotic cream such as clindamycin over the area and take an oral antibiotic like Doxycycline twice daily for a week.5) If it does not improve then you might need a course of antibiotics by injection. Hope I have answered your query. Let me know if I can assist you further.

Patient query: Hello doctor,My baby just turned 6 months. I gave him Nan Optipro One for his 1st to 6 months, now I gave him the follow up milk which is Nan Optipro Two. After two days of drinking, he is suddenly having diarrhea now (five times a day). I tried reaching out for a pediatrician in our area but they are not accepting the appointments. He is also irritated because of his blooming teeth and he is eating oatmeal with banana puree. I wanted to ask if it is just his tummy adjusting or is there any underlying problem?
Doctor response: Hi dear, I understand your concern. Diarrhea is common in infants and kids during the first year of life. It is usually due to viral infection. The cause for diarrhea can be many like change of feeds, improper hygiene etc. In your case, your kid might have developed food poisoning because of some contaminated food or water. You should give ORS as per instructions and keep him HY Chat Doctor.  If symptoms persist then consult nearby pediatrician. Hope this helps. Take care.

Patient query: Hello doctor,I have disc desiccation. There is a pain in my right leg while walking.
Doctor response: 1) Disc degeneration can lead to nerve compression and it can cause pain.2) Degenerative changes of the spine can result in back pain and numbness in your legs.3) You need to get an MRI done for further management.4) You should take rest as much as possible.5) Physiotherapy like TENS therapy will help to reduce pain and inflammation.6) You may require analgesics and muscle relaxants.7) You can discuss with your treating Doctor about these.

Patient query: Hi doctor,We have a regular contraceptive pill and an emergency contraceptive pill. I-pill is an emergency contraceptive pill. What is the difference between them? Which one is taken after unprotected sex to avoid pregnancy?
Doctor response: 1. Emergency pills are used when you had unprotected sexual intercourse or if your birth control method fails(in this case it can be used as a regular method). They contain high doses of hormone which prevent ovulation and fertilization.2. Regular pills are used regularly for birth control. They contain lower doses of hormones which prevent ovulation and also thicken cervical mucus thus preventing sperm penetration into uterine cavity.3. The difference is that the emergency pill contains higher dosage of hormones and has to be taken within 72 hours of unprotected intercourse while the regular pill requires to be taken every day at same time.

Patient query: Hello doctor,Diffusion-weighted images, ADC maps, and postcontrast sequences were also performed.Findings:There is mild cerebral volume loss and ex vacuo dilatation of ventricular system. There are scattered punctate foci of increased signal intensity within the periventricular and deep subcortical white matter on the T2/flair sequences which are nonspecific. However, they are most likely secondary to chronic small vessel disease. There is no evidence of restricted diffusion to suggest an acute infarct, midline shift or mass effect. There are no blood products on the gradient-echo images.Normal intracranial flow-voids are seen.The visualized paranasal sinuses are clear.There is no pathologic enhancement identified.Degenerative changes are noted within the upper cervical spine.Impression:1. No acute intracranial process.2. Mild cerebral atrophy and mild chronic small vessel disease.3. No pathologic enhancement identified.What should I do and how concerned should I be? I am 70 years old and my BP and cholesterol are controlled. How concerned should I be?
Doctor response: Thank you for asking Chat Doctor. I have gone through your question and understand your concerns. These findings indicate age related degenerative changes in brain. The best way to prevent these changes is keeping blood pressure under control and avoiding smoking if you are a smoker. You can discuss with your neurologist about it. Hope this answers your question. If you have additional questions or follow-up questions then please do not hesitate in writing to us. I will be happy to answer your questions. Wishing you good health.

Patient query: Hi doctor,My period is a little late, just only a day. But, I have been having many pregnancy symptoms. I masturbated yesterday (penetration and clitoral stimulation to orgasm) and a considerable amount of blood came out. Some blood flushed itself out for some time and I am clear now. What does this mean? Before, I was worried that I was pregnant, but that blood was too much to be spotted from implantation I think. Was it period blood as I masturbated roughly? I had a bit of cramping today.
Doctor response: 1. No need to worry about your pregnancy.2. The bleeding occurred after masturbation could be due to hormonal imbalance or stress.3. There is no chance of pregnancy because of single ejaculation with penetrative sex.4. Please wait for your periods to come.5. If they don't come within few days, then get Beta Chat Doctor test done to confirm the pregnancy status.6. Take healthy diet and sleep properly.

Patient query: Hello doctor,So I never had acne on the back, maybe one or two single, but after visiting this massage center, which I know was a big mistake, my lower back is full of acne. I tried a couple of ointments, did not work. Cortisone helped a little, but not really. I think I need oral back up, any suggestions?
Doctor response: Hi...if your back has developed acnes and if they are small in size then oral antibiotics like doxycycline or minocycline can be started. But if the lesions are big in size and have spread all over the back then it will require a course of oral steroids for better control. But before starting treatment you should get blood investigations done to rule out any other cause responsible for the acne like hormonal imbalance etc.

Patient query: Hello doctor,55 years old male with complaint of ptosis on the right eye having diabetes for the past 10 to 12 years. FBS yesterday taken was 165 mg/dl. Ocular movement normal on left side but adduction limited in affected side. He is suspected to have third nerve palsy. What all medical intervention can be possible to get normal?
Doctor response: 3rd nerve palsy is a rare condition and usually due to compression at the level of brain stem or cervical spine. You need to consult an ophthalmologist who will examine your eyes and may refer you to neurosurgeon if it is thought that there is a problem in the brainstem or cervical spine. If there is no such problem then you should continue to take your blood sugar under control as per the advice from your physician.

Patient query: Hi,My age is 29 years. Yesterday I drank ice cold water in the afternoon. Since today morning I am feeling pain in the throat, body pain and laziness. Please suggest medicine for the same.
Doctor response: 1) You could have gotten a sore throat from the cold water you had yesterday.2) You can take paracetamol or ibuprofen for the pain if it is not too severe.3) If the pain is persistent, you should consult your family physician to get examined and get some antibiotics prescribed.4) For the symptoms of laziness, you may try taking some multivitamin supplements like vitamin B complex. Hope this helps.

Patient query: Hi doctor,I am having my Mirena IUD removed today. I have had regular cycles the entire five years of having it. How soon can I conceive?
Doctor response: Hi, Thanks for writing to us. In fact, after removal of the Mirena IUD, there will be no obstruction or hormonal imbalance in your body and hence conception may occur as early as within 4-6 months of its removal. However, as you are planning to get pregnant, you should start taking folic acid supplements at least three months prior to conception. This helps in prevention of neural tube defects in the baby. Hope this helps. Regards.

Patient query: Hi doctor,I am a 25 year old woman. I like my skin tone very much. But, I have pigmented skin. I see a lot of discoloration in my face, near my eyes and near mouth. I have consulted a dermatologist and he recommended Vichy cream overnight, which helped me a lot in getting an even skin. But, the wrinkles around my eyes are still there, which make me look aged. Patient query: Hi doctor,My mom is 83 years old. She had a bad fall 1.5 years ago and suffered with a head injury with little internal bleeding and a broken arm. While in hospital, she contracted C.diff and has had several recurring bouts with it. She has had a transplant and so far she is doing well with no recurrence. She also has a fistula near the rectum from an abscess. They put in a tube to keep it open and flowing. She has always had bouts of constipation and diarrhea for years before the accident. Her cognitive functions have been diminishing. One of my brothers is living with her and care taking her for full time.She is very weak, but can walk with the aid of a walker. Before the accident, she was fine. But, she may have shown a few signs of slight memory issues and balance prior to the accident as well. Our main issue right now is loose stools with some fecal incontinence. The doctor said that the fecal incontinence is because of a weak rectum that will not hold back fecal matter. Also, the fistula is always draining. When her stools are normal, she has good energy and cognitive function. When she has loose stools, she is very weak and can hardly stand or walk. Her cognitive function is a lot worse. She gets very confused about daily items and memory issues.We are looking for supplements to keep her regular and avoid the loose stool episodes. These are recurring every other week. Being so weak at the time of an episode, the toilet and the surrounding area get very filthy. She has little control and not able to clean herself properly. Her diet is pretty good. We are trying to keep dairy items away, limiting sugar and some carbohydrates as best as we can.We are giving her Metamucil when she has loose stools as well as some ammonium. This seems to have very limited success. She is on a blood pressure medicine as well as on Coumadin. So, we have to watch for interactions between everything. Regarding supplements, right now she is taking Alpha-GPC, Prevagen and multivitamins B for cognitive help, Fish oil, turmeric and Centrum multivitamins.Any help or suggestions to prevent the loose stools without creating constipation would be appreciated. I would also like to increase her core energy, so she will feel more like moving around. We have a physical therapist at once a week.
Doctor response: Hi, Thanks for writing in. It is possible that your mother is suffering from Dementia and this is causing her confusion, forgetfulness, poor balance etc. It might be better if you consult a Neurologist who can examine her and do necessary tests like MRI brain scan to rule out any neurological condition. I hope this information has been both informative and helpful for you. You can consult me again directly through my profile URL http://bit.ly/ Chat Doctor.

Patient query: Respected doctor,My father is suffering from a chronic liver disease. I have attached his case summary with this query. He is in the ICU for the last four days. As per the doctor, my father may remain in this state for an indefinite period of time because his liver is not functioning. So, I want to get a second opinion and want to know, whether there is a way to revive his liver and make it function properly.
Doctor response: 1) In your fathers case, he has developed severe acute liver failure which is a very serious condition. Unless his bilirubin levels come down and his enzymes and INR levels become normal, he will need intensive care support.2) The only way to improve or reverse liver damage in such cases is by liver transplantation.3) However, that can be done only in centers where there is adequate expertise in performing liver transplants and they are equipped with necessary facilities.4) You do need to consult a hepatologist who can guide you further about the possibility of getting him treated in India as well as abroad if need be.

Patient query: Hi doctor,I am on Depot injection and I missed the shot for over 10 days now. I have not started bleeding yet. When I was on the shot before, I bled when I get off the shot. Now, how would I know if I am pregnant?
Doctor response: 1. You got your last period on 28/9, so the due date of the next period is 23/11. So, if you miss this period, then you should take a urine pregnancy test with first morning sample. It is positive in case of pregnancy.2. Do a blood beta-ChatDoctor test to confirm the pregnancy. This test will be positive only after 6 weeks of conception.3. In case of doubt, you can go for an ultrasound scan at 7 weeks of gestation to see the fetal heart beat.4. The other possibility is that you may be having breakthrough bleeds or spotting during the active phase of the cycle. In such cases, the chance of pregnancy is very low.5. In any case, you need to consult your gynecologist.

Patient query: Hello doctor,My partner and I had sex two months back. She got her period that month but she missed her period for this month. She took an I-pill after we had sex. Could this be her pregnancy? Please help.
Doctor response: 1) I pill is contraceptive pill which prevents ovulation and implantation of fertilized egg in uterus.2) It can prevent pregnancy if taken within 72 hours of unprotected sex.3) In your case it was taken after 48 hrs of sex so it will not work.4) Missed periods may occur due to stress, change in diet, oral contraceptives etc.5) You should wait for one week before consulting gynecologist.6) Consult gynecologist for pelvic examination and ultrasound to rule out pregnancy.7) If pregnancy is confirmed then abortion can be done by medicines under the guidance of gynecologists.

Patient query: Hello doctor,I have a lot of black spots on my face and upper back due to the popping of pimples. To where it is darkening my skin making me uncomfortable with myself. I have been clueless about the medication I should use that would help my situation.

They are more likely post inflammatory hyperpigmentation due to the acne lesions. You need to take oral antibiotics for at least 6 months along with topical steroids/retinoids/benzoyl peroxide containing creams. Please consult a dermatologist for further advice. Hope this helps. Patient query: Hello doctor,I am pregnant for one month. I got to know it when I missed my periods on a fourth of date. I had sex with my husband after an eighth of date. Then I did the pregnancy test 3 to 4 times and it was positive. Then I tried natural abortion methods like having food for natural abortion but it did not work. It was 4 to 5 days for it now. But you must do the blood tests for complete hormone profile and ultrasound to rule out any complications.2. The abortion pills should be used under medical supervision.3. The abortion pills will lead to incomplete abortion in most cases. Incomplete abortions may require surgical intervention and hence you must consult your gynecologist before taking the pills.

Patient query: Hello doctor,I have an unstable sacroiliac joint that gives me pain, which is relieved by adjustment for a few days. There is no effective stretching exercises for Sacroiliac joint.3. The best thing to do would be to avoid movements that increase the pain and try to maintain as much flexibility and strength as possible without causing more pain. Hope I have answered your query. Let me know if I can assist you further.

Hope this answers your question. Please feel free to ask if you have any further doubts.

Patient query: Hello doctor,I just want to consult about my skin condition that happens annually. Every year, my hands has this condition where it will itch and form rashes with liquid inside then skin itself. Most of the time, it starts on December then end on February, however it differs every year. This year it started on March and up to now. It is there for the past 11 years. I have never consulted any professionals about it since it does not look severe. However, I am curious what is this condition called.
Doctor response: Hi, thanks for posting your query at Chat Doctor. You seem to be suffering from the condition known as winter itchy dermatitis or hand eczema. This occurs during winter when the temperature falls and becomes very cold. The exact cause is not known but it could be due to changes in environment like low humidity, increased use of central heating etc. The symptoms include redness, swelling, itching, blister formation, pain and scaling. Moisturizers, emollients and topical steroid cream can help reduce itching and inflammation. You may also require oral antihistamines if required. Hope this answers your question. Regards.

Patient query: Hi doctor,My partner had phlegm with blood just now without coughing. He does not have chest pain and a fast heartbeat. Before a day, he also had a headache and hot temperature. Yesterday, he poked his nose with his finger at night. This morning, he had phlegm coming with a portion of blood. Does it require medical attention? Does spitting phlegm with blood is an alarming one? Please suggest.
Doctor response: 1) No, bleeding from nose or throat is not usually an emergency unless there is significant bleeding that can not be controlled.2) Bleeding from the lungs (pneumothorax) may cause symptoms like shortness of breath, difficulty breathing, chest pain, coughing up blood, etc.3) Phlegm (mucus) in the throat and/or nose is common and not always an indication for medical evaluation.4) A fever that comes and goes could be due to many causes including viral upper respiratory tract infection, bacterial sinusitis, etc.5) It would be good if you could describe your partners symptoms more precisely such as how much blood was in the mucus, what color was the bloody mucus, did they feel dizzy, nauseated, vomit, etc.6) You should discuss these symptoms with your primary

Patient query: Hello doctor,I am 47 today. I went to my primary doctor three years ago with low libido and poor quality erections. Blood work came back as total testosterone 381 and A1c 6.9. Started exercising and lost weight and inches, 198 lbs to 178, 38-inch waist to 32. Symptoms still persisted. The doctor started me on Clomid 50 mg three times per week.Testosterone shot up to 900\s but symptoms persisted although Cialis helped with erection quality, still low libido. Will attach a note with test and A1c results during this time. So, I stopped taking the Clomid in March this year and had my physical last week.The doctor says my testosterone is 570, A1c is 6.0 and everything else looks good. He says since I still have symptoms, that I have testosterone resistance. His analogy was; like diabetics, their bodies produce insulin but just does not know what to do with it.So, his treatment recommendation is TRT testosterone replacement therapy along with Clomid. I am hesitant because I feel this therapy is overused nowadays, and I feel pretty good except my libido.Sought a second opinion today from my urologist, he seemed disinterested in me doing that but said if I try a few injections it would not hurt me, then advised me to run this by an endocrinologist.So I guess in summary:Do you believe that testosterone resistance is a valid diagnosis?If I do try the TRT, can I stop after a few weeks or a few injections and get back to the way I am right now with no permanent issues?Should I just start the Clomid again, or just keep using the Cialis and keep working out and trying to clean up my diet more?Any other thoughts and advise would be appreciated. Thanks.
Doctor response: Hi, Thanks for writing in. Testosterone resistance is a real entity and many patients who present to me with such complaints. I would suggest you to go ahead with the testosterone replacement therapy and see how it works. You need to take tablets of testosterone for about 3 months before deciding whether to continue or not. So wait and watch and then decide. As far as your current problems are concerned, if you are not having any other symptoms, you can continue with the medication you are currently using and exercise regularly.

Patient query: Hello doctor,My baby is 3.5 months old. In my house, they are saying to give urai marundhu is it safe to give? As my daughter is licking her fingers, my mom wants to keep castor oil or neem oil, is it safe to keep it on her finger?
Doctor response: 1) It is not recommended to use Urai Marudhu for babies as it contains high levels of lead and other heavy metals which can be harmful to your child.2) Castor oil/neem oil cannot be kept on the finger for long periods of time because it will cause irritation, redness, blisters etc. You should apply only small amounts at any given time.3) The best way to ensure that your child does not get exposed to these substances in the first place would be to avoid using them altogether. Hope this helps.

Patient query: Hello doctor, To start, I have bipolar disorder type II, social and generalized anxiety disorders. Previously, I failed to SSRI medications such as Zoloft, Prozac, Lexapro. I tried Lithium, Depakote, and Carbamazepine with no success. However currently, I take 50 mg of Lamictal and 75 mg Venlafaxine. In a few days we will increase Lamictal to 100 mg and after two weeks to 200 mg. I also take Tranxene 10 mg if needed, as well as Olanzapine 10 mg. How come I responded to Venlafaxine XR so fast, when I did not respond to SSRI? I lack energy and motivation, should I increase Venlafaxine XR to 150? If so, will it have more effects on my anxiety and depressive episode?
Doctor response: 1) Venlafaxine XR has not been studied in comparison to other antidepressants in clinical trials.2) Your response to venlafaxine XR could be due to your personal genetic makeup which may predispose you to its action or due to some other factors like dietary habits etc.3) You need to try out different types of medicines before deciding upon the one that suits you best.4) The dosage of lamotrigine can be increased gradually over a period of time depending on the dose-response relationship.5) There is no scientific evidence to support the use of higher doses of venlafaxine XR than what is prescribed by your doctor. Hope this helps

Patient query: Hi doctor,One year back, while sitting on a chair in office I felt as if my back got stuck and was unable to move. I took two painkillers and managed to sit there for a while, but after two to three hours the pain started radiating to leg. I was diagnosed with moderate disc herniation at L4-L5 and L5-S1. I was advised to take bed rest for three months and felt better after five months. Then I got some manipulation done with my lower back and my condition got worse. After that I had slight pain in my tail bone while walking and the pain got worse when I sit for five minutes. It got radiated to hips, thighs and it was worse when I stood up from a sitting position. Then I left with no option except bed rest for another four months that is a total nine months of bed rest. After that I suddenly started walking two to three hours a day in a stretch and started doing some exercises. After few days of getting my body too much into motion I felt my upper back getting stuck and again was unable to move and the pain radiated to my wrist and hand. Then had bed rest for another 10 days and felt a bit better. But, still in pain and resumed with two to three hours of brisk walking and exercises. I noticed that many joints in my body were making cracking sound while I walk or move my body and they were continuous. They are not going away no matter how much I move that joint, the cracking sound will repeat infinite times whenever I move my body. The cracking sound is mostly from lower and upper back, shoulder, ankle, foot fingers, knees also make that cracking sound and it is painful as well. Cracking sound in knees are felt more when I start walking after being in rest state and frequency of cracking sound reduces after walking for two to three minutes.I got my ESR and CRP checked. They are normal, but there is a slight increase in lymphocytes and RBC. Now, I have been suffering from this continuous cracking sounds and pain in almost all my joints for more than a month now. I also suffer from severe pain in tail bone area. Also suffers from some sensation loss (not persistent) in left side of my upper left leg, pain in groin area (but not anymore), pain in lower back and upper back. Also a few days back a physiotherapist did some manipulation, which again increased my problem and after that when I wake up in morning both my hands are badly at asleep. Doctors say that discs are hydrated and it is rather some other thing which is causing me problems but are unable to diagnose. The amount of rest I have taken and all those manipulations have gone through have only done badly rather than doing any good. I am only 27 years old and unable to do simple tasks like sitting for five minutes. Please help me, what could be the possible reason for all this.I had some back pain three years ago. My lifestyle is also not good. I do not used to any exercise or walk earlier, only sitting on a chair in front of a computer for 10-11 hours. I have also gained weight of 15 kg in 10 months. Right now, I am taking only Vitamin D3 supplement. I am attaching all my reports for your reference.
Doctor response: Hi, Thanks for writing to Chat Doctor. I have read your case and can understand your concern. As you mentioned, you have undergone treatment for disc prolapse at L4/5 and L5/S1 levels. You have been prescribed bed rest for 9 months. But even after that, you have not recovered completely. This suggests that you may need some additional treatment like physical therapy. You said that you had pain in tailbone area. This is suggestive of nerve compression at sacral level. So, I would advise you to get an MRI scan to rule out any such pathology. In addition, you should also visit an orthopedic surgeon who can examine you and treat you accordingly. Hope this helps.

Patient query: Hello doctor,I concern that I have angle-closure glaucoma. I took a strong sleeping pill called Trazodone one night and woke up with a decreased vision in the right eye. However, an OCT showed nerve fiber thinning and ganglion cell thinning.
Doctor response: 1) You need to get your blood pressure checked regularly because it is important for angle closure glaucoma.2) The visual field test will tell us whether you have any damage to your optic nerves or not.3) You should start using eyedrops once daily before going to bed.4) You may be having chronic angle closure glaucoma which needs lifelong treatment.5) Your ophthalmologist will also take into consideration the severity of glaucoma while deciding how much medication to prescribe.

Patient query: Hello doctor,A couple of my adult teeth feel loose. My gums are sore and bleed randomly as well as when I brush. Do I have gum disease?
Doctor response: Hi welcome to Chat Doctor forum.  Thanks for your query.  The symptoms you mention in your post can be due to gum inflammation or periodontal problems. Patient query: Hi doctor.I had Pantocid HP after doctor advice and had loose motion 4-5 times. For stopping loose motion what shall I do? For past six days I am taking Pantocid HP kit. Patient query: Hello doctor,Something broke off from one of my teeth, and I would like to know what was it that broke and what I should do about it (if anything). I think it might have been tartar or cementum, but I do not know. They are hard and off whitish (a little yellowing). They are the same as that material that appears roughly along the bottom edges of my lower incisors. I think they are either tartar or cementum, but I do not know. Please let me know what you think they are and what my options are.
Doctor response: Hi Dear, Welcome to Chat Doctor forum. As you describe your problem is either Tartar or Cementum. Cementum is calcified substance over root of tooth. It is part of periodontal ligament connecting tooth with alveolar bone. If it gets loosened then it may be Tartar. In both case it can be removed by scaling. But if you are having pain associated with it then consult dentist for further treatment. Hope this may help you. Contact us if you need any more clarification. Wishing you good health.

But since then, I have been noticing a slight burning sensation after passing urine, especially during morning and afternoon hours. Today, there is a slight pain in the penis. You can use sterile water to clean your penis and apply an anti-itch cream like HY Chat Doctor. 3. You should avoid sexual activities till you get rid of all symptoms. 4. This could be due to the infection caused by the broken condom or the semen.

Patient query: Hello doctor,I suffer from bipolar 2 disorder as well as OCD and social anxiety disorder. I have tried almost all SSRIs, and SNRIs and neither of them have worked for me (for the last 2 1/2 years). I believe that I have treatment-resistant depression because all the medicines are not working. Currently, I am taking 20 mg of Paroxetine (although I already took 40 mg a few months ago, so I already increased the dose as well), 900 mg of Lithium and 1.5 mg of Risperidone. What should I do?
Doctor response: 300mg risperidone is a good dose for your condition. It may take some time before it starts to work. But the risk of side effects is also less in this dosage. Please discuss with your psychiatrist about increasing the dose. The reason why SSRI or SNRI did not work could be due to the fact that they are not specific enough for your condition. You need to try other medications like atypical antipsychotics, benzodiazepines etc. which can help more in your condition. I hope this helps you.

Patient query: Hi doctor,I am a 30-year-old woman. I am having OCD since I was 12 years old. I just realized these things now so I started to confront my fears about what the psychiatrist said to me. But I ran into another one which is about what if my mother is right and if I am confronting my fears it is going to get worse. What do you think?
Doctor response: Hi, Welcome to Chat Doctor forum. It seems that you are suffering from obsessive compulsive disorder (OCD) which is characterized by recurrent thoughts, ideas or impulses which are intrusive and unwanted. You need to consult a psychiatrist for proper treatment. You can take fluoxetine and paroxetine both are effective in OCD. In addition, you may also require cognitive behavioral therapy (CBT). Hope this helps. Take care.

Patient query: Hello doctor,I was diagnosed with a left branch bundle block a few years back. I have been under the care of a cardiologist to make sure my heart is fine since then. I have done stress echos yearly or every two years since and have been told my heart is otherwise fine. I just had to switch the other doctor because of insurance and my new doctor says old stress echos are irrelevant, that only chemical or nuclear echos work in patients with lbbb. Is this true? I have a strong family history of heart disease, my father survived two heart attacks, mother survived double bypass and my maternal uncle died from a heart attack, all were smokers with high cholesterol and high blood pressure. I am a former smoker. I am a 43-year-old female. I have been exercising six days per week for over 20 years. My cholesterol is high 213 but HDL is 140 and triglycerides are low. I am a little put off by a nuclear stress echo and would prefer the regular exercise. But I want to know what this new doctor says is true? Then I guess I will have to go nuclear. I am currently taking Spironolactone 100 mg for acne, Omeprazole, and multivitamins. I just had an ultrasound of heart and EKG past monday. Doctor did not mention anything other than lbbb that was previously diagnosed.
Doctor response: Hi, I read your question carefully and understand your concern. The first thing I should mention is that your doctor is right about the need for nuclear stress test. The reason is that it can detect better any abnormality in the heart function which may be missed in the routine echo. On the other hand, the regular echo is still needed as a screening tool to exclude possible heart valve problems. As far as the family history is concerned, it does increase the risk of coronary artery disease. You should try to control your cholesterol levels and blood pressure as much as possible. In addition, I recommend having an annual physical check up including a resting ECG and lipid profile. Hope to have been helpful. Let me know if I can assist you further. Kind regards,

Patient query: Hi doctor,I had a c-section with my first pregnancy 19 years ago. I have fallen in love with a wonderful man who does not have kids. I and my fiance have been discussing and are planning to have a baby. I am concerned if I am able to have a VBAC delivery with my second pregnancy since my first pregnancy resulted in an emergency C-section. Also, I am 48. What are the risks of pregnancy in women over 40?
Doctor response: Thank you for posting your query at Chat Doctor. I read carefully through your question and understand your concern. Pregnancy after cesarean section is safe and possible. However, there is a risk of uterine rupture which can be prevented by using a vaginal birth after cesarean (VBAC) protocol. This includes cervical ripening with prostaglandin gel, monitoring of contractions and fetal heart rate and close observation of the uterus during labor. The risk of uterine rupture is about 2% or less. It is important that you find a doctor experienced in VBAC delivery. You should also consider having a repeat cesarean delivery if you develop problems during labor such as high blood pressure or fever. Age alone does not increase the risk of complications during pregnancy. At age 48, you will probably need more frequent ultrasounds and tests because of the advanced maternal

I have a mild fever that goes to high fever as the time passes. There is malaise. I have vomiting often after I swallow. It is like a viscous sputum that blocks food from entering into the food canal. This time, I have swollen lymph nodes in my neck. The doctor examined me and told me there is no tonsillitis. Patient query: Hello doctor,My wife has lung cancer PD-L1. I need your advice regarding the continuation of this therapy. Docetaxel and Nintedanib are suggested. I think it is too heavy. I would prefer immunotherapy, if possible.
Doctor response: In the treatment of lung cancer, immunotherapy is not yet approved by FDA for being used as a first line treatment. The only available immunotherapies for lung cancer are nivolumab and pembrolizumab which are both approved by FDA. They are used in patients with advanced non-small cell lung cancer (NSCLC) who have progressed after platinum-based chemotherapy and targeted therapy (tyrosine kinase inhibitors). These treatments may also be given to people whose cancer has worsened after surgery or radiation therapy. These medicines are usually used in combination with another type of medicine called an antiangiogenic (such as cediranib). There is very limited evidence that any of these treatments will help slow down the spread of the disease.

Patient query: Hi doctor,I have had a terrible cough for weeks due to the flu. I decided to try Delsym 12 hour cough. It helped immensely, but the second day when I had it, I noticed a bit of restlessness and light sensitivity. I waited to take another dose and when I did take another dose, I took half of the recommended dose for adults. That was at 10 pm last night. Now, at almost 2 pm the next day and I am experiencing odd side effects. Sweaty palms, a bit of confusion, loss of attention, and light sensitivity. It feels like my eyes are dilated, but does not appear they are. Every day I take 20 mg of Vyvanse and 300 mg of Wellbutrin.
Doctor response: 1) As per your query this is a combination of dextromethorphan HBr and guaifenesin. Dextromethorphan HBr is a cough suppressant that affects certain natural substances in the body which causes cough reflex. Guaiphenesin is a cough expectorant. This means that these medicines may help reduce how much you cough by causing less secretions. But this also means that these medicines won't help loosen phlegm or mucus so easily as many other medications would.2) The symptoms of sweating palms, blurred vision, confusion etc. can be due to over dosage of Chat Doctor. 3) You should consult your Physician for further treatment. Hope I have answered your query. Let me know if I can assist you further.

Patient query: Hello doctor, For ten years, my husband has been successfully using an extended wear bandage contact lens (monthly wear) to control the pain of aphakic bullous keratopathy in one eye. About seven months ago, he had an episode of foreign body pain in the eye which the contact lens could not control. His optometrist changed the type of lens after remarking that the lens appeared tight. Although the painful sensations have decreased, they are still present with more of a sore feeling now. His ophthalmologist suggested that he discontinue the Azopt drops he had been using in case the preservative was causing some corneal toxicity. His eye pressure without the drops has read at 18 and 20 on separate occasions, but he does have corneal edema which may affect the measurement. He has had high pressure in that eye previously, but it was mostly lowered by Cyclodiode treatment some eight years ago. The consultant said he had left him on the Azopt drops just as a precaution. My query is that if the bandage lens has worked so well for pain management for 10 years is it possible that it can continue to work? And if the Azopt drops and their preservative had caused some toxic reaction seven months ago, could that still be causing him to feel the discomfort? His consultant suggested out that he could have the eye removed to control the pain, but as he has what he feels is some slight, useful vision in that eye, he does not want to take such a drastic and life-changing step. In fact, he wants to pursue the least invasive course of action to relieve the pain he is getting. I would appreciate any advice you could give as he is in quite a bit of pain.
Doctor response: 1. The idea of removing the eye because of pain is not a good option. It is better to try other options first.2. Contact lenses are very helpful in controlling pain associated with bullous keratopathy.3. The cornea becomes thickened and fibrotic due to the disease process. This makes the contact lenses less effective at controlling pain.4. There are other types of contact lenses available that might not cause irritation like the ones he currently uses.5. There also are medicated lubricating eye drops that may help reduce the discomfort.6. The eye pressure should be monitored regularly.7. The best way to treat this is to see his ophthalmologist and discuss the different options that are available. Hope this helps.

Patient query: Hello doctor,I have an anal fissure. I am taking homeopathy for the past 25 days. It worked for the first 20 days, but for the past five days, my pain has increased significantly. Is it homeopathy aggravation or something else?
Doctor response: 1) If you have taken homeopathic treatment for about 25 days and your symptoms improved for about 20 days then you should not worry about the fact that your symptoms are worsening now as this could be due to aggravation of the symptoms which is common in case of homeopathic medicines. 2) You can continue with the same medicine for another 15-20 days more and if symptoms still don't improve then you need to consult a physician or surgeon who would examine you and prescribe appropriate treatment.

Patient query: Hello doctor,I am 30 years old male with HTN (Telmisartan 49 mg and CTD 6.25 mg) for past six years with a body weight of 80 kg. For some days I have noticed froth in urine and facial puffiness. I want your suggestion. My RFT was normal but I have not checked my urine for protein or USG abdomen. Can you please guide me regarding further management?
Doctor response: 1st thing is to find out if it is significant proteinuria or microalbuminuria. You can check that by doing an early morning sample of urine which will show any albumin present in the urine. If there is no proteinuria then we need to rule out other causes like heart failure, liver disease, etc. As you are taking blood pressure medications, get your kidney function tests done as well. You may also need to get your urine culture tested. Avoid fatty foods and take healthy diet.

Patient query: Hello doctor,Diagnosed with varicocele grade 2. I have a lot of queries. Can it be treated? Will varicocele affect my sexual life? Hope this answers your query.

Patient query: Hello doctor,I urinate a lot, almost 32 times a day. When I urinate and come back, after a while, I can feel some urine passes my urinary tract, and I have to urinate again. Can you prescribe some tablets?
Doctor response: 1st thing is not just urinating more than normal, but also passing small amount of urine every time you go to urinate. This is called as frequency of micturition or nocturia. Patient query: Hi doctor,The patient is oxygen dependent because of pleurodesis since 1 month. She is suffering from breathlessness after talc pleurodesis. She has metastatic breast cancer with distant spread to the lung and liver. There is residual pleural effusion along with bilateral lower lobe consolidation. Patient is currently on tablet Methylprednisolone 16 mg every day. Along with this, she is taking tablet Mucinac 600 mg daily thrice a day. Blood reports, current x-rays and CT scans are attached for your reference. His CT chest is suggestive of patchy areas of consolidation along with bilateral pleural effusion. Doctors are not sure about the reason for breathlessness. I need your valuable opinion to treat this breathlessness. Kindly help.
Doctor response: Hi, thanks for posting your query in Chat Doctor. I can understand your concern regarding his patients condition. As per your history, it appears that the patient is having malignant pleural effusions. The most common cause of pleural effusions is malignancy. In such cases, pleural effusion can be treated by pleural decortication (pleurectomy). It is a surgical procedure where pleura is removed partially or completely depending upon the size of the tumor. This is done under general anesthesia. After completion of surgery, the patient is put on antibiotics, anti-inflammatory medications and sometimes steroids. Hope this helps. Regards

Patient query: Hello doctor,I had a tetanus shot last year around June. I had another minor mishap on the road with a small injury (cleaned with antiseptic). Do I need another tetanus shot now?
Doctor response: 1) You should have received booster doses of tetanus toxoid every ten years starting from your initial dose.2) Since it has been over one year since you received your last dose and you have not received any other wound injections or immunization, no further boosters are necessary at this time.3) Your current situation is very similar to what would occur if you were getting regular booster doses of tetanus toxoid.4) Therefore, if you have not received a booster dose for more than 10 years, you can get one now.5) This will protect you for 10 years again.6) If you have any doubts, you can check with your treating physician to confirm that you are protected against tetanus.

Patient query: Hello doctor,Is hepatitis B transmitted by saliva? Hepatitis B virus is just detected in my body. My viral load is 1.5 * 10^5 count/mL. Is it possible for me to get totally cure for this disease? If it is possible how much time will it take to get totally cured?
Doctor response: 1.5 x 10^5/ml of HBV DNA is very low and not indicative of active disease. It may be due to past infection only.2. Yes, HBV can be transmitted through saliva.3. No one can predict the exact duration of recovery. But usually, people with a lower viral load recover faster than those who have higher viral load.4. You should continue your treatment as advised by your doctor. Hope I have answered your query. Let me know if I can assist you further.

Patient query: Hi doctor,I have just received results back from a blood test that says my red blood cell count is quite high. I am a 35-year-old female and I am a smoker (between 4 to 7 a day). I began to get headaches, dizzy spells, nausea, fatigue, and itchiness all over the past five weeks. I do not know whether or not a miscarriage could count towards what is going on or not but I would like to know what it is I should do. My doctor just said to quit smoking and come back in 12 weeks for another test.
Doctor response: Hi, Thanks for posting your query. Your symptoms are suggestive of anemia due to low RBC counts. It may be due to many reasons such as loss of blood, hemolysis, iron deficiency etc. You need to get a peripheral smear examination done to see if there is any abnormality seen. Also, your hematocrit values must be determined along with PCV(percentage of RBC volume) to assess the status of RBC. Please consult a physician for further evaluation. Hope this helps.

Patient query: Hello doctor,I want to know about piles. For the past two days, I am having little bit pain in the anus. I want to know if it is piles or not.
Doctor response: Hi, It is most likely that you have hemorrhoids or piles. They are swollen veins around the anus. You can see them as small lumps hanging out of your anus. The symptoms include pain and bleeding while passing stools. These are common symptoms for hemorrhoids. The other possible cause could be fissure in ano. This condition causes pain while passing stools. However, in this case there will not be any lump protruding outside. You need to consult a gastroenterologist who will examine you and may ask you to do some investigations like colonoscopy. Treatment includes dietary modifications and medicines. In severe cases surgery might be required. I hope this information was helpful. Thank you for choosing Chat Doctor.

Patient query: Hello doctor,I am writing for my daughter, staying away from us, with her husband. She is 30 years, 5 feet 1 inch and 63 kg, working in the IT sector. She is married for the last three years and seriously trying for conception from a year. She missed her period once in the beginning of this year. During her obstetrics consultation, beta hCG was done. It was repeated after two days. A transvaginal ultrasound scan was done and repeated after 10 days. The end result was diagnosed as a blighted ovum. So, it was evacuated by D and C.Our daughter is of normal build and nutrition. Her menstrual history was normal since the beginning in terms of cycle, duration, and flow. But, one month after D and C, she did not have her period. On the doctor's advice, she took some medicines and bleeding occurred. She was known hypothyroid. So, she was taking Thyroxin 50 or 75 to keep the TSH near about 2.5 Uiu/ml. Her Hb % and sugar are within the normal range.Again, she tried to conceive since three months ago along with Aspirin and folic acid. She missed her period last month. Her beta hCG was 9.20 mIu/ mL. It was repeated after two days. It came down to 1 Miu/ml suggestive of \chemical pregnancy\. This time, after a few days, a spontaneous jelly-like bleeding occurred for two days. I would like to add that her husband requires to take Penegra 50 mg tab before a performance. Our daughter is immunized with triple antigen, polio, MMR, chickenpox and hepatitis B vaccine in childhood. The transvaginal scan (done at a later phase of the first conception) showed normal anatomical and physiological pattern of the ovary and uterus to me at least (report attached).Two consecutive miscarriages brought great disappointment to all. Presently, the doctor told her to take Aspirin 150 mg, folic acid, and Vitamin B12 combination tablet and to try for pregnancy again. I want your valuable opinion regarding subsequent management or the right line of treatment and suggestions or tests (if any) to get a successful pregnancy and healthy baby.
Doctor response: Hi, Thanks for writing to Chat Doctor. Your daughter has gone through two chemical pregnancies, which means that there were no fetal heart beats detected in the ultrasonography scans. This can happen due to many reasons such as, unhealthy eggs, abnormal sperm, or problems with the embryo. I would advise her to undergo blood test for ovarian reserve and AMH level to determine if she has sufficient number of eggs left. Also, do a thyroid profile and prolactin levels. In case all these come out to be normal then I would suggest her to go ahead with IVF procedure. Hope this helps.

Doctor response: Hi, thanks for asking your query, As per your history, your symptoms could be due to chronic bronchitis, as you were having smoking habit so there might be possibility of developing Chronic Bronchitis, as well as you are also having cough with expectoration of blood. You will need to consult pulmonologist and get done clinical examination of respiratory system, PFT (Pulmonary Function Test) and chest x-ray. Clinical examination can give idea about presence of consolidation in lungs. PFT will give idea about severity of the disease. Chest x-ray will rule out any other associated condition like pneumonia etc. You may need antibiotic, antihistamine, decongestant, expectorant and anti-inflammatory Chat Doctor.. Patient query: Hi doctor,I am a 26 year old male. When I am with my friends (male), an image of kissing that friend pops into my head sometimes. Though I am not attracted to boys, what could be the reason for this? Please help.
Doctor response: 1) You are having homosexual feelings or fantasies but are not acting upon it.2) This is normal in many people and is usually not a problem if it doesn't interfere with your daily life.3) It's important to remember that these thoughts do not make you gay or bisexual.4) They may just be a phase that you are going through and will eventually pass.5) If they are causing you distress, then you should seek professional help from a psychologist, who can assist you in dealing with them. Hope this helps!

Patient query: Hello doctor,I feel as if I may have a neurodegenerative disease. My symptoms are as follows:More forgetful than normal.Battle to find the right words.I get very bad pains and pressure in my brain.When driving, I battle with judging my following distance.Please, could you provide any tests that I could take? If it is a neurodegenerative disease, what is the progression rate, that is, the timeline between each stage?
Doctor response: Hi, Thank you for asking question on Chat Doctor. The symptoms of your father are suggestive of mild cognitive impairment (MCI). In MCI there is decline in memory but not so severe that it can be termed dementia. There is no test which can diagnose MCI. But he should undergo few investigations like routine hologram, random blood sugar, ECG, ultrasound abdomen, liver function test, renal function test and thyroid profile. He should also consult psychiatrist for detailed evaluation.

Doctor response: 1) The MRI will show if there is any disc herniation or spinal canal stenosis. This is the most common cause of low back pain2) If there is no significant findings then it may be due to muscle strain3) In such case, your doctor should be able to give you some exercises which can help you4) If you have severe symptoms then an epidural steroid injection may be helpful5) However, it is important that you see a doctor as soon as possible so that we can rule out other causes of back pain

Patient query: Hello doctor,I fell off the bike. I took X-rays and the doctor is telling me that both elbows are broken. As a non-professional, I cannot see if it is really broken. I do not have any pain if I am not stretching the elbow too much. Are both elbows really broken? And if yes, do I have to wear the cast for 2 to 3 weeks?
Doctor response: 1) If the x-ray confirms fracture, then yes, it has to be in plaster for at least two to three weeks. 2) Non-professionals can only judge the appearance of the bones but not their integrity. In other words, they can only tell whether a bone looks broken or not. Only an expert can tell whether there is a fracture or not. So, if the X-ray shows a fracture, you will need to wear a cast for at least two to three weeks. Hope this helps!

Patient query: Hello doctor,I had a question about the ketone diet. I honestly do not understand the benefits of a ketone diet, what are they? Is a ketone diet good for those who are diabetic?
Doctor response: Hi, thanks for posting your query to Chat Doctor. Ketosis is a metabolic state where body uses fat as its main source of energy instead of carbohydrates. In this condition ketones are produced in liver which is excreted in urine. This happens when there is no glucose available in blood and body has to burn fats for energy. It is beneficial in some diseases like epilepsy and cancer. But as far as diabetics are concerned it is not recommended because it may worsen their control over blood sugar level.

Please visit the dentist, get a radiograph done to see the status of the tooth and take treatment accordingly. Hope this helps
